name: Affenpinscher
description: A small, loyal terrier-like toy dog known for its mischievous, monkey-like expression.
history_description: Originated in Germany as a ratter in homes and stables. Its name means 'monkey-like terrier'.
coat_description: Wiry, dense, and rough coat. Colors: Black, gray, silver, red, or beige.
temperament_description: Feisty, curious, and playful. Devoted to their family but can be dominant.
lifestyle_description: Good apartment dog, needs moderate daily walks. Requires regular grooming.
content: Known for their 'mustache' and 'beard', giving them a distinct, charming look.

name: Afghan Hound
description: An ancient sighthound known for its distinctive long, silky coat and unique ring curl at the end of the tail.
history_description: Originated in Afghanistan, used for hunting deer, wolves, and snow leopards in the mountains.
size_description: Large. Males: 58–66 pounds, 25–27 inches. Females: slightly smaller.
coat_description: Long, thick, and silky coat that requires intensive grooming. Any color is permissible.
temperament_description: Independent, aloof, and dignified. Can be challenging to train due to stubbornness.
lifestyle_description: Requires vigorous exercise (running). Not suited for apartment living due to high exercise needs.
activities_description: Lure coursing, racing, and endurance running.
content: Their regal appearance has made them a popular subject in art and fashion.

name: Africanis
description: The indigenous dog of Southern Africa, highly intelligent, healthy, and athletic.
history_description: Descended from ancient African dogs, they evolved through natural selection rather than selective breeding.
coat_description: Short, low-maintenance coat. Colors are variable.
temperament_description: Loyal, reserved, and protective. Extremely adaptable and hardy.
lifestyle_description: Thrives in a farm environment or a home with a large yard. Requires exercise.
content: They are a landrace breed, meaning they developed naturally over millennia in Africa.

name: Aidi
description: A large, robust Moroccan dog, primarily used to guard flocks against predators.
history_description: Native to the Atlas Mountains of Morocco, where it has served as a protector for centuries.
size_description: Large. Typically 50–55 cm tall and about 50–55 lbs.
coat_description: Thick, coarse, and weather-resistant coat, usually black, brown, or fawn.
temperament_description: Protective, brave, and territorial. Not suited as a house pet without extensive training.
lifestyle_description: Needs a purpose and a large area to roam and guard. Moderate exercise.
content: The Aidi is rarely found outside of Morocco and surrounding North African regions.

name: Airedale Terrier
description: The largest of the terriers, known as the 'King of Terriers.' Energetic and courageous.
history_description: Developed in the Aire Valley of Yorkshire, England, to catch otters and rats on the River Aire.
coat_description: Hard, dense, and wiry coat. Colors: Tan and black or grizzle saddle.
temperament_description: Intelligent, athletic, and strong-willed. Needs consistent training.
lifestyle_description: Requires vigorous daily exercise and mental stimulation. Not ideal for sedentary owners.
activities_description: Hunting, agility, police work, and utility trials.
content: They were used extensively in World War I for message carrying and guard duty.

name: Akbash
description: A large, ancient Turkish breed, primarily a livestock guardian dog.
history_description: Originating in Turkey, this breed has been used for hundreds of years to protect sheep and livestock.
coat_description: Double coat, either medium or long, always white or biscuit and white.
temperament_description: Calm, observant, and independent. Highly protective of its charges and territory.
lifestyle_description: Best suited for working on a farm or ranch. Requires a large, secure area.
content: The name 'Akbash' means 'white head' in Turkish.

name: Akita
description: A large and powerful Japanese breed with a dignified and courageous demeanor.
history_description: Originated in the Akita region of Japan, used for hunting bear and boar. Two types exist: Japanese and American.
size_description: Large. Males: 100–130 lbs, 26–28 inches. Females: 70–100 lbs, 24–26 inches.
coat_description: Thick double coat (similar to a Husky). Colors: Red, Fawn, Sesame, Brindle, White.
temperament_description: Courageous, highly loyal, and aloof with strangers. Can be aggressive towards other dogs.
lifestyle_description: Requires firm, consistent leadership. Needs moderate to high daily exercise.
content: Famous for the story of Hachikō, a dog that waited for his deceased master for nearly ten years.

name: Aksaray Malaklisi
description: A very large, powerful Turkish mastiff breed, one of the largest dog breeds in the world.
history_description: A native, giant mastiff breed from the Aksaray region of Turkey, primarily used for livestock guarding.
size_description: Giant. Can exceed 200 lbs and 30 inches tall.
coat_description: Short to medium coat, often fawn or brindle with a black mask.
temperament_description: Intelligent, courageous, and fiercely protective of its territory and flock.
lifestyle_description: Needs a vast amount of space and a working role. Not suited for urban life.
content: Distinguished by its large size and characteristic loose lips (malakli means 'with loose lips').

name: Alano Español
description: A large, muscular dog from Spain, traditionally used for cattle handling and hunting.
history_description: An ancient Spanish Mastiff type used for bull fighting (historically), hunting large game, and cattle work.
size_description: Large. Males: 75–88 lbs, 23–25 inches. Females: slightly smaller.
coat_description: Very short and dense coat. Colors: Brindle, Fawn, Black and Brindle, or Black.
temperament_description: Submissive to its owner, yet dominant and serious when working. Highly loyal.
lifestyle_description: Needs a job and substantial daily exercise. Best with experienced handlers.
activities_description: Cattle herding and management, and big game hunting.
content: The breed was nearly extinct but has been successfully revived since the 1980s.

name: Alapaha Blue Blood Bulldog
description: A sturdy, medium-sized bulldog-type dog, bred for guarding and companionship.
history_description: Developed in the U.S. (Georgia) by the late Lana Lou Lane to guard family properties.
size_description: Medium/Large. Males: 70–90 lbs, 18–24 inches. Females: slightly smaller.
coat_description: Short and stiff coat. Colors: Blue Merle, Brown Merle, solid white, or various patterns.
temperament_description: Protective, loving, and highly attached to its family. Reserved with strangers.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate exercise and early, extensive socialization to be a good family dog.
content: Known for its unique 'Blue Blood' lineage and distinctive facial mask.

name: Alaskan Husky
description: A high-performance sled dog, bred purely for speed, endurance, and working ability, not appearance.
history_description: A mixed breed landrace developed in Alaska from various Arctic dogs (like Siberian Husky, Malamute, Hound mixes) purely for competitive sled racing.
coat_description: Medium-length double coat, color and pattern highly variable.
temperament_description: High drive, friendly, and extremely energetic. Needs constant stimulation.
lifestyle_description: Requires tremendous daily exercise, primarily running. Not suitable as a typical pet.
content: The breed of choice for nearly all competitive Iditarod and Yukon Quest racers.

name: Alaskan Klee Kai
description: A smaller version of the Alaskan Husky/Siberian Husky, meaning 'little dog' in an Eskimo dialect.
history_description: Developed in the 1970s in Alaska to be a companion-sized replica of the Husky.
size_description: Small/Medium. Three sizes: Toy, Miniature, and Standard, ranging from 5–22 lbs.
coat_description: Thick, soft double coat, colors similar to the Siberian Husky.
temperament_description: Intelligent, curious, and sensitive. Can be very reserved with strangers.
lifestyle_description: Good apartment dog, but requires moderate daily activity and is prone to separation anxiety.
content: Maintains the same striking facial mask and markings as its larger relatives.

name: Alaskan Malamute
description: A large, powerful Arctic working dog, built for strength and endurance, hauling heavy freight.
history_description: An ancient breed originating with the Mahlemut Inuit tribe of Alaska, used for hauling heavy loads.
size_description: Large. Males: 85 lbs up, 25 inches. Females: 75 lbs up, 23 inches.
coat_description: Thick, coarse outer coat and a dense, oily undercoat. Colors: Gray and white, Black and white, Red and white.
temperament_description: Affectionate, friendly, and loyal, but highly independent. Can be stubborn and destructive if bored.
lifestyle_description: Needs very vigorous daily exercise and is prone to digging and escaping.
content: Malamutes are power-haulers, in contrast to Huskies, who are speed-racers.

name: Alopekis
description: An ancient, small, primitive Greek dog type, known for being hardy and versatile.
history_description: Native Greek dog breed, existing since ancient times. Traditionally used as a ratter and farm dog.
coat_description: Short, dense, and straight coat. Colors are varied.
temperament_description: Lively, alert, intelligent, and affectionate with family.
lifestyle_description: Good apartment dog, needs moderate daily walks.
content: The name 'Alopekis' means 'small fox-like dog' in Greek.

name: Alpine Dachsbracke
description: A small, sturdy scenthound from Austria, used for tracking wounded game.
history_description: Originated in Austria, used by hunters to track deer and wild boar in high mountainous terrain.
size_description: Small/Medium. Up to 20 kg, 34–42 cm tall.
coat_description: Short, dense coat. Colors: Dark deer-red with or without black ticking.
temperament_description: Brave, hardworking, and focused while tracking. Gentle and calm at home.
lifestyle_description: Needs a lot of tracking and scent work. Best suited for rural areas.
content: Known for its outstanding nose and ability to work in rugged conditions.

name: American Bulldog
description: A large, powerful, and athletic working dog, combining strength with agility.
history_description: Descended from the Old English Bulldog, retained by immigrants in the American South to work on farms (catching hogs/cattle).
size_description: Large. Males: 70–120 lbs, 20–28 inches. Females: slightly smaller.
coat_description: Short, smooth coat. Colors: White with patches of red, black, or brindle.
temperament_description: Confident, protective, and devoted to family. Requires early training and socialization.
lifestyle_description: Needs plenty of vigorous exercise and a job to do. Needs a secure yard.
activities_description: Weight pulling, protection sports, and farm work.
content: Known for being protective guardians and strong working dogs.

name: American Bully
description: A recently developed companion breed known for its compact, muscular build and friendly temperament.
history_description: Developed in the 1990s in the US, intentionally created from American Pit Bull Terriers and American Staffordshire Terriers with the addition of other bulldog breeds.
size_description: Medium/Large. Varies across four classes: Pocket, Standard, Classic, and XL.
coat_description: Short, close, and glossy coat. All colors and patterns are acceptable.
temperament_description: Extremely gentle, loyal, and friendly. Known for having a low prey drive and high tolerance for children.
lifestyle_description: Moderate daily exercise is sufficient. Good family companion.
content: Bred primarily for companionship and its 'bully' appearance, rather than working ability.

name: American Cocker Spaniel
description: The smallest member of the sporting group, known for its soft expression and long, feathered coat.
history_description: Developed in the U.S. from the English Cocker Spaniel, bred to be slightly smaller and with a rounder head.
size_description: Small/Medium. Males: 25–30 lbs, 14.5–15.5 inches. Females: 20–25 lbs, 13.5–14.5 inches.
coat_description: Long, silky, and heavily feathered coat. Colors: Black, ASCOB (Any Solid Color Other than Black), and Parti-color.
temperament_description: Gentle, happy, and eager to please. Excellent family companion.
lifestyle_description: Needs daily moderate exercise and extensive grooming.
content: Known for their beautiful, sorrowful eyes and perpetually wagging tail.

name: American English Coonhound
description: A fast, wide-ranging scenthound, known for its determination and musical baying voice.
history_description: Descended from English Foxhounds brought to America. Bred to hunt raccoons and foxes, specializing in long hunts.
coat_description: Hard, protective, and medium length coat. Colors: Red and White ticked (Redtick), Blue and White ticked (Bluetick), or Tricolor.
temperament_description: Enthusiastic hunter, but calm and friendly at home. Highly determined.
lifestyle_description: Needs a lot of vigorous exercise and a job for its nose. Best suited for rural areas.
activities_description: Coon hunting and organized trail hunting.
content: They are often called 'Redtick Coonhounds' when red markings predominate.

name: American Eskimo Dog
description: A Nordic-type companion dog known for its beautiful white coat and playful nature.
history_description: Descended from the German Spitz. Brought to America by German immigrants, and renamed after WWI.
size_description: Small/Medium. Three sizes: Toy, Miniature, and Standard (10-35 lbs).
coat_description: Thick, pure white double coat with a lion-like ruff. Sheds heavily.
temperament_description: Intelligent, lively, and highly trainable. Can be reserved with strangers and are good watchdogs.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate exercise and mental engagement. Good for apartment life if exercised.
content: Despite its name, the breed has no ties to Eskimo or Inuit culture.

name: American Foxhound
description: A tall, lean, and athletic scenthound, bred for long-distance running and hunting in packs.
history_description: Developed in the U.S. from English Foxhounds, bred by George Washington for hunting foxes.
coat_description: Short, hard, and dense coat. Any hound color is permissible.
temperament_description: Sweet, patient, and easy-going. Strong hunting instinct, can be independent.
lifestyle_description: Requires extreme amounts of exercise; needs to run for miles. Best in rural settings.
activities_description: Fox hunting and competitive field trials.
content: Considered a distinctly American breed, known for its melodic, musical voice.

name: American Hairless Terrier
description: A small to medium-sized, hairless terrier known for its playful and energetic disposition.
history_description: Developed in Louisiana, U.S., originating from a Rat Terrier with a natural hairless mutation.
coat_description: Hairless (smooth skin) or Coated variety. Skin color varies widely (pink, gray, black spots).
temperament_description: Friendly, curious, and protective. Highly energetic and playful.
lifestyle_description: Good apartment dog, needs moderate daily exercise. Hairless variety needs sun protection.
content: One of the few hairless breeds, making it a good choice for allergy sufferers.

name: American Leopard Hound
description: An all-purpose working dog, known for its spotted coat and treeing ability.
history_description: One of the oldest treeing dog breeds, used for hunting bear, bobcat, and raccoon in the U.S.
coat_description: Short to medium length, dense coat. Colors: Red, Blue, or Black Leopard (spotted), or Solid.
temperament_description: Strong hunting drive, but loyal and devoted to its family. Intelligent.
lifestyle_description: Requires extensive exercise and hunting work. Needs a large, fenced area.
content: Its distinctive spotted coat gives it the 'Leopard' name.

name: American Pit Bull Terrier
description: A strong, confident, and enthusiastic dog, originally bred for bull-baiting and later farm work.
history_description: Bred in 19th-century England and Ireland from Bulldogs and Terriers. Brought to the U.S. where they were used for catching hogs and companionship.
coat_description: Short, stiff, and glossy coat. All colors are permissible.
temperament_description: Confident, good-natured, and highly protective of children. Can be dog-aggressive.
lifestyle_description: Needs regular, vigorous exercise and mental stimulation. Requires firm, consistent training.
activities_description: Weight pull, agility, and competitive obedience.
content: Historically known as 'nanny dogs' due to their tolerance with children.

name: American Staffordshire Terrier
description: A stocky, muscular dog known for its courage, intelligence, and stable temperament.
history_description: Bred from the same ancestors as the Pit Bull. Separated and bred for show purposes in the U.S., emphasizing heavier, stockier build.
coat_description: Short, stiff, and glossy coat. All colors are permissible, but over 80% white is discouraged.
temperament_description: Brave, protective, and smart. Generally stable and reliable with family members.
lifestyle_description: Needs daily vigorous exercise and socialization. Requires strong leadership.
activities_description: Weight pulling, protection sports, and companionship.
content: Often confused with the American Pit Bull Terrier, but typically thicker and shorter.

name: American Water Spaniel
description: A rare, medium-sized spaniel, known for its proficiency in water retrieval and its curly coat.
history_description: Developed in the U.S. (Wisconsin) to hunt and retrieve from boats on lakes and rivers.
coat_description: A tightly curled or marcel coat, dense and water-resistant. Colors: Liver or dark chocolate.
temperament_description: Happy, energetic, and eager to please. Can be reserved with strangers.
lifestyle_description: Needs regular swimming or water retrieval work. Moderate daily exercise.
content: The state dog of Wisconsin, prized for its ability to work in small boats.

name: Andalusian Terrier
description: A small, sturdy Spanish terrier, related to the Rat Terriers, used for hunting rodents.
history_description: A rustic Spanish terrier from the region of Andalusia, traditionally used as a ship dog and ratter.
size_description: Small. Similar in size to other Rat Terriers.
coat_description: Short and smooth coat. Colors: Tricolor (white, black, and tan) with a characteristic head patch.
temperament_description: Lively, curious, and fearless. Energetic and demanding of attention.
lifestyle_description: Good apartment dog if given sufficient daily activity.
content: A very rare breed, mostly known within its region of origin.

name: Anglo-Français de Petite Vénerie
description: A medium-sized French scenthound, used for hunting small game in packs.
history_description: A cross between English and French hounds, specifically bred for hunting smaller game (Petite Vénerie).
coat_description: Short and smooth coat. Colors: Black and white, or Tricolor.
temperament_description: Energetic, enthusiastic hunter, but amiable and social in the pack.
lifestyle_description: Needs extensive outdoor exercise and is best suited for working packs.
content: Known for its harmonious proportions and elegant movement.

name: Appenzeller Sennenhund
description: A lively, spirited medium-sized Swiss mountain dog with striking tricolor markings.
history_description: One of the four Swiss Sennenhund breeds, originating in the Appenzell region for herding and guarding livestock.
coat_description: Thick, double coat, always tricolor (black, rust/tan, and white markings).
temperament_description: Confident, reliable, and highly intelligent. Needs a lot of mental and physical work.
lifestyle_description: Needs extensive daily exercise and a working role. Best in active homes.
content: Known for their unique way of curling their tail tightly over their back.

name: Ariège Pointer
description: A medium-sized French pointing dog, known for its elegant build and excellent nose.
history_description: Developed in the Ariège region of France, specializing in hunting in rough, mountainous terrain.
coat_description: Short, fine, and glossy coat. Colors: White with orange or chestnut patches.
temperament_description: Gentle, devoted, and a keen, energetic hunter.
lifestyle_description: Needs considerable daily exercise and time in the field.
content: A rare breed, recognized for its exceptional endurance and scenting ability.

name: Ariégeois
description: A medium-sized French pack-hunting scenthound, known for its speed and musical voice.
history_description: Originated in the Ariège region of the Pyrenees, a cross between local hounds and Briquet hounds.
coat_description: Short, fine, and glossy coat. Colors: White with black markings.
temperament_description: Enthusiastic hunter, but calm and docile at home. Social and good in a pack.
lifestyle_description: Needs extensive daily exercise and a secure, rural environment.
activities_description: Pack hunting and organized trail hunting.
content: Combines the best qualities of the local hunting dogs from its native region.

name: Argentine Pila
description: A small, hairless dog from Argentina, known for its warm, soft skin and devotion.
history_description: A landrace hairless dog native to Argentina, existing for centuries.
size_description: Small. Three sizes exist, ranging from 4–14 lbs.
coat_description: Hairless or very sparsely coated. Skin color varies widely.
temperament_description: Lively, affectionate, and alert. Good companion dog.
lifestyle_description: Good apartment dog, needs protection from cold and sun.
content: Like other hairless breeds, it is often favored by people with allergies.

name: Armant
description: A medium-sized Egyptian herding and guarding dog, known for its ruggedness and loyalty.
history_description: An Egyptian working dog, believed to have descended from Briard-type dogs brought by Napoleon's army.
coat_description: Long, thick, and coarse coat, often gray, black, or yellowish.
temperament_description: Loyal, courageous, and protective of its herd or family. Can be reserved.
lifestyle_description: Needs space and a job to do. Requires moderate to high exercise.
content: Also known as the 'Egyptian Sheepdog' or 'Ermenti'.

name: Armenian Gampr
description: A large, powerful livestock guardian dog, native to the Armenian Highlands.
history_description: An ancient landrace breed, used for millennia to guard flocks against large predators.
size_description: Giant. Highly variable, usually 100–140 lbs or more.
coat_description: Thick double coat, varied colors.
temperament_description: Independent, highly protective, and courageous. Can be very reserved with strangers.
lifestyle_description: Best suited for working in a rural environment. Needs a working role.
content: Known for its natural ability to assess threats independently.

name: Artois Hound
description: A classic French scenthound, known for its short legs and long, heavy ears.
history_description: An ancient French breed from the Artois region, once common but now very rare.
coat_description: Short, thick, and coarse coat. Colors: Tricolor (Fawn, Black, and White).
temperament_description: Determined and keen hunter, but calm and docile at home.
lifestyle_description: Needs daily outdoor exercise, primarily scent work.
content: The breed was nearly extinct after World War II, but was revived by enthusiasts.

name: Australian Cattle Dog
description: A rugged, tireless herding dog, known for its intelligence and protective nature.
history_description: Developed in Australia in the 19th century to herd cattle over vast distances in rough terrain.
coat_description: Smooth double coat. Colors: Red Heeler (red speckled) or Blue Heeler (blue mottled).
temperament_description: Highly intelligent, alert, and wary of strangers. Needs constant mental and physical stimulation.
lifestyle_description: Requires intense, daily vigorous exercise and a job to do. Not suited for sedentary life.
content: Known for its unique method of driving cattle by nipping at their heels ('heeler').

name: Australian Kelpie
description: An extremely intelligent and highly driven herding dog, known for its efficiency and stamina.
history_description: Developed in Australia from British collies to efficiently muster sheep in the harsh climate.
coat_description: Short, double coat. Colors: Black, Red, Chocolate, Blue, Fawn, usually with tan points.
temperament_description: Highly intelligent, tireless, and loyal. Needs constant mental engagement.
lifestyle_description: Requires enormous amounts of exercise and a full-time job (herding is ideal).
content: Known for its 'Kelpies stare' (eye contact) used to control livestock.

name: Australian Shepherd
description: Intelligent, active herding dog of striking color and a medium-length coat.
history_description: Developed in the U.S. (despite the name) by Basque shepherds to herd livestock.
size_description: Medium. Males: 50–65 lbs, 20–23 inches. Females: 40–55 lbs, 18–21 inches.
coat_description: Medium-length, waterproof double coat. Colors: Blue Merle, Red Merle, Black, Red (all with/without white).
temperament_description: Smart, devoted, and a natural herder. Can be reserved with strangers.
lifestyle_description: Requires intense daily exercise and a 'job' to do to satisfy its working drive.
activities_description: Herding, agility, flyball, and Frisbee catching.
content: Famous for their hypnotic gaze, known as the 'Aussie stare,' used to control livestock.

name: Australian Silky Terrier
description: A small toy terrier known for its long, straight, silky blue and tan coat.
history_description: Developed in Australia in the late 19th century from crossbreeding the Australian Terrier, Yorkshire Terrier, and possibly the Cairn Terrier.
coat_description: Long, fine, silky coat that grows straight. Colors: Blue and tan.
temperament_description: Typical terrier: feisty, energetic, and highly curious. Loyal to family.
lifestyle_description: Good apartment dog, needs moderate daily exercise and regular grooming.
content: Often mistaken for the Yorkshire Terrier, but is sturdier and longer in body.

name: Australian Stumpy Tail Cattle Dog
description: A sturdy, compact herding dog, distinguishable by its natural bobtail or 'stumpy tail'.
history_description: Developed in Australia in the 19th century for droving cattle. A mix of Dingo, Collie, and later, Kelpie.
coat_description: Short, double coat. Colors: Blue speckled (blue heeler) or Red speckled (red heeler).
temperament_description: Highly intelligent, alert, and fiercely loyal. Very protective of property.
lifestyle_description: Requires intense daily exercise and a working role. Needs a large, secure space.
content: The defining characteristic is the natural, undocked tail, no longer than 4 inches.

name: Australian Terrier
description: A small, spirited terrier known for its rough coat and friendly disposition.
history_description: The first Australian native breed recognized in Australia. Bred to exterminate rodents and snakes.
coat_description: Rough, shaggy, double coat. Colors: Blue and tan, solid red, or sandy.
temperament_description: Plucky, spirited, and self-assured. Loyal to its owners.
lifestyle_description: Good apartment dog, needs moderate daily exercise and a securely fenced area (high prey drive).
activities_description: Companion, ratter, and small game hunting.
content: They are typically longer than they are tall, giving them a sturdy profile.

name: Austrian Black and Tan Hound
description: A medium-sized scenthound from Austria, known for its excellent nose and stamina.
history_description: Originated in Austria, used for tracking wounded deer and other game in the mountains.
coat_description: Short, smooth, and dense coat. Colors: Black with small, clearly defined tan markings.
temperament_description: Energetic, keen hunter, but calm and docile with family.
lifestyle_description: Needs extensive daily exercise and tracking work. Best suited for rural living.
content: A hardy and enduring hunting dog, built for long hours in rugged terrain.

name: Austrian Pinscher
description: A medium-sized, lively, and feisty farm dog from Austria.
history_description: A working farm dog from Austria, used for guarding, ratting, and herding.
coat_description: Short to medium-length double coat, slightly rough. Colors: Red, yellow, black and tan, usually with white markings.
temperament_description: Lively, alert, and playful. Wary of strangers, making them good watchdogs.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate to high daily exercise and mental stimulation. Requires a secure yard.
content: Known for its love of its family and a highly developed protective instinct.

name: Azawakh
description: A slender, elegant, and high-legged African sighthound, built for speed and endurance.
history_description: Originated in the Azawakh Valley of the Sahara, used by nomadic tribes for guarding camps and hunting fast desert game.
coat_description: Very short and fine coat. Colors: Fawn, Red, Brindle, usually with white markings on legs.
temperament_description: Distant and protective with strangers, but deeply affectionate with its family. Sensitive.
lifestyle_description: Needs bursts of high-speed running daily. Does not tolerate cold weather.
activities_description: Sighthound racing (Lure coursing) and long runs.
content: An ancient, exotic breed that is extremely rare outside of its native Mali/Niger region.

name: Bắc Hà
description: A medium-sized dog native to Vietnam, known for its intelligence, loyalty, and impressive mane.
history_description: Originating in the Bắc Hà region of Vietnam, traditionally used for guarding and hunting.
coat_description: Thick, long double coat, forming a ruff around the neck. Colors: Black, brown, white, or mixed.
temperament_description: Loyal, protective, and independent. Wary of strangers, making it a good guard dog.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate to high daily exercise and a working role. Best suited for rural areas.
content: A prized native Vietnamese dog breed, known for its wolf-like appearance.

name: Bakharwal
description: A large, ancient working dog from the Himalayan foothills, used as a livestock guardian.
history_description: Native to the Indian and Pakistani Kashmir regions, bred by the Gujjar and Bakarwal nomadic tribes.
coat_description: Thick, medium-length coat, often black or brown with white markings.
temperament_description: Strongly protective, dominant, and fearless. Loyal to its herd and family.
lifestyle_description: Needs a lot of space and a guarding role. Not suited for apartment life.
content: A critically endangered species of Indian mastiff, rarely found outside its native region.

name: Banjara Hound
description: A powerful, tall sighthound from India, known for its speed and hunting prowess.
history_description: Used by the nomadic Banjara people of Maharashtra for hunting big game.
coat_description: Short, smooth coat. Colors: Fawn, brindle, or black.
temperament_description: Loyal, courageous, and highly focused on hunting. Can be aloof.
lifestyle_description: Needs vast amounts of running space and daily exercise.
activities_description: Sighthound racing and big game hunting.
content: A rugged and enduring breed adapted to the dry, hot climate of central India.

name: Bankhar Dog
description: A massive, powerful guardian dog from Mongolia, used to protect livestock.
history_description: An ancient Tibetan Mastiff descendant, used for guarding livestock on the steppes of Mongolia.
coat_description: Long, thick coat, often black and tan or solid black.
temperament_description: Fiercely protective, calm, and independent. Highly wary of strangers.
lifestyle_description: Needs a vast working territory and a full-time guarding role.
content: Highly prized by nomadic Mongolians for its ability to withstand extreme weather.

name: Barak hound
description: A medium-sized scenthound from Bosnia and Herzegovina, known for its rough coat and deep voice.
history_description: Used for hunting fox, wild boar, and rabbit in the rough, mountainous terrain of the Balkans.
coat_description: Long, hard, and shaggy outer coat. Colors: Yellowish, reddish-yellow, or earthy gray, often with white markings.
temperament_description: Lively, courageous, and tireless worker. Affectionate with family.
lifestyle_description: Needs frequent, vigorous outdoor activity and tracking work.
content: Also known as the Bosnian Coarse-haired Hound.

name: Barbado da Terceira
description: A medium-sized Portuguese herding dog, known for its dense, wavy coat and intelligence.
history_description: Native to the Terceira Island of the Azores, traditionally used for handling cattle and guarding farms.
coat_description: Long, wavy coat with a beard and mustache. Colors: Fawn, black, gray, or yellow.
temperament_description: Intelligent, loyal, and energetic. A devoted family dog.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate to high exercise and mental stimulation.
content: A rustic and versatile breed that adapts well to various climates.

name: Barbet
description: A medium-sized French water dog, characterized by its long, curly, woolly coat.
history_description: An ancient French breed, primarily used for retrieving waterfowl. The word 'barbet' means 'bearded dog'.
coat_description: Thick, woolly, curly coat that is water-resistant. Colors: Black, brown, fawn, gray, or white.
temperament_description: Friendly, joyful, and highly intelligent. Loves water and play.
lifestyle_description: Needs plenty of exercise, especially swimming. Requires regular grooming.
content: Considered the ancestor of many modern water dog breeds, including the Poodle.

name: Basenji
description: A unique African hound known for not barking, instead making a yodeling sound, and its fastidious nature.
history_description: An ancient breed originating in Central Africa (Congo), used for hunting small game.
coat_description: Short, fine, and smooth coat. Colors: Red, black, brindle, or tricolor (always with white feet, chest, and tail tip).
temperament_description: Intelligent, independent, and curious. Can be aloof and challenging to train.
lifestyle_description: Needs a secure area (escape artist) and moderate daily exercise. Cat-like grooming habits.
content: Known as the 'barkless dog' and also for its distinctive wrinkled forehead.

name: Basque Shepherd Dog
description: An ancient herding dog native to the Basque Country of Spain and France.
history_description: Used by Basque shepherds for centuries to guard and herd sheep and cattle.
size_description: Medium. 35–80 pounds, 18–24 inches tall. Two varieties: Gorbeiakoa and Iletsua.
coat_description: Medium-length, smooth or woolly coat. Colors: Fawn or cinnamon.
temperament_description: Intelligent, tireless, and loyal to its shepherd. Can be protective and reserved.
lifestyle_description: Needs a working role and extensive daily exercise. Best in a rural environment.
content: Highly prized for its gentle nature with livestock and alertness to danger.

name: Basset Artésien Normand
description: A short-legged French scenthound with a very long body and distinctive 'sad' expression.
history_description: Developed in France by crossing the Basset d'Artois and the Basset Normand; used for hunting small game.
coat_description: Short, smooth, and dense coat. Colors: Tricolor or Lemon and White.
temperament_description: Affectionate, patient, and highly focused on scent work. Can be stubborn.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate exercise, primarily scent walks. Prone to weight gain.
content: Its appearance is very similar to the Basset Hound, but with slightly straighter legs.

name: Basset Bleu de Gascogne
description: A short-legged French scenthound with a unique mottled blue coat and deep, mournful bark.
history_description: A descendant of the much larger Grand Bleu de Gascogne hound, bred in Gascony, France.
coat_description: Short, dense coat, predominantly white mottled with black, giving a slate-blue appearance.
temperament_description: Calm, devoted, and highly driven by scent. Can be very vocal (baying).
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate exercise and a secure yard (will follow a scent).
content: Known for its long ears, noble head, and distinctive blue coat color.

name: Basset Fauve de Bretagne
description: A small, sturdy, wire-haired scenthound from Brittany, known for its reddish-fawn coat.
history_description: Developed in the 19th century in France from the larger Grand Fauve de Bretagne, used for hunting rabbit and fox.
coat_description: Wiry, harsh, and dense coat. Colors: Fawn (red-fawn or wheaten).
temperament_description: Energetic, playful, and very affectionate. Excellent family dog, but a tireless hunter.
lifestyle_description: Needs plenty of outdoor activity and moderate daily exercise.
content: The breed was nearly extinct after the Second World War but was successfully revived.

name: Basset Hound
description: A charming, low-slung scenthound known for its long, velvety ears and mournful expression.
history_description: Originated in France and Belgium from early St. Hubert Hounds, bred to trail small game on foot.
size_description: Medium. 40–65 pounds, no more than 14 inches tall.
coat_description: Short, smooth, and dense coat. Colors: Typically tricolor or red and white.
temperament_description: Docile, lazy indoors, but tireless on the trail. Highly affectionate but can be stubborn.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate daily exercise. Must be watched near water due to short legs.
content: Known for having one of the best noses in the dog world, second only to the Bloodhound.

name: Bavarian Mountain Hound
description: A medium-sized scenthound from Germany, specializing in tracking wounded game in mountainous areas.
history_description: Bred in Germany in the 19th century by crossing Bavarian Hounds with Tyrolean Hounds.
coat_description: Short, dense, and smooth coat. Colors: Deep deer red, reddish-brown, or fawn.
temperament_description: Calm, courageous, and highly focused when tracking. Devoted to its handler.
lifestyle_description: Needs extensive tracking work and moderate to high daily exercise.
content: A highly esteemed tracking dog, often reserved for professional hunters.

name: Beagle
description: A small, compact hound with an endless love for sniffing and a merry, friendly disposition.
history_description: Ancestors trace back to ancient Greece; developed in England for hunting rabbits.
size_description: Small. Two height varieties: up to 13 inches, and 13 to 15 inches.
coat_description: Short, smooth, dense, and weather-proof. Tri-color or any hound color.
temperament_description: Happy, curious, and outgoing. Excellent with children and other dogs.
lifestyle_description: Thrives on company and needs a secure, fenced yard due to its strong hunting instinct.
activities_description: Tracking, obedience, and plenty of scent-related games.
content: Famous for their vocal 'bay' and ability to follow a scent trail relentlessly.

name: Beagle-Harrier
description: A medium-sized scenthound that is a cross between the Beagle and the Harrier, possessing features of both.
history_description: Originated in France, bred for hunting small game like rabbits and hares.
coat_description: Short, smooth coat. Colors: Typically tricolor (black, tan, and white).
temperament_description: Energetic, good-natured, and sociable. Ideal for group hunting.
lifestyle_description: Needs plenty of exercise and is best suited for country life or active owners.
content: Falls between the Beagle and the Harrier in size, hence the name.

name: Bearded Collie
description: A shaggy, bright, and animated herding dog known for its characteristic beard and flowing coat.
history_description: An ancient British herding dog, used primarily for driving cattle in the rugged Scottish climate.
coat_description: Long, shaggy outer coat with a soft undercoat. Colors: Black, blue, brown, or fawn, often with white.
temperament_description: Bouncy, playful, and stable. Highly intelligent and trainable.
lifestyle_description: Needs vigorous daily exercise and mental stimulation. Requires extensive grooming.
content: Their characteristic beard is formed by the hair falling forward from the cheeks and chin.

name: Beauceron
description: A powerful, large French herding dog, known for its intelligence, loyalty, and calm confidence.
history_description: A very old breed from France, historically used for herding sheep and guarding livestock. Related to the Briard.
coat_description: Short, thick, and harsh outer coat. Colors: Black and tan (most common) or Harlequin (gray, black, and tan).
temperament_description: Intelligent, fearless, and highly devoted to its family. Reserved with strangers.
lifestyle_description: Needs intense daily exercise and a 'job' to do. Best for experienced owners.
activities_description: Herding, police work, Schutzhund, and agility.
content: Known for the double dewclaws on its hind legs, a traditional trait.

name: Bedlington Terrier
description: A small, unique terrier resembling a lamb, known for its arched back and pear-shaped head.
history_description: Originated in the mining district of Bedlington, England, bred to hunt vermin in mines and homes.
coat_description: Crisp, wiry, and curly coat. Colors: Blue, liver, or sandy (often fades over time).
temperament_description: Feisty, courageous, and energetic, despite its gentle appearance. Affectionate indoors.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate daily exercise. Hypoallergenic coat requires regular clipping.
activities_description: Hunting vermin, earthdog trials, and companion activities.
content: Its distinctive coat and shape make it one of the most unique-looking terriers.

name: Belgian Shepherd
description: A highly intelligent, versatile, and elegant herding dog with four distinct coat varieties.
history_description: Developed in Belgium in the late 19th century as a multi-purpose shepherd and guard dog.
coat_description: Four varieties (Groenendael, Tervuren, Malinois, Laekenois) range from long black hair to short fawn hair.
temperament_description: Extremely intelligent, alert, sensitive, and highly energetic. Needs constant engagement.
lifestyle_description: Requires intensive daily exercise, training, and a job to do. Prone to anxiety if under-stimulated.
activities_description: Herding, police and military work, tracking, and agility.
content: The Malinois variety is heavily favored for high-level police and military roles worldwide.

name: Bergamasco Shepherd
description: An ancient Italian herding dog, famous for its unique, felted, 'flocked' coat.
history_description: Originated in the Italian Alps near Bergamo, used for guarding and driving sheep.
coat_description: Long, heavy coat that forms flat, woven 'flocks' (or dreadlocks). Colors: Gray or black.
temperament_description: Intelligent, patient, and highly devoted. A natural, self-sufficient guardian.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate exercise and space. The coat requires unique, low-frequency care once flocked.
content: The flocks protect the dog from weather and wolf bites while on the job.

name: Berger Picard
description: A medium-sized French herding dog with a shaggy coat and rugged, handsome appearance.
history_description: One of the oldest French herding breeds, originating in the Picardy region. Nearly extinct after WWI and WWII.
coat_description: Rough, crisp, medium-length coat (shaggy). Colors: Fawn or gray.
temperament_description: Lively, intelligent, and sensitive. Loyal and protective of its family.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate to high daily exercise and mental challenges.
content: Known for its keen expression and often-described 'rustic' charm.

name: Bernese Mountain Dog
description: A large, sturdy working dog with a beautiful tricolor coat, known for its gentle, calm nature.
history_description: One of the four Swiss Sennenhund breeds, used for herding, guarding, and drafting (pulling carts) in the Swiss Alps.
coat_description: Thick, long, and silky double coat. Always tricolor (black, rust, and white).
temperament_description: Good-natured, calm, and highly devoted to family. Excellent with children.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate daily exercise and companionship. Does not tolerate heat well.
activities_description: Drafting (cart pulling), therapy work, and obedience.
content: A beautiful and powerful dog, sadly known for a relatively short life span.

name: Bichon Frisé
description: A small, cheerful dog with a curled, white coat. Known for its playful and charismatic nature.
history_description: Descended from the Barbets (water spaniels). Became popular in 13th-century Europe, especially as companions to royalty.
coat_description: Soft, thick, curly, pure white coat. Hypoallergenic, requires daily grooming.
temperament_description: Affectionate, playful, and charming. Good with other pets and children.
lifestyle_description: Good apartment dog. Needs short daily walks and indoor play.
activities_description: Companion activities and short bursts of play.
content: The name 'Bichon Frisé' means 'curly lap dog' in French.

name: Biewer Terrier
description: A small, elegant toy terrier with a long, flowing tri-color coat.
history_description: Originated in Germany in the 1980s, descending from the Yorkshire Terrier with a recessive piebald gene.
coat_description: Long, silky, tri-color coat (black/blue, white, and tan). Does not shed.
temperament_description: Playful, whimsical, and highly affectionate. Maintains a puppy-like demeanor.
lifestyle_description: Excellent apartment dog. Requires moderate exercise and daily grooming.
content: Distinguished from the Yorkshire Terrier by the presence of white markings.

name: Billy
description: A large, elegant, and rare French scenthound, known for its striking white color and speed.
history_description: Created in France in the 19th century by Monsieur Gaston Hublot du Rivault for hunting large game, primarily deer.
coat_description: Short, harsh coat. Colors: White, milk-white, or white with lemon or orange patches.
temperament_description: Energetic, enthusiastic hunter, but gentle and social within the pack.
lifestyle_description: Needs vast amounts of running space and is best kept in a working pack.
content: Named after the town of Billy, the former residence of the breed's creator.

name: Black and Tan Coonhound
description: A large, powerful scenthound, known for its tracking ability, black and tan color, and deep baying voice.
history_description: Descended from the Bloodhound and Foxhound. Bred in the U.S. for trailing raccoons (coon) at night.
coat_description: Short, dense, and glossy coat. Always black with rich tan markings.
temperament_description: Outgoing, mild-mannered, and devoted. Highly driven by scent; can be stubborn.
lifestyle_description: Needs vigorous daily exercise and a secure yard. Can be very vocal.
activities_description: Coon hunting and organized trail hunting.
content: The only Coonhound breed that traces its ancestry primarily to the Bloodhound.

name: Black Norwegian Elkhound
description: A medium-sized spitz-type dog, known for its all-black coat and bold, independent nature.
history_description: A Norwegian hunting dog, specializing in hunting elk and bear in dense forests.
coat_description: Thick, coarse, double coat, always solid black.
temperament_description: Brave, independent, and tireless hunter. Loyal to its owner.
lifestyle_description: Needs extensive daily exercise, especially in cold weather. Needs a job to do.
activities_description: Hunting large game, guarding, and endurance activities.
content: A smaller, black variant of the more common Gray Norwegian Elkhound.

name: Black Russian Terrier
description: A large, powerful, and robust working dog with a thick, protective black coat.
history_description: Developed by the Soviet military in the 1940s/50s from 17 breeds (including Rottweiler, Giant Schnauzer, Airedale) for use as guard dogs.
coat_description: Coarse, dense, wavy, black coat. Requires regular grooming.
temperament_description: Calm, courageous, and highly protective. Intelligent and trainable, but needs an experienced hand.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate to high daily exercise and mental stimulation. Not suited for novice owners.
content: Known as the 'Black Pearl of Russia' and is a relatively young breed.

name: Black Mouth Cur
description: A medium/large, powerful working dog from the American South, known for its hunting skills and distinctive black muzzle.
history_description: A multi-purpose farm and hunting dog used for herding cattle, tracking game, and guarding.
coat_description: Short to medium length, dense coat. Colors: Fawn, yellow, brindle, or red, with the signature black muzzle.
temperament_description: Courageous, highly intelligent, and strong-willed. Devoted to family and protective.
lifestyle_description: Needs a job to do and daily vigorous exercise. Best in a rural environment.
content: The 'Cur' name refers to its working class heritage in the U.S.

name: Bloodhound
description: A large scenthound with long, drooping ears and deeply wrinkled skin, famed for its extraordinary sense of smell.
history_description: Originated in Belgium from St. Hubert Hounds. Bred for tracking humans and trailing game since medieval times.
coat_description: Short, hard, and dense coat. Colors: Black and tan, Liver and tan, or Red.
temperament_description: Gentle, noble, and extremely affectionate. Persistent and highly driven by scent (can be stubborn).
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate exercise, primarily scent walks. Requires clean ears and face folds.
content: Possesses the most sensitive nose of any dog breed, often used in forensic work.

name: Blue Lacy
description: A medium-sized working dog from Texas, known for its high energy and blue or gray color.
history_description: Developed in Texas in the mid-19th century by the Lacy family for herding cattle, catching feral hogs, and hunting.
coat_description: Short, smooth coat. Colors: Blue (gray), Red, or Tri-color.
temperament_description: Intelligent, intense worker, and loyal. High energy and needs a job.
lifestyle_description: Requires intensive daily exercise and mental stimulation. Best for working homes.
content: The state dog of Texas, recognized for its exceptional versatility on ranches.

name: Blue Picardy Spaniel
description: A medium-sized French pointing dog, known for its striking mottled blue-gray coat.
history_description: Developed in the Picardy region of France from the English Setter and local French spaniels.
coat_description: Medium-length, flat, and slightly wavy coat. Colors: Black and white speckled, giving a blue shade.
temperament_description: Calm, devoted, and a tireless hunter. Gentle family companion.
lifestyle_description: Needs daily vigorous exercise, especially hunting and retrieving.
content: A high-quality gundog, known for its love of water and thick coat for wetland hunting.

name: Bluetick Coonhound
description: A fast, determined scenthound, known for its mottled blue coat and powerful hunting voice.
history_description: Developed in the U.S. from French hounds and English Foxhounds. Bred for trailing raccoons and large game.
coat_description: Short, glossy, and coarse coat. Colors: Dark blue mottled with black spots.
temperament_description: Intelligent, loyal, and highly driven by scent. Can be aloof with strangers.
lifestyle_description: Needs vigorous daily exercise and a job for its nose. Prone to baying.
activities_description: Coon hunting and organized trail hunting.
content: Distinctive for its unique, almost entirely blue-black-mottled coat.

name: Boerboel
description: A large, powerful South African mastiff, bred to guard the home and farm (erf).
history_description: Developed in South Africa by Dutch, French, and British settlers using mastiff-type dogs for protection against large predators.
coat_description: Short, dense, and sleek coat. Colors: Red, brown, fawn, or brindle, often with a black mask.
temperament_description: Intelligent, confident, and highly territorial. Devoted to family but reserved with strangers.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate daily exercise and firm, consistent training. Requires extensive socialization.
content: The name means 'farmer's dog' in Afrikaans.

name: Bohemian Shepherd
description: A medium-sized herding dog from the Czech Republic, known for its friendly demeanor and long coat.
history_description: An ancient Czech breed used for guarding and herding in the Bohemian Forest.
coat_description: Long, thick coat with feathering on the ears and legs. Colors: Black and tan.
temperament_description: Lively, intelligent, and very good with children. Easy to train.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate to high daily exercise and mental stimulation. Good family companion.
content: Known for its distinctive head shape and alert expression.

name: Bohemian Spotted Dog
description: A medium-sized Czech dog, known for its lean, athletic build and spotted coat.
history_description: A relatively new breed developed in Czechoslovakia in the 1950s for laboratory testing, later repurposed as a companion dog.
coat_description: Short, smooth coat. Colors: Black, brown, or liver spots on a white base.
temperament_description: Lively, playful, and highly intelligent. Very adaptable.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate daily exercise and enjoys training.
content: Recognized for its symmetrical spotting and elegant movement.

name: Bolognese
description: A small, fluffy Italian toy dog, known for its calm demeanor and pure white, cotton-like coat.
history_description: An ancient Italian breed, belonging to the Bichon family. Favored by European nobility since the 11th century.
coat_description: Long, fluffy, cotton-like coat (not curly). Always pure white. Hypoallergenic.
temperament_description: Calm, serious, and deeply devoted to its owner. Not excessively yappy.
lifestyle_description: Excellent apartment dog. Requires minimal exercise but daily grooming.
content: Named after the northern Italian city of Bologna.

name: Border Collie
description: A supremely intelligent and energetic herding dog, considered the world's premier sheepdog.
history_description: Developed in the border region between Scotland and England for herding sheep using its intense gaze ('eye').
coat_description: Rough or smooth double coat. Colors: Black and white is common, but any color/pattern is permissible.
temperament_description: Intensely intelligent, highly sensitive, and tireless. Needs constant mental and physical work.
lifestyle_description: Requires constant training and multiple hours of vigorous exercise daily. Not suited for inactive homes.
activities_description: Herding, agility, flyball, and competitive obedience.
content: Routinely ranked as the most intelligent dog breed.

name: Border Terrier
description: A small, hardy terrier from the English-Scottish border, known for its otter-like head.
history_description: Bred to accompany horsemen hunting foxes in the Cheviot Hills, able to follow a horse and go to ground.
coat_description: Wiry, dense outer coat and close undercoat. Colors: Grizzle and tan, blue and tan, or wheaten.
temperament_description: Affectionate, alert, and keen. Less feisty than many terriers, but still tenacious.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate daily exercise and a securely fenced area (high prey drive).
content: Known for its adaptability to both city and country life.

name: Borzoi
description: A tall, aristocratic Russian sighthound, known for its speed and elegance.
history_description: Bred by Russian nobility for hundreds of years, used for coursing wolves and hares over open country.
size_description: Giant. Males: 75–105 pounds, 28 inches up. Females: 60–85 pounds, 26 inches up.
coat_description: Long, silky, and wavy coat. Colors: Any color is permissible.
temperament_description: Quiet, gentle, and highly sensitive indoors. Explosively fast outdoors.
lifestyle_description: Needs a securely fenced area for sprinting. Moderate daily exercise is sufficient indoors.
content: Once known as the Russian Wolfhound.

name: Boston Terrier
description: A neat, compact, and friendly American dog, known for its tuxedo-like markings and square head.
history_description: Originated in Boston, Massachusetts, in the late 19th century from a cross between an English Bulldog and an English White Terrier.
size_description: Small. Three weight classes: under 15, 15–20, and 20–25 pounds.
coat_description: Short, smooth, and glossy coat. Colors: Brindle, seal, or black, all with white markings.
temperament_description: Gentle, lively, and highly adaptable. Excellent companion dog.
lifestyle_description: Good apartment dog, needs moderate daily walks. Cannot tolerate heat or extreme cold.
content: Known as 'The American Gentleman' for its tidy appearance and disposition.

name: Bouvier des Ardennes
description: A medium/large, rugged Belgian herding dog with a harsh, shaggy coat.
history_description: A rare Belgian breed from the Ardennes region, traditionally used for herding cattle and driving meat to market.
coat_description: Rough, wiry, shaggy coat with a dense undercoat. Colors: Gray, fawn, or black.
temperament_description: Intelligent, brave, and stubborn. Highly devoted and protective.
lifestyle_description: Needs a job to do and extensive daily exercise. Best with experienced owners.
content: The breed has a naturally short tail or is docked.

name: Bouvier des Flandres
description: A sturdy, compact herding dog from Flanders, known for its impressive shaggy coat and immense strength.
history_description: Originated in the Belgian and French Flanders region, used by monks and farmers for herding, cart pulling, and general farm work.
coat_description: Rough, double coat, shaggy on the head (beard/mustache). Colors: Fawn, black, gray, or brindle.
temperament_description: Calm, protective, and resolute. Intelligent and trainable.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate daily exercise and firm training. Requires significant grooming.
content: The breed was nearly destroyed during World War I, as they were used as trench dogs and ambulance dogs.

name: Boxer
description: Bright, playful, and high-spirited working dog with a sleek, fawn or brindle coat.
history_description: Bred in Germany from the now-extinct Bullenbeisser for hunting boar and later used for police work.
size_description: Large. Males: 65–80 lbs, 23–25 inches. Females: 15 inches and up.
coat_description: Short, smooth, and tight-fitting coat. Colors: Fawn or Brindle, with white markings.
temperament_description: Patient and protective with kids, but can be rambunctious. Playful and clownish.
lifestyle_description: Needs daily vigorous exercise. Does poorly in hot weather and needs a cool environment.
activities_description: Obedience, agility, watch-dog duties, and fetching.
content: Boxers are known for standing on their hind legs and 'boxing' with their front paws while playing.

name: Boykin Spaniel
description: A medium-sized retriever developed for hunting wild turkeys and waterfowl in the South Carolina swamps.
history_description: Originated in South Carolina, U.S., in the early 1900s, specifically bred to work in small boats.
coat_description: Medium-length, flat to wavy coat. Colors: Solid liver or dark chocolate.
temperament_description: Energetic, eager-to-please, and friendly. Excellent water dog.
lifestyle_description: Needs high daily exercise, especially retrieving and swimming.
activities_description: Waterfowl and turkey hunting, and retrieving.
content: The state dog of South Carolina, known as the 'little brown dog'.

name: Bracco Italiano
description: A large, ancient Italian pointing dog with long ears, drooping lips, and a noble appearance.
history_description: One of the two Italian pointing breeds. Has existed since the 4th century B.C., used for bird hunting.
coat_description: Short, dense, and glossy coat. Colors: White, white with orange or chestnut patches, or roan.
temperament_description: Affectionate, patient, and docile at home. Tireless and fast in the field.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate to high daily exercise and is best suited for an active family.
content: Known for its distinctive head and long, leathery ears.

name: Braque d'Auvergne
description: A medium-sized French pointing dog with a sleek build and striking black and white mottled coat.
history_description: Developed in the Auvergne region of France, traditionally used for hunting upland game birds.
coat_description: Short, glossy coat. Colors: Black, heavily mottled with white, giving a 'blue' appearance.
temperament_description: Gentle, devoted, and intelligent. Easy to train and keen hunter.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate to high daily exercise and time in the field.
content: Its distinctive coat pattern is known as 'blue roan'.

name: Braque du Bourbonnais
description: A medium-sized French pointing dog, noted for its naturally short tail and pale, spotted coat.
history_description: Originated in the Bourbonnais region of France. Its lineage dates back to the 1500s.
coat_description: Short, fine, and dense coat. Colors: Fawn or brown spots on a white base.
temperament_description: Affectionate, calm, and intelligent. Highly effective hunter.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate to high daily exercise and a secure place to run.
content: Known for having been historically popular with French nobility.

name: Braque Français
description: An adaptable, medium-sized French pointing dog, highly versatile and gentle.
history_description: One of the oldest pointing breeds in France, believed to be the ancestor of many modern European pointers.
size_description: Medium. Two varieties exist: Gascogne (larger) and Pyrenees (smaller).
coat_description: Short, thick, and smooth coat. Colors: Brown, brown and white, often heavily ticked or roan.
temperament_description: Intelligent, calm, and devoted. Highly adaptable as both a hunter and companion.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate to high daily exercise. Good family dog if exercised.
content: Prized for its ease of training and gentle nature.

name: Braque Saint-Germain
description: A large, elegant French pointing dog, known for its white coat with orange markings.
history_description: Created in the 19th century near Paris, combining English and French pointing dogs.
coat_description: Short, smooth, and dense coat. Colors: White with orange/fawn spots.
temperament_description: Affectionate, lively, and intelligent. A devoted and patient hunting companion.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate to high daily exercise, especially running.
content: A noble-looking gundog with a beautiful gait.

name: Brazilian Terrier
description: A small, lively terrier from Brazil, known for its unique tricolor markings and enthusiasm.
history_description: Developed in Brazil from Fox Terriers and other small terriers brought by European students returning home.
coat_description: Short, smooth, and fine coat. Colors: Tricolor (white, black, and tan/brown), with characteristic markings.
temperament_description: Energetic, playful, and alert. Affectionate with family but wary of strangers.
lifestyle_description: Good apartment dog if exercised. Needs moderate daily activity.
content: The only terrier breed native to Brazil.

name: Briard
description: A large, shaggy French herding dog with a long, protective coat and a loyal, protective nature.
history_description: An ancient French breed, used for both herding and guarding sheep since the Middle Ages.
coat_description: Long, dry, and shaggy coat (goat-like texture). Colors: Black, gray, or fawn.
temperament_description: Intelligent, faithful, and protective. Can be stubborn and needs early socialization.
lifestyle_description: Needs significant daily exercise and a job to do. Requires regular grooming.
content: Known for the double dewclaws on the hind legs and its 'heart of gold'.

name: Briquet de Provence
description: A rare, medium-sized French scenthound from the Provence region.
history_description: An ancient hunting dog from southeastern France, known for hunting small game in the mountainous terrain.
coat_description: Short, dense, and slightly coarse coat. Colors: Fawn with a black saddle.
temperament_description: Keen hunter, energetic, and highly focused on scent.
lifestyle_description: Needs extensive outdoor exercise and is best suited for working.
content: A rustic and enduring breed, highly adapted to its native rocky landscape.

name: Briquet Griffon Vendéen
description: A medium-sized French scenthound with a shaggy, rough coat, known for its hunting enthusiasm.
history_description: A descendant of the larger Grand Griffon Vendéen, bred for hunting small game in the thickets of the Vendée region.
coat_description: Long, shaggy, and rough coat, but not excessive. Colors: Fawn, orange, black, or tricolor.
temperament_description: Energetic, brave, and good-natured. Highly social in a pack.
lifestyle_description: Needs ample daily exercise, primarily running and hunting.
content: Known for its distinctive shaggy appearance and powerful bark.

name: Brittany
description: A medium-sized French pointing dog, known for its intelligence, energy, and short/natural bobtail.
history_description: Originated in the Brittany region of France in the 17th century, a versatile hunting dog (pointing and retrieving).
coat_description: Dense, flat, or wavy coat with feathering. Colors: Orange and white, or Liver and white (often roan or ticked).
temperament_description: Eager to please, intelligent, and highly energetic. Excitable and friendly.
lifestyle_description: Needs at least an hour of vigorous, off-leash exercise daily. Best for active homes.
activities_description: Pointing, retrieving, agility, and field trials.
content: One of the most popular pointing breeds worldwide due to its compact size and temperament.

name: Broholmer
description: A large, powerful Danish mastiff-type dog, known for its calm temperament and protective nature.
history_description: An old Danish breed used for guarding large estates and hunting. Named after Sehested of Broholm.
coat_description: Short and smooth coat. Colors: Yellow/Fawn, Reddish-gold, or Black.
temperament_description: Calm, friendly, and self-assured. A gentle family protector.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate daily exercise and companionship. Needs space.
content: The breed was nearly extinct after World War II but was revived by the Danish Kennel Club.

name: Bruno Jura Hound
description: A medium-sized Swiss scenthound from the Jura mountains, known for its robust build and deep bay.
history_description: One of the four Swiss Hounds, specializing in tracking game on difficult, rocky terrain.
coat_description: Short, smooth, and dense coat. Colors: Black with rich tan markings (often with a tan spot above the eye).
temperament_description: Passionate hunter, but gentle and loyal with family. Calm indoors.
lifestyle_description: Needs extensive outdoor exercise, primarily scent work.
content: Known for its stamina and ability to withstand the harsh mountain climate.

name: Bucovina Shepherd Dog
description: A large, imposing livestock guardian dog from the Carpathian Mountains of Romania.
history_description: Used for centuries by shepherds to protect flocks against bears and wolves in the Carpathian Mountains.
coat_description: Long, harsh, and thick double coat. Colors: White or pale fawn with symmetrical black or brindle patches.
temperament_description: Fierce guardian, calm, and protective. Highly independent.
lifestyle_description: Needs a large, secure space and a working role. Not suited for city life.
content: A very powerful and massive dog, known for its deep, powerful bark.

name: Bulgarian Hound
description: A medium-sized scenthound native to Bulgaria, known for its tracking ability.
history_description: Used historically in Bulgaria for hunting wild boar, deer, and fox.
coat_description: Short, dense, and smooth coat. Colors: Tricolor (black, tan, and white).
temperament_description: Lively, courageous, and highly persistent on the trail. Loyal to its handler.
lifestyle_description: Needs extensive daily exercise and hunting work.
content: A traditional hunting dog of the Balkans.

name: Bulgarian Scenthound
description: A medium-sized scenthound from Bulgaria, known for its excellent nose and stamina.
history_description: Used in Bulgaria for tracking and flushing out game in thick vegetation.
coat_description: Short, dense, and smooth coat. Colors: Typically black and tan.
temperament_description: Energetic, highly focused on scent, and a tireless worker.
lifestyle_description: Needs extensive daily exercise and a working role.
content: A hardy working breed, valued by local hunters.

name: Bull Arab
description: A large, powerful working dog from Australia, a cross between various bull breeds and sighthounds.
history_description: Developed in Australia in the 1970s for finding and catching feral pigs.
coat_description: Short, smooth coat. Colors: Solid white, black, red, liver, or brindle.
temperament_description: Strong, athletic, and loyal. Protective of its family, but needs firm handling.
lifestyle_description: Requires constant, vigorous exercise and a working role. Not suited for urban life.
content: A high-performance hunting dog known for its strength and endurance.

name: Bull Terrier
description: A stocky, muscular dog known for its distinctive egg-shaped head and clownish personality.
history_description: Developed in England in the 19th century by crossbreeding the Bulldog and the now-extinct White English Terrier for fighting and ratting.
coat_description: Short, flat, and glossy coat. Colors: White or colored (brindle, red, fawn, black).
temperament_description: Playful, mischievous, and highly affectionate. Can be stubborn and challenging to train.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate to high daily exercise and intensive socialization.
content: The breed's unique, triangular eyes and egg-shaped head are its trademarks.

name: Bulldog
description: Friendly, courageous, and calm dog with a massive, short-faced head.
history_description: Originated in the British Isles for bull-baiting; later bred for companionship.
size_description: Medium. Males: approx 50 lbs. Females: approx 40 lbs.
coat_description: Short, fine, smooth, and sleek. Colors: Red Brindle, White, Fawn, etc.
temperament_description: Docile, dependable, and dignified. Loving to family but can be willful.
lifestyle_description: Low exercise needs, but should avoid heat and excessive activity due to breathing issues.
activities_description: Short, leisurely walks. Indoor play in cool environments.
content: The breed's wrinkled face and distinctive 'sourmug' expression make it instantly recognizable.

name: Bullmastiff
description: A large, massive dog known for its power, courage, and role as a silent guardian.
history_description: Developed in England in the mid-19th century by gamekeepers (60% Mastiff, 40% Bulldog) to silently catch and hold poachers.
coat_description: Short, dense, and weather-resistant coat. Colors: Red, fawn, or brindle, always with a black mask.
temperament_description: Calm, protective, and highly devoted to family. Reserved with strangers.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate daily exercise. Best with experienced owners who can handle its size.
content: Known as the 'Gamekeeper's Night Dog'.

name: Bully Kutta
description: A large, imposing mastiff-type dog from Pakistan and India, known for its strength and protective nature.
history_description: An ancient dog breed from the Indian subcontinent, used for guarding, hunting, and historically, dog fighting.
size_description: Giant. Can exceed 150 pounds and 30 inches tall.
coat_description: Short, dense, and smooth coat. Colors: White is common, but also fawn, brindle, or black.
temperament_description: Fiercely protective, aggressive towards other dogs, and highly territorial. Requires firm handling.
lifestyle_description: Needs vast space and a working role. Not suitable as a pet for novice owners.
content: The name means 'heavily wrinkled dog' in the Sindhi language.

name: Burgos Pointer
description: A large, powerful Spanish pointing dog, known for its heavy build and mottled coat.
history_description: An ancient Spanish breed, originating in the province of Burgos, used for hunting all types of game.
coat_description: Short, thick, and smooth coat. Colors: Liver and white, often heavily speckled or roan.
temperament_description: Calm, affectionate, and highly reliable in the field. Patient with children.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate to high daily exercise and is best suited for an active hunting home.
content: Distinguished by its large head, floppy ears, and heavy, muscular body.

name: Dachshund
description: A small, elongated hound known for its short legs and keen sense of smell.
history_description: Bred in Germany (since the 15th century) to fearlessly hunt badgers and other burrowing animals.
size_description: Small. Standard (16–32 lbs) and Miniature (under 11 lbs).
coat_description: Three varieties: Smooth, Longhaired, and Wirehaired. Colors: Red, black and tan, chocolate, dapple, etc.
temperament_description: Lively, courageous, and curious. Can be stubborn and prone to barking.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate daily exercise, but care must be taken to protect its back.
content: Its name means 'Badger Dog' in German.

name: Dalmatian
description: A medium-sized dog known for its unique spotted coat and athletic build.
history_description: Its origin is debated, but it gained fame in Dalmatia (Croatia) and was historically used as a carriage dog in England.
coat_description: Short, hard, and dense coat. Colors: Pure white with black or liver spots.
temperament_description: Energetic, playful, and highly devoted to family. Can be aloof with strangers.
lifestyle_description: Needs high daily exercise and companionship. Prone to deafness.
content: Famous for its association with horses and fire carriages.

name: Dandie Dinmont Terrier
description: A small, unique terrier from Scotland, known for its long body, short legs, and characteristic topknot.
history_description: Originated on the border of Scotland and England, used for hunting otter and badger.
coat_description: Mix of hard and soft hair, giving a crisp texture. Colors: Pepper (dark gray) or Mustard (fawn/red).
temperament_description: Independent, intelligent, and affectionate. Less feisty than many terriers.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate daily exercise. Good apartment dog.
content: Named after a character in Sir Walter Scott's novel *Guy Mannering*.

name: Danish Spitz
description: A medium-sized spitz-type dog from Denmark, known for its white, fluffy coat.
history_description: A very old Scandinavian breed, historically used as a companion and farm watchdog, especially popular with children.
coat_description: Long, thick, white or biscuit-colored coat.
temperament_description: Friendly, gentle, and playful. Excellent family companion.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate daily exercise and companionship.
activities_description: Companion activities and short bursts of play.
content: A rare breed with a calm and gentle disposition.

name: Danish–Swedish Farmdog
description: A small, versatile farm dog from Scandinavia, known for its compact build and lively temperament.
history_description: Used for herding, vermin control, and guarding on farms in Denmark and Sweden.
coat_description: Short, smooth, and dense coat. Colors: White with one or more patches of various colors (tan, black, brown).
temperament_description: Lively, alert, and friendly. Easily trained and enjoys performing tricks.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate daily exercise and mental stimulation. Good family dog.
content: Historically known as the 'Skåne Terrier'.

name: Denmark Feist
description: A small, agile hunting dog from the U.S., known for its determination in hunting small game.
history_description: An American hunting dog, part of the 'Feist' group, specializing in hunting squirrels and small treeing game.
coat_description: Short, smooth coat. Colors: Variable, often black, tan, or brindle.
temperament_description: Brave, energetic, and highly focused on the hunt. Loyal to its owner.
lifestyle_description: Needs high daily exercise and is best suited for hunting homes.
content: A rugged working dog with a high prey drive.

name: Dikkulak
description: A small, primitive-type dog from Turkey, known for its spitz-like appearance and upright ears.
history_description: A landrace dog from Turkey, used for hunting and guarding farms. The name means 'erect ears'.
coat_description: Short to medium coat. Colors: Fawn, red, or black and tan.
temperament_description: Alert, intelligent, and reserved with strangers. Independent.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate daily exercise and mental stimulation.
content: An old, native Turkish breed.

name: Dingo
description: A canid native to Australia, often considered a separate species or subspecies of the wolf.
history_description: Arrived in Australia approximately 4,000 years ago. An apex predator and wild dog, not a domesticated breed.
coat_description: Short, dense coat. Colors: Ginger, yellow, red, or sable.
temperament_description: Wary, highly independent, and wild. Not suited as a typical pet.
lifestyle_description: Wild animal, needs a vast territory and is highly independent.
content: Plays a vital role in the Australian ecosystem.

name: Dobermann
description: An elegant, muscular, and highly intelligent German working dog, known for its loyalty and fearlessness.
history_description: Developed in Germany by Karl Friedrich Louis Dobermann (tax collector) in the late 19th century for personal protection.
coat_description: Short, smooth, and hard coat. Colors: Black, red, blue, or fawn (Isabella), all with rust markings.
temperament_description: Intelligent, fearless, and highly devoted to family. Excellent guard dog.
lifestyle_description: Needs intense daily exercise and constant mental stimulation. Requires firm, positive training.
activities_description: Police work, Schutzhund, obedience, and agility.
content: Known as the 'Dog of the Tax Collector'.

name: Dogo Argentino
description: A large, powerful Argentine mastiff, known for its pure white coat and athletic build.
history_description: Created in Argentina in 1928 by Dr. Antonio Nores Martínez for hunting large game (wild boar and puma).
coat_description: Short, smooth, and pure white coat (black spots allowed but discouraged).
temperament_description: Courageous, protective, and affectionate with family. Can be dominant and needs experienced handling.
lifestyle_description: Needs high daily exercise and experienced, firm training. High prey drive.
activities_description: Big game hunting and protection sports.
content: Known for its immense power and impressive white musculature.

name: Dogo Sardesco
description: A medium/large working dog from the island of Sardinia, used for herding and guarding.
history_description: An ancient, rustic working dog of Sardinia, used for herding, guarding livestock, and hunting.
coat_description: Short, dense coat. Colors: Fawn, black, brindle, or gray.
