temperament_description: Strong, courageous, and highly territorial. Independent worker.
lifestyle_description: Needs a working role and extensive daily exercise.
content: Known for its highly developed sense of smell and great endurance.

name: Dogue Brasileiro
description: A medium-sized Brazilian mastiff, developed as a versatile farm and guard dog.
history_description: Created in Brazil in the 1970s by crossing the Bull Terrier and the Boxer.
coat_description: Short, smooth coat. Colors: All colors, except solid white or brindle with a white base.
temperament_description: Protective, loyal, and energetic. Can be dominant and needs early socialization.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate daily exercise and firm training.
content: A strong, versatile dog with a stable temperament.

name: Dogue de Bordeaux
description: A massive, powerful French mastiff, known for its huge head and short, wrinkled face.
history_description: An ancient French breed, historically used for guarding, hunting big game, and fighting.
coat_description: Short, fine, and soft coat. Colors: All shades of fawn (from mahogany to Isabella), with a red or black mask.
temperament_description: Calm, protective, and highly devoted to family. Patient with children.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate daily exercise. Does not tolerate heat well. Prone to drooling.
content: Also known as the French Mastiff. Known for its massive, expressive head.

name: Donggyeongi
description: A medium-sized Korean spitz-type dog, known for its naturally short or bobbed tail.
history_description: An ancient Korean native dog from the Gyeongju region, historically used as a companion and farm dog.
coat_description: Medium-length, dense double coat. Colors: White, yellow, or black.
temperament_description: Intelligent, loyal, and gentle with family. Reserved with strangers.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate daily exercise. Adaptable to various conditions.
content: The defining characteristic is the bobtail (or lack of tail).

name: Drentse Patrijshond
description: A medium-sized, versatile Dutch pointing dog, known for its beautiful coat and devotion.
history_description: Originated in the Drenthe province of the Netherlands, used as a multi-purpose gundog (pointing and retrieving).
coat_description: Medium-length, dense coat with feathering. Colors: White with brown or orange markings.
temperament_description: Intelligent, eager to please, and highly devoted. A calm but driven hunter.
lifestyle_description: Needs high daily exercise and is best for active owners or hunting homes.
content: A gentle and highly trainable breed.

name: Drever
description: A small/medium scenthound from Sweden, known for its long body and keen hunting skills.
history_description: A short-legged Swedish hound used for hunting deer and elk, known for its deep baying voice.
coat_description: Short, dense coat. Colors: All colors with white markings.
temperament_description: Energetic, courageous, and highly independent when hunting. Affectionate indoors.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate to high daily exercise and is driven by scent.
content: The national scenthound breed of Sweden.

name: Dunker
description: A medium-sized Norwegian scenthound, known for its endurance and unique piebald coat.
history_description: Bred in Norway by Wilhelm Dunker in the early 19th century for hunting rabbit in packs.
coat_description: Short, smooth, and dense coat. Colors: Black or blue marbled with white markings.
temperament_description: Energetic, hardy, and highly persistent on the trail. Docile at home.
lifestyle_description: Needs high daily exercise and a secure place to run.
content: One of the few Norwegian hound breeds.

name: Dutch Shepherd
description: A medium-sized herding dog from the Netherlands, known for its versatility and brindle coat.
history_description: Used by farmers in the Netherlands for herding, guarding, and general farm work.
coat_description: Three varieties: Short, Long, and Wire-haired. Colors: Fawn or reddish brindle is defining.
temperament_description: Highly intelligent, extremely active, and loyal. Needs constant mental and physical work.
lifestyle_description: Requires intensive daily exercise and a job to do. Best for experienced owners.
activities_description: Herding, police work, Schutzhund, and agility.
content: Known for its intense work ethic and highly developed herding instincts.

name: Dutch Smoushond
description: A small, spirited Dutch dog, known for its shaggy, yellowish coat and resemblance to a small terrier.
history_description: Used in the Netherlands for centuries to catch rats in stables and carriages. Nearly extinct after WWII.
coat_description: Rough, shaggy, and straight coat. Colors: Solid yellow (shades of straw to reddish-yellow).
temperament_description: Friendly, lively, and intelligent. Energetic and devoted.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate daily exercise. Good apartment dog if exercised.
content: The name means 'shaggy-muzzled dog'.

name: East Siberian Laika
description: A large, powerful Russian spitz-type hunting dog from Eastern Siberia.
history_description: A multi-purpose hunting dog used in the vast forests of Eastern Siberia for hunting large game (bear, moose) and pulling sleds.
coat_description: Thick, coarse double coat. Colors: Gray, black, red, or white, often with patches.
temperament_description: Brave, independent, and highly driven hunter. Reserved with strangers.
lifestyle_description: Needs extensive daily exercise and is best suited for cold climates and working roles.
content: A rugged and hardy breed, well-adapted to the harsh Siberian wilderness.

name: East European Shepherd
description: A large, strong German Shepherd type dog developed in the Soviet Union.
history_description: Bred by the Soviet military in the 1930s/40s, specifically to create a larger, hardier version of the German Shepherd that could withstand the Russian climate.
coat_description: Thick, medium-length coat. Colors: Black and tan, black and sable, or solid black.
temperament_description: Intelligent, calm, and protective. Highly trainable and devoted.
lifestyle_description: Needs high daily exercise and mental stimulation. Best for experienced owners.
activities_description: Police work, guarding, and search & rescue.
content: Developed for military and police use in extreme cold.

name: Ecuadorian Hairless Dog
description: A small, primitive hairless dog from Ecuador, known for its slender build.
history_description: An ancient breed from Ecuador, believed to be the only remaining descendant of hairless dogs of pre-Inca cultures.
coat_description: Hairless (sparse tufts allowed). Skin color varies widely.
temperament_description: Lively, affectionate, and alert. Can be reserved with strangers.
lifestyle_description: Good apartment dog. Needs sun protection and warmth.
content: One of the rarest hairless breeds.

name: English Cocker Spaniel
description: A medium-sized spaniel, known for its dome-shaped head, long ears, and constant tail-wagging.
history_description: Developed in England for flushing woodcock (Cocker) from dense cover.
coat_description: Medium-length, silky coat with feathering. Colors: Variable (solid, parti-color, roan).
temperament_description: Happy, eager-to-please, and devoted. Highly energetic and loves to work.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate to high daily exercise and mental stimulation. Requires regular grooming.
content: Known for its perpetual cheerful expression and boundless energy.

name: English Foxhound
description: A large, sturdy scenthound bred primarily for hunting foxes in large packs.
history_description: Developed in England for riding-to-hounds fox hunting. Has remained virtually unchanged for centuries.
coat_description: Short, dense, and glossy coat. Colors: Any hound color (typically tricolor).
temperament_description: Friendly, social (loves packs), and tireless hunter. Not well suited as a house pet.
lifestyle_description: Requires extreme amounts of exercise and is best suited for rural pack life.
content: The quintessential fox hunting dog, often maintained only in working kennels.

name: English Mastiff
description: A massive, imposing dog, the largest and heaviest of the dog breeds.
history_description: An ancient English breed, descended from the dogs of war. Used historically for guarding estates.
coat_description: Short, smooth, and dense coat. Colors: Fawn, apricot, or brindle, always with a black mask.
temperament_description: Dignified, gentle, and utterly devoted. A gentle giant and natural guardian.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate daily exercise. Best with experienced owners who can handle its size. Prone to drooling.
content: Known for its vast size and calm demeanor.

name: English Setter
description: An elegant, medium-sized gundog, known for its beautiful speckled coat and gentle nature.
history_description: Developed in England for setting (crouching) when locating game birds.
coat_description: Long, silky coat with heavy feathering. Colors: Belton (white with spots/ticking of blue, lemon, orange, or liver).
temperament_description: Gentle, friendly, and good-natured. Highly energetic when hunting, but docile at home.
lifestyle_description: Needs high daily exercise. Needs regular grooming.
content: Known for its elegant movement and affectionate nature.

name: English Shepherd
description: A medium-sized, versatile working dog from the U.S., used for herding and general farm work.
history_description: Developed in the U.S. from farm collies for herding, guarding, and vermin control.
coat_description: Medium-length, wavy or straight coat. Colors: Black and tan, black and white, sable and white, or tricolor.
temperament_description: Intelligent, loyal, and highly energetic. Needs a job to do.
lifestyle_description: Needs constant, vigorous exercise and mental stimulation. Best suited for farm life.
content: Known for being the 'Velcro dog' of the farm.

name: English Springer Spaniel
description: A medium-sized gundog, known for its high energy, feathered coat, and role in 'springing' game.
history_description: One of the oldest spaniel breeds, developed in England for flushing (springing) game birds into the air for the gunner.
coat_description: Medium-length, flat or wavy coat with feathering. Colors: Black or liver with white markings (or roan/ticked).
temperament_description: Friendly, enthusiastic, and eager to please. Highly energetic and excels at retrieving.
lifestyle_description: Needs high daily exercise and a working role (retrieving). Requires regular grooming.
content: A versatile and highly trainable gundog.

name: English Toy Terrier (Black & Tan)
description: A small, elegant toy terrier from England, known for its black and tan coat and large, upright ears.
history_description: Developed in England (Manchester) in the 19th century from the Old English Black and Tan Terrier for ratting.
coat_description: Short, fine, and glossy coat. Colors: Black with rich tan markings.
temperament_description: Lively, alert, and affectionate. Good companion dog.
lifestyle_description: Good apartment dog, needs moderate daily exercise and warmth.
content: Known for its 'candle flame' shaped ears and elegant frame.

name: Entlebucher Mountain Dog
description: A medium-sized, compact Swiss mountain dog, the smallest of the four Sennenhund breeds.
history_description: Originated in the Entlebuch region of Switzerland, traditionally used for herding cattle.
coat_description: Short, dense, and stiff coat. Always tricolor (black, rust, and white).
temperament_description: Intelligent, energetic, and highly devoted to family. Can be reserved with strangers.
lifestyle_description: Needs high daily exercise and mental stimulation (prone to herding/nipping).
content: Known for its powerful build and tireless work ethic.

name: Erbi Txakur
description: A rare, medium-sized Basque scenthound from Spain, known for its speed and agility.
history_description: A traditional hunting dog of the Basque Country, used for hunting rabbit and hare in packs.
coat_description: Short, dense coat. Colors: Typically white with orange or fawn patches.
temperament_description: Energetic, determined hunter, and highly focused on scent.
lifestyle_description: Needs extensive daily exercise and hunting work.
content: A hardy, traditional Spanish hound.

name: Estonian Hound
description: A small/medium scenthound from Estonia, known for its determination and musical voice.
history_description: The only official dog breed of Estonia, developed in the mid-20th century for hunting small game.
coat_description: Short, smooth, and dense coat. Colors: Black and tan with white markings.
temperament_description: Energetic, good-natured, and highly focused when hunting. Affectionate at home.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate to high daily exercise and is driven by scent.
content: A relatively new breed, developed to meet Soviet regulations on dog size.

name: Estrela Mountain Dog
description: A large, imposing Portuguese livestock guardian dog, known for its protective nature.
history_description: One of the oldest breeds in Portugal, used for guarding flocks against predators in the Estrela mountains.
coat_description: Long, thick, and coarse or short, thick coat. Colors: Fawn, wolf gray, or yellow (often with white markings).
temperament_description: Intelligent, courageous, and fiercely protective. Calm and devoted to family.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate daily exercise and a large, secure area. Requires firm training.
content: Known for its distinctive head and powerful build.

name: Eurasier
description: A medium-sized spitz-type companion dog from Germany, known for its beautiful coat and calm temperament.
history_description: Created in Germany in the 1960s by crossing the Chow Chow, Wolfspitz, and later the Samoyed.
coat_description: Medium-length, dense double coat. Colors: All colors except pure white and liver.
temperament_description: Calm, confident, and devoted to family. Reserved with strangers but not aggressive.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate daily exercise and companionship. Does not do well alone.
content: Bred solely for companionship, combining the best traits of its founding breeds.

name: Faroese Sheepdog
description: A medium-sized, hardy herding dog from the Faroe Islands.
history_description: A primitive Nordic breed, descending from dogs brought by the Vikings. Used for herding sheep on the Faroese hills.
coat_description: Medium-length, dense double coat. Colors: Variable (gray, black, or brown with markings).
temperament_description: Intelligent, energetic, and highly devoted to its flock and owner. Hardy.
lifestyle_description: Needs extensive daily exercise and is best suited for cold climates and working roles.
content: Closely related to the Icelandic Sheepdog.

name: Field Spaniel
description: A medium-sized, long-bodied spaniel from England, known for its long, rich coat.
history_description: Originally bred in England as an all-black variety of the land spaniels; later developed as a gundog.
coat_description: Long, silky, single coat with heavy feathering. Colors: Black, liver, roan, or gold.
temperament_description: Gentle, sensitive, and devoted. A playful and steady companion.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate daily exercise. Requires regular grooming.
content: Known for its elegant appearance and docile nature.

name: Fila Brasileiro
description: A large, powerful Brazilian mastiff, known for its distinct gait and immense loyalty.
history_description: Developed in Brazil from Mastiffs and Bloodhounds. Used for guarding, tracking, and cattle herding.
coat_description: Short, smooth, and dense coat. Colors: Fawn, black, or brindle (often with a black mask).
temperament_description: Extremely loyal and fiercely protective (has an innate aversion to strangers). Requires highly experienced handling.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate daily exercise and a working role. Not suited for urban life or novice owners.
activities_description: Guard duty, tracking, and cattle herding.
content: Known for its 'cow-like' gait and massive, loose-skinned body.

name: Finnish Hound
description: A medium-sized scenthound from Finland, known for its stamina and smooth coat.
history_description: Developed in Finland in the 19th century from various European hounds for hunting hare and fox.
coat_description: Short, dense, and smooth coat. Colors: Tricolor (black, tan, and white).
temperament_description: Energetic, determined hunter, but calm and docile at home. Good with children.
lifestyle_description: Needs high daily exercise and is best suited for hunting homes.
content: The most common hound breed in Finland.

name: Finnish Lapphund
description: A medium-sized spitz-type dog from Finland, used for herding reindeer.
history_description: Used by the Sami people of Lapland for herding reindeer for centuries.
coat_description: Thick, long, and abundant double coat. Colors: All colors are permissible (black, brown, gray, etc.).
temperament_description: Intelligent, brave, and deeply devoted to family. Barks often.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate daily exercise and mental stimulation. Sheds heavily.
content: Known for its 'watchful' but gentle expression.

name: Finnish Spitz
description: A medium-sized spitz-type dog, the national dog of Finland, known for its fox-like appearance and constant barking.
history_description: Used for centuries in Finland for hunting game birds (pointing to the birds by barking).
coat_description: Thick, medium-length double coat. Colors: Golden red or red-yellow.
temperament_description: Lively, alert, and intelligent. Energetic but can be independent. Highly vocal (barking).
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate daily exercise and a cold environment.
activities_description: Barking at game birds and hunting.
content: Known as the 'Barking Bird Dog'.

name: Flat-coated Retriever
description: A medium/large, elegant retriever known for its long, sleek, black or liver coat.
history_description: Developed in England in the mid-19th century from a mix of setters, spaniels, and other retrievers for gundog work.
coat_description: Dense, fine, and flat coat of medium length. Colors: Solid black or solid liver.
temperament_description: High-spirited, optimistic, and highly intelligent. Maintains a puppy-like enthusiasm for life.
lifestyle_description: Needs high daily exercise and a working role (retrieving). Requires regular grooming.
content: Known as the 'Peter Pan' of the retriever world due to its slow maturity.

name: Florida Brown Dog a/k/a Florida Cracker Cur
description: A medium-sized cur-type dog from the U.S. Southeast, used for herding and hog hunting.
history_description: An all-purpose working dog used by Florida cattlemen ('Crackers') for herding and catching feral hogs.
coat_description: Short, dense coat. Colors: Often brown, fawn, yellow, or brindle.
temperament_description: Intelligent, strong drive, and loyal. Protective of its charges.
lifestyle_description: Needs a job to do and daily vigorous exercise. Best for rural settings.
content: A rugged working dog well-adapted to the Florida climate.

name: French Bulldog
description: A small, muscular companion dog known for its bat ears and smushed face.
history_description: Originated in England as a miniature Bulldog, later gained popularity in France as a companion for lacemakers.
coat_description: Short, smooth, and brilliant coat. Colors: Brindle, fawn, white, or pied.
temperament_description: Affectionate, playful, and charming. Good apartment dog.
lifestyle_description: Needs minimal daily exercise. Cannot tolerate heat or excessive activity due to breathing issues.
content: Known for its unique, large, naturally upright 'bat ears'.

name: French Spaniel
description: A medium/large, elegant French pointing spaniel, known for its rich brown and white coat.
history_description: One of the oldest spaniel breeds, dating back to the 14th century. Used as a gundog in France.
coat_description: Long, dense, and wavy coat with heavy feathering. Colors: White with brown markings (often roan or ticked).
temperament_description: Gentle, intelligent, and highly devoted. Eager to please and easy to train.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate to high daily exercise and is best suited for an active family.
content: Highly prized for its gentle nature and beautiful appearance.

name: Galgo Español
description: A tall, slender Spanish sighthound, known for its athleticism and large heart.
history_description: An ancient Spanish breed, used for coursing hare in open fields.
coat_description: Short, fine, and smooth or rough coat. Colors: All colors are permissible.
temperament_description: Calm, gentle, and quiet indoors. Explosively fast outdoors. Sensitive.
lifestyle_description: Needs a securely fenced area for sprinting. Moderate daily exercise.
content: Similar to the Greyhound but built for endurance over speed.

name: Gascon Saintongeois
description: A large, elegant French scenthound, known for its power and unique black and white coloring.
history_description: Developed in France by crossing the Grand Bleu de Gascogne with the extinct Saintonge Hound.
size_description: Large. Two sizes: Grand (Large) and Petite (Medium).
coat_description: Short, smooth coat. Colors: White with black patching and black ticking (often a blue tint).
temperament_description: Energetic, courageous hunter, but docile and friendly at home.
lifestyle_description: Needs to be kept in a working pack and requires extensive exercise.
content: Known for its distinctive dark blue-black coloring.

name: Gaucho sheepdog
description: A medium-sized herding dog from South America, used by the Gauchos for working livestock.
history_description: A traditional, rustic herding dog used on ranches in Southern Brazil, Uruguay, and Argentina.
coat_description: Medium-length, dense coat. Colors: Variable, often black, tan, or gray.
temperament_description: Intelligent, tireless worker, and devoted to its owner. Highly energetic.
lifestyle_description: Needs a working role and intensive daily exercise.
content: A rugged and enduring working dog.

name: Georgian Shepherd
description: A large, imposing livestock guardian dog from the Republic of Georgia.
history_description: An ancient landrace breed from the Caucasus region, used for protecting flocks from predators.
coat_description: Thick, coarse coat (long or short). Colors: Variable, often white with patches, gray, or fawn.
temperament_description: Fiercely protective, calm, and independent. Highly wary of strangers.
lifestyle_description: Needs a vast working space and experienced handling. Not suited for city life.
content: A powerful dog known for its bravery against wolves.

name: German Hound
description: A medium-sized German scenthound, known for its endurance and tricolor coat.
history_description: Developed in Germany in the late 19th century from various German hounds for hunting hare and fox.
coat_description: Short, dense, and smooth coat. Colors: Tricolor (black, red, and white).
temperament_description: Energetic, determined hunter, and highly focused on scent.
lifestyle_description: Needs high daily exercise and is best suited for hunting homes.
content: A robust and efficient hunting dog.

name: German Longhaired Pointer
description: A medium/large German pointing dog, known for its long, wavy coat and versatility.
history_description: One of the oldest German pointers, used as a versatile gundog (pointing, tracking, retrieving) on land and water.
coat_description: Medium-length, slightly wavy coat with feathering. Colors: Solid brown, or brown and white (roan).
temperament_description: Intelligent, gentle, and highly devoted. Eager to please and easy to train.
lifestyle_description: Needs high daily exercise and a working role. Good family dog if exercised.
content: Known for its elegant appearance and calm nature.

name: German Pinscher
description: A medium-sized German dog, known for its elegance, strength, and rat-catching history.
history_description: An old German breed, the ancestor of the Dobermann and Miniature Pinscher. Used as a ratter and guard dog.
coat_description: Short, dense, and smooth coat. Colors: Red, black and tan, or solid red.
temperament_description: Intelligent, highly energetic, and curious. Needs firm, consistent training.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate to high daily exercise and mental stimulation. Best for active owners.
content: Known for its highly developed sense of hearing and alertness.

name: German Roughhaired Pointer
description: A medium/large German pointing dog, similar to the Wirehaired Pointer but with a slightly less harsh coat.
history_description: A versatile German gundog, used for pointing and retrieving on all types of terrain.
coat_description: Rough, bristly coat, but not overly harsh. Colors: Brown or brown roan.
temperament_description: Intelligent, devoted, and a determined worker. Energetic and keen.
lifestyle_description: Needs high daily exercise and a working role.
content: A hardy and efficient gundog.

name: German Shepherd
description: A large, strong, and highly intelligent working dog, known for its versatility and loyalty.
history_description: Developed in Germany by Max von Stephanitz for herding sheep, quickly gaining popularity for military and police work.
coat_description: Medium-length, double coat. Colors: Black and tan (most common), sable, or solid black.
temperament_description: Intelligent, confident, and highly trainable. Reserved with strangers but intensely loyal to family.
lifestyle_description: Needs high daily exercise and constant mental stimulation. Best for active, experienced owners.
activities_description: Police and military work, guarding, herding, and Schutzhund.
content: One of the world's most recognizable and popular dog breeds.

name: German Shorthaired Pointer
description: A medium/large, elegant German pointing dog, known for its versatility and sleek build.
history_description: Developed in Germany in the 19th century as a multi-purpose gundog (pointing, tracking, retrieving) on land and water.
coat_description: Short, thick, and dense coat. Colors: Solid liver, or liver and white (ticked/patched).
temperament_description: Intelligent, eager to please, and highly energetic. Needs an active lifestyle.
lifestyle_description: Requires intensive daily exercise and a working role. Best for active, outdoor owners.
content: Known for its high drive and webbed feet for excellent swimming ability.

name: German Spaniel
description: A medium-sized German gundog, known for its thick, wavy coat and deep-set eyes.
history_description: Developed in Germany in the late 19th century for flushing and retrieving game from heavy cover.
coat_description: Long, thick, and wavy coat. Colors: Solid brown, or brown with white markings.
temperament_description: Lively, passionate hunter, but gentle and devoted to family. Good-natured.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate to high daily exercise and is best suited for hunting or active country homes.
content: Known for its excellent nose and strong swimming ability.

name: German Spitz
description: A medium-sized spitz-type dog from Germany, known for its dense coat and alert demeanor.
history_description: Descended from ancient Nordic dogs. Historically used as watchdogs and companions on farms.
size_description: Medium. Various sizes (Keeshond, Giant, Medium, Miniature, Toy).
coat_description: Long, thick, stand-off double coat. Colors: Black, brown, white, orange, etc.
temperament_description: Lively, intelligent, and highly alert. A naturally good watchdog (prone to barking).
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate daily exercise and companionship. Requires regular grooming.
content: The ancestor of many spitz breeds, including the Pomeranian.

name: German Wirehaired Pointer
description: A medium/large German pointing dog, known for its versatility and harsh, wiry coat and beard.
history_description: Developed in Germany in the late 19th century for gundog work across diverse terrains and water.
coat_description: Harsh, wiry, and dense coat (must have a beard and eyebrows). Colors: Liver and white or solid liver.
temperament_description: Intelligent, eager to please, and determined worker. Highly energetic.
lifestyle_description: Requires intensive daily exercise and a working role. Best for dedicated hunting owners.
content: The rugged coat provides excellent protection in dense cover and cold water.

name: Giant Schnauzer
description: A large, powerful working dog from Germany, the largest of the three Schnauzer breeds.
history_description: Originated in Bavaria, Germany, used for driving cattle and guarding breweries and stockyards.
coat_description: Hard, wiry, and dense outer coat (must have a beard and eyebrows). Colors: Solid black or salt and pepper.
temperament_description: Intelligent, loyal, and highly protective. Can be dominant and needs firm training.
lifestyle_description: Needs high daily exercise and mental stimulation. Requires regular grooming (stripping/clipping).
activities_description: Police work, guard duty, Schutzhund, and agility.
content: A dignified and fearless guardian.

name: Glen of Imaal Terrier
description: A small, sturdy Irish terrier, known for its long body, short legs, and serious demeanor.
history_description: Originated in the Glen of Imaal valley in Ireland. Used for hunting badger and fox, and historically, turning spits for cooking.
coat_description: Medium-length, harsh, and wiry coat. Colors: Blue brindle or wheaten.
temperament_description: Plucky, spirited, and quiet. Devoted to family but less excitable than most terriers.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate daily exercise. Good apartment dog.
content: Known for working silently, unlike many noisy terriers.

name: Golden Retriever
description: A medium/large gundog, known for its beautiful golden coat and friendly, devoted nature.
history_description: Developed in Scotland in the mid-19th century by Lord Tweedmouth for retrieving waterfowl from land and water.
coat_description: Dense, water-repellent, straight or wavy coat with feathering. Colors: Various shades of gold or cream.
temperament_description: Intelligent, friendly, and eager to please. Excellent family dog and highly trainable.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate to high daily exercise and mental stimulation. Loves water and fetching.
content: One of the most popular family dog breeds worldwide.

name: Gończy Polski
description: A medium-sized Polish scenthound, known for its black and tan coat and agility.
history_description: A traditional Polish hunting hound, used for tracking and hunting small game, fox, and wild boar.
coat_description: Short, dense, and close coat. Colors: Black and tan (most common), or brown and tan.
temperament_description: Energetic, courageous, and highly determined hunter. Calm and devoted at home.
lifestyle_description: Needs high daily exercise and a working role.
content: Known for its beautiful, melodious baying voice.

name: Gordon Setter
description: A large, elegant setter from Scotland, known for its rich black and tan coat.
history_description: Developed in Scotland by the 4th Duke of Gordon for hunting game birds (setting/pointing).
coat_description: Medium-length, straight or slightly wavy coat with feathering. Colors: Rich coal black with deep mahogany/chestnut markings.
temperament_description: Intelligent, loyal, and steady. Energetic in the field, but dignified at home.
lifestyle_description: Needs high daily exercise and a working role. Requires regular grooming.
content: The heaviest and slowest of the setter breeds, built for endurance.

name: Grand Anglo-Français Blanc et Noir
description: A very large French scenthound, a cross between English and French hounds, known for hunting large game.
history_description: A large French pack hound, created by crossing French hounds with English Foxhounds.
coat_description: Short, smooth coat. Colors: White and black (often with tan markings on the face).
temperament_description: Energetic, highly driven, and social in the pack. Not suitable as a house pet.
lifestyle_description: Needs to be kept in a working pack and requires extensive exercise.
content: One of the largest hounds used for traditional French hunting.

name: Grand Anglo-Français Blanc et Orange
description: A very large French scenthound, known for its white and orange coat and hunting ability.
history_description: A large French pack hound, created by crossing French hounds with English Foxhounds.
coat_description: Short, smooth coat. Colors: White and orange (or lemon).
temperament_description: Energetic, enthusiastic hunter, and docile in the pack.
lifestyle_description: Needs to be kept in a working pack and requires extensive exercise.
content: Known for its speed and stamina.

name: Grand Anglo-Français Tricolore
description: A very large French scenthound, known for its tricolor coat and powerful build.
history_description: A large French pack hound, created by crossing French hounds with English Foxhounds.
coat_description: Short, smooth coat. Colors: Tricolor (black, white, and tan).
temperament_description: Energetic, highly driven, and social in the pack.
lifestyle_description: Needs to be kept in a working pack and requires extensive exercise.
content: A high-performance hunting dog.

name: Grand Basset Griffon Vendéen
description: A medium-sized French scenthound with a shaggy coat, known for its long, distinguished head.
history_description: Bred in the Vendée region of France for hunting hare and rabbit in thick cover.
coat_description: Long, rough, and shaggy coat. Colors: White with orange, lemon, or black patches.
temperament_description: Energetic, highly determined hunter, but friendly and social. Can be stubborn.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate to high daily exercise and a securely fenced area (high prey drive).
content: Known for its long, shaggy eyebrows and beard.

name: Grand Bleu de Gascogne
description: A large, imposing French scenthound with a unique mottled blue coat and deep bay.
history_description: An ancient breed from Gascony, France, used for hunting large game (boar and wolf).
coat_description: Short, smooth coat. Colors: White mottled with black, giving a slate-blue appearance (with tan markings).
temperament_description: Calm, dignified, and highly focused on scent. Very deep, mournful baying voice.
lifestyle_description: Needs extensive daily exercise and a large, secure space. Best for experienced owners.
content: One of the largest and most impressive of the French Hounds.

name: Grand Griffon Vendéen
description: A large French scenthound with a shaggy, rough coat, known for its speed and agility.
history_description: The largest of the four Griffon Vendéen breeds, used for hunting boar and deer in the dense Vendée region.
coat_description: Long, rough, and shaggy coat. Colors: Fawn, orange, black, or tricolor.
temperament_description: Brave, determined hunter, but social and friendly in the pack.
lifestyle_description: Needs extensive outdoor exercise and a secure environment.
content: Known for its impressive size and endurance.

name: Great Dane
description: A giant, noble, and muscular dog, known as the 'Apollo of Dogs'.
history_description: Originated in Germany. Used for hunting wild boar and guarding noble estates.
coat_description: Short, smooth, and glossy coat. Colors: Fawn, brindle, blue, black, harlequin (white with black patches), or mantle (black and white).
temperament_description: Gentle, friendly, and highly devoted to family. Patient with children.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate daily exercise. Requires large living space. Short life expectancy.
content: One of the tallest dog breeds in the world.

name: Greater Swiss Mountain Dog
description: A large, sturdy, and heavy working dog, the largest of the four Swiss Sennenhund breeds.
history_description: Used in the Swiss Alps for herding, guarding, and pulling carts (drafting).
coat_description: Short, dense, and thick double coat. Always tricolor (black, rust, and white).
temperament_description: Confident, good-natured, and highly devoted. Calm and steady temperament.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate daily exercise and a purpose (pulling). Requires a large space.
content: Known for its immense strength and friendly nature.

name: Greek Harehound
description: A medium-sized scenthound from Greece, known for its black and tan coat and strong hunting drive.
history_description: The only official Greek scenthound, used for hunting hare in mountainous terrain.
coat_description: Short, dense, and smooth coat. Colors: Black and tan (always tricolor).
temperament_description: Energetic, brave, and persistent hunter. Highly driven by scent.
lifestyle_description: Needs extensive daily exercise and hunting work.
content: Known for its stamina and ability to work in difficult conditions.

name: Greek Shepherd
description: A large, imposing livestock guardian dog from Greece, known for its protective nature.
history_description: Used for millennia in Greece to protect flocks from wolves and bears in the mountains.
coat_description: Thick, dense, and semi-long coat. Colors: White, gray, black, or fawn.
temperament_description: Fiercely protective, independent, and courageous. Highly wary of strangers.
lifestyle_description: Needs a working role and vast space. Not suited for city life.
content: A traditional guardian dog, valued for its ability to work independently.

name: Greenland Dog
description: A large, powerful Arctic working dog, one of the oldest and purest working breeds.
history_description: Developed in Greenland, used for centuries by the Inuit for hauling heavy sleds in frigid conditions.
coat_description: Very thick, dense, and double coat. Colors: All colors are permissible (common: black, white, gray).
temperament_description: Brave, independent, and highly social with people. Needs a working role.
lifestyle_description: Requires vigorous daily exercise and a job (sledding/hauling). Not suited for hot climates.
content: Highly valued for its strength, endurance, and pack-working ability.

name: Greyhound
description: A tall, slender sighthound, known as the fastest dog breed on earth.
history_description: An ancient breed, tracing ancestry back to ancient Egypt. Bred for coursing game and racing.
coat_description: Short, smooth, and fine coat. Colors: All colors and patterns.
temperament_description: Gentle, calm, and quiet indoors ('45 mph couch potato'). Needs a securely fenced area for sprinting.
lifestyle_description: Needs daily bursts of running (sprinting). Surprisingly low endurance for long, sustained exercise.
content: Known for its double suspension gallop and elegant, streamlined body.

name: Griffon Bleu de Gascogne
description: A medium-sized French scenthound with a shaggy coat and mottled blue-gray color.
history_description: A cross between the Bleu de Gascogne hound and a rough-haired Griffon hound. Used for hunting small game.
coat_description: Rough, harsh, and shaggy coat. Colors: White mottled with black (blue appearance) with tan markings.
temperament_description: Energetic, determined hunter, but gentle and friendly at home.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate to high daily exercise and tracking work.
content: Known for its unique coat and deep, baying voice.

name: Griffon Bruxellois
description: A small, sturdy toy dog from Belgium, known for its human-like expression and prominent beard/mustache.
history_description: Developed in Brussels, Belgium, from various terrier and toy breeds, used as watchdogs in cabs and stables.
coat_description: Rough (wirly, dense) or Smooth (short, glossy). Colors: Red, black, black and tan, or belgium (reddish-brown).
temperament_description: Lively, curious, and highly sensitive. Devoted to its owner.
lifestyle_description: Good apartment dog, needs moderate daily walks. Prone to separation anxiety.
content: Often known simply as the 'Brussels Griffon'.

name: Griffon Fauve de Bretagne
description: A medium-sized French scenthound with a rough, shaggy coat and reddish-fawn color.
history_description: An ancient breed from Brittany, France, used for hunting wild boar and deer in packs.
coat_description: Rough, harsh, and dense coat. Colors: Fawn (red-fawn or wheaten).
temperament_description: Brave, determined hunter, but gentle and affectionate with family. Highly social.
lifestyle_description: Needs extensive outdoor exercise and is best suited for working packs.
content: Known for its distinctive shaggy appearance and enthusiasm.

name: Griffon Nivernais
description: A medium-sized French scenthound with a shaggy, long coat and scruffy appearance.
history_description: A very old French breed, nearly extinct after the French Revolution. Used for hunting wild boar in the Nivernais region.
coat_description: Long, shaggy, and sparse coat. Colors: Gray, gray-blue, or fawn with black shading.
temperament_description: Passionate hunter, but calm and docile at home. Needs firm training.
lifestyle_description: Needs extensive daily exercise and is best suited for hunting homes.
content: Known for its unique coat and determined hunting style.

name: Gull Dong
description: A large, powerful Pakistani working dog, a cross between the Gull Terrier and Bully Kutta.
history_description: A strong, aggressive fighting and guard dog from Pakistan and India.
size_description: Giant. Can exceed 140 pounds and 30 inches tall.
coat_description: Short, dense coat. Colors: White is common, but also fawn, brindle, or black.
temperament_description: Fierce, highly territorial, and dominant. Requires highly experienced handling.
lifestyle_description: Not suitable as a pet. Needs a working role in guarding or protection.
content: Bred solely for protection and fighting in its native region.

name: Gull Terrier
description: A medium-sized, muscular terrier from Pakistan and India, used for fighting and guarding.
history_description: Bred in the Indian subcontinent from English fighting bull terriers. Used for fighting and protection.
coat_description: Short, smooth coat. Colors: White is most common.
temperament_description: Aggressive, highly determined, and dominant. Needs firm handling.
lifestyle_description: Needs a working role and experienced ownership. Highly dog-aggressive.
content: Also known as the Indian Bull Terrier.

name: Hällefors Elkhound
description: A medium-sized spitz-type dog from Sweden, used for hunting elk (moose).
history_description: Developed in the 1930s in the town of Hällefors, Sweden, for hunting elk.
coat_description: Thick, coarse double coat. Colors: Red or yellow-red, often with white markings.
temperament_description: Brave, energetic, and a determined hunter. Loyal to its family.
lifestyle_description: Needs extensive daily exercise and is best suited for hunting homes in cold climates.
activities_description: Hunting elk and other large game.
content: Known for its endurance and ability to track game in deep snow.

name: Halden Hound
description: A medium-sized Norwegian scenthound, known for its elegant build and tricolor coat.
history_description: Developed in the early 20th century in Halden, Norway, for hunting hare and fox.
coat_description: Short, dense, and smooth coat. Colors: White with black patches and tan markings on the head.
temperament_description: Energetic, determined hunter, but friendly and docile at home. Good with children.
lifestyle_description: Needs high daily exercise and is driven by scent. Needs a secure area.
content: A rare breed, highly valued in Norway for its hunting prowess.

name: Hamiltonstövare
description: A medium-sized Swedish scenthound, known for its athletic build and tricolor coat.
history_description: Developed in Sweden by Count Adolf Patrick Hamilton in the 19th century for hunting hare and fox.
coat_description: Short, coarse, and dense coat. Colors: Tricolor (black, white, and tan).
temperament_description: Energetic, determined hunter, but calm and friendly at home. Highly persistent.
lifestyle_description: Needs high daily exercise and is driven by scent. Best suited for country life.
content: The breed's founder also founded the Swedish Kennel Club.

name: Hanover Hound
description: A large German scenthound, known for its heavy build and specialization in tracking wounded game.
history_description: Descended from medieval German hunting hounds. Used exclusively for tracking wounded big game.
coat_description: Short, thick, and dense coat. Colors: Red fawn to brindle, often with a black mask.
temperament_description: Calm, devoted, and highly focused when tracking. Reserved with strangers.
lifestyle_description: Needs a purpose (tracking) and moderate daily exercise.
content: Highly revered in Germany as a specialized tracking dog.

name: Harrier
description: A medium-sized English scenthound, resembling a larger Beagle or smaller Foxhound.
history_description: Developed in England for hunting hare (harriers) in packs.
coat_description: Short, smooth, and dense coat. Colors: Tricolor or any hound color.
temperament_description: Energetic, enthusiastic hunter, but friendly and sociable. Good with children.
lifestyle_description: Needs high daily exercise and is best kept in a pack or highly active family.
content: Named for its ability to hunt hare ('harry').

name: Havanese
description: A small, sturdy companion dog, the national dog of Cuba, known for its long, silky coat.
history_description: Descended from the Bichon family (like the Bichon Frise and Maltese). Developed in Cuba as a companion for wealthy families.
coat_description: Long, silky, wavy coat. Colors: All colors are permissible (white, black, fawn, brown, etc.).
temperament_description: Intelligent, cheerful, and highly social. Excellent lap dog.
lifestyle_description: Good apartment dog. Needs moderate daily exercise and regular grooming.
content: The only dog breed native to Cuba.

name: Himalayan Sheepdog
description: A large, powerful livestock guardian dog from the Himalayan region.
history_description: Used by shepherds in the Himalayan mountains to protect flocks against large predators (snow leopard, wolf).
coat_description: Thick, long double coat. Colors: Black, black and tan, or solid gray/brown.
temperament_description: Fiercely protective, independent, and courageous. Highly suspicious of strangers.
lifestyle_description: Needs a vast working space and is best suited for cold climates and guarding roles.
content: A rugged and imposing mastiff type.

name: Hmong bobtail dog
description: A medium-sized dog from Vietnam and China, known for its naturally short tail and high intelligence.
history_description: Used by the Hmong people for hunting, guarding, and herding.
coat_description: Short, dense double coat. Colors: Black, red, or fawn.
temperament_description: Intelligent, brave, and loyal. Excellent hunter and guardian.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate to high daily exercise and mental stimulation.
content: The distinguishing feature is the natural bobtail (or no tail).

name: Hokkaido
description: A medium-sized Japanese spitz-type dog, known for its loyalty and endurance.
history_description: One of the six native Japanese spitz breeds. Used for hunting bear and other large game in the mountainous Hokkaido region.
coat_description: Thick, dense double coat. Colors: Red, white, black, sesame, or brindle.
temperament_description: Brave, reserved with strangers, and highly devoted to family. Independent.
lifestyle_description: Needs high daily exercise and is best suited for cold climates.
content: A national monument of Japan.

name: Hovawart
description: A large German working dog, known for its balanced temperament and strong guarding instinct.
history_description: A medieval German farm dog (Hofewart/Hovawart means 'farm guardian'). Revived in the 20th century for guarding and utility work.
coat_description: Long, strong, and wavy coat. Colors: Black, black and gold (tan), or blonde.
temperament_description: Intelligent, calm, and protective. Devoted family dog that is slow to mature.
lifestyle_description: Needs high daily exercise and mental stimulation. Requires firm, consistent training.
activities_description: Guard duty, search & rescue, and obedience.
content: Known for its distinctive coat colors and stable temperament.

name: Huntaway
description: A large, strong herding dog from New Zealand, bred to use its loud, deep bark to drive sheep.
history_description: Developed in New Zealand for herding sheep in vast, hilly terrain, where a loud bark is essential for communication.
coat_description: Medium-length, double coat (smooth or rough). Colors: Black and tan (most common), or tricolor.
temperament_description: Intelligent, tireless worker, and devoted to its owner. Highly energetic.
lifestyle_description: Needs a full-time working role or intensive daily exercise. Best for rural areas.
content: Unique among herding dogs for using its *voice* rather than its *eye* to control sheep.

name: Hygen Hound
description: A medium-sized Norwegian scenthound, known for its elegant build and endurance.
history_description: Developed in Norway in the 19th century by Hans Fredrik Hygen for hunting hare.
coat_description: Short, dense, and smooth coat. Colors: Reddish-brown, black and tan, or white with patches.
temperament_description: Energetic, determined hunter, but gentle and loyal at home. Highly persistent.
lifestyle_description: Needs high daily exercise and is driven by scent. Needs a secure area.
content: A rare breed outside of Norway.

name: Ibizan Hound
description: A tall, slender sighthound from the Balearic Islands (Spain), known for its large, upright ears and elegance.
history_description: An ancient Mediterranean breed, used on the island of Ibiza for hunting rabbit without a gun.
coat_description: Smooth (short, hard) or Wire (longer, harsh) coat. Colors: Red and white, or solid red or white.
temperament_description: Affectionate, quiet, and gentle indoors. Highly energetic and independent when hunting.
lifestyle_description: Needs a securely fenced area for sprinting. Moderate daily exercise.
content: Known for its impressive jumping ability.

name: Icelandic Sheepdog
description: A medium-sized spitz-type dog, the only native dog breed of Iceland, known for its friendly nature.
history_description: Brought to Iceland by the Vikings in the 9th century. Used for herding sheep and horses.
coat_description: Medium or long, thick double coat. Colors: Fawn, brown, gray, or black, often with white markings.
temperament_description: Happy, friendly, and highly intelligent. Energetic and barks often.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate daily exercise and companionship. Best suited for cold climates.
content: A charming and enthusiastic Nordic breed.

name: Indian pariah dog
description: A primitive, medium-sized landrace dog native to the Indian subcontinent.
history_description: One of the oldest landrace dogs in the world, living freely in human settlements across India, Bangladesh, and Pakistan.
coat_description: Short, dense, and smooth coat. Colors: Fawn, brown, black, or pied.
temperament_description: Intelligent, highly adaptable, and independent. Can be reserved with strangers.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate daily exercise. Highly healthy and low-maintenance.
content: A healthy, self-sufficient dog that evolved through natural selection.

name: Indian Spitz
description: A small/medium Indian dog, closely related to the German Spitz, known for its fluffy coat and friendly nature.
history_description: Developed in India from the German Spitz, becoming popular due to its adaptability to the hot Indian climate.
size_description: Small/Medium. Two sizes: Small (under 15 lbs) and Great (15–30 lbs).
coat_description: Fluffy, dense double coat (sheds heavily). Colors: White is most common, but also cream or brown.
temperament_description: Intelligent, playful, and highly active. Good family companion.
lifestyle_description: Good apartment dog if exercised. Needs moderate daily activity.
activities_description: Companion activities and short bursts of play.
content: A highly popular pet breed in India.

name: Irish Red and White Setter
description: A medium/large Irish setter, known for its friendly nature and distinct red and white coat.
history_description: An older, original setter breed from Ireland, used for hunting game birds (setting/pointing).
coat_description: Medium-length, silky coat with feathering. Colors: Clearly defined solid red patches on a white base.
temperament_description: Energetic, affectionate, and intelligent. Highly devoted and trainable.
lifestyle_description: Needs high daily exercise and a working role. Best for active, outdoor owners.
content: A slightly stockier build than the Irish Setter.

name: Irish Setter
description: A large, elegant setter from Ireland, known for its solid mahogany red coat and boundless energy.
history_description: Developed in Ireland for hunting game birds. Bred to be a fast, wide-ranging gundog.
coat_description: Long, silky coat with heavy feathering. Colors: Solid mahogany or rich chestnut red.
temperament_description: Outgoing, high-spirited, and affectionate. Needs consistent training (slow to mature).
lifestyle_description: Requires intensive daily exercise and a working role. Needs a large, secure area.
content: Known for its stunning coat and enthusiastic nature.

name: Irish Terrier
description: A medium-sized terrier from Ireland, known for its bold nature and distinctive fiery red coat.
history_description: One of the oldest terrier breeds. Used as an all-purpose farm dog (ratter, guard, companion).
coat_description: Hard, wiry, and dense coat. Colors: Solid red, wheaten, or red wheaten.
temperament_description: Feisty, courageous, and highly devoted to family. Can be dog-aggressive.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate daily exercise and a securely fenced yard (high prey drive).
content: Known as the 'Daredevil' of the terrier group.

name: Irish Water Spaniel
description: A large, rugged spaniel, known for its curly liver coat and 'rat tail'.
history_description: One of the oldest and largest spaniel breeds. Developed in Ireland for retrieving waterfowl from icy waters.
coat_description: Mass of dense, tight curls (no undercoat). Colors: Solid liver.
temperament_description: Intelligent, clownish, and energetic. Highly devoted and loves water.
lifestyle_description: Needs high daily exercise, especially swimming and retrieving. Requires regular grooming.
content: Easily identified by its curly topknot and smooth, tapering tail ('rat tail').

name: Irish Wolfhound
description: A giant Irish sighthound, the tallest of all dog breeds, known for its rough coat and gentle nature.
history_description: An ancient Irish breed used for hunting wolf and large game.
coat_description: Rough, hard, and wiry coat. Colors: Gray, brindle, red, black, white, or fawn.
temperament_description: Gentle, patient, and highly devoted. A gentle giant.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate daily exercise (best in a secure, large space). Short life expectancy.
content: Known for its motto: 'Gentle when stroked, fierce when provoked.'

name: Istrian Coarse-haired Hound
description: A medium-sized scenthound from Croatia, known for its shaggy white and orange coat.
history_description: Used in the Istria region of Croatia for hunting fox and wild boar.
coat_description: Long, shaggy, and coarse coat (beard/eyebrows). Colors: White with orange or yellow markings.
temperament_description: Energetic, determined hunter, but calm and devoted to family. Highly vocal.
lifestyle_description: Needs high daily exercise and is driven by scent.
content: Known for its persistence and deep, loud baying voice.

name: Istrian Shorthaired Hound
description: A medium-sized scenthound from Croatia, known for its sleek white and orange coat.
history_description: Used in the Istria region of Croatia for hunting small game.
coat_description: Short, smooth, and dense coat. Colors: Pure white with orange or yellow markings.
temperament_description: Energetic, determined hunter, but friendly and docile at home. Good with children.
lifestyle_description: Needs high daily exercise and is driven by scent.
content: A high-performing, elegant hound.

name: Italian Greyhound
description: A small, slender sighthound, known for its extreme elegance and speed.
history_description: An ancient breed from the Mediterranean. Used as a companion dog and miniature sighthound for small game.
coat_description: Short, fine, and glossy coat. Colors: All colors and patterns (gray, fawn, black, etc.).
temperament_description: Affectionate, gentle, and sensitive. Fast but delicate (prone to leg breaks).
lifestyle_description: Good apartment dog. Needs bursts of running in a secure area. Needs warmth.
content: Known for its double-suspension gallop in miniature.

name: Jack Russell Terrier
description: A small, spirited terrier known for its boundless energy and hunting instinct.
history_description: Developed in England in the 19th century by Parson John Russell for fox hunting.
size_description: Small. Typically 10–12 inches tall, 13–17 pounds. Muscular and flexible.
coat_description: Can be smooth, broken, or rough-coated. Predominantly white with black or tan markings.
temperament_description: Energetic, bold, highly intelligent, and fearless. Requires strong, consistent training.
lifestyle_description: Not suitable for apartment life; needs a large, secured yard and constant mental stimulation. Prone to digging and barking.
activities_description: Agility, earthdog trials, flyball, and hunting.
content: Known for their high-jump ability and endless stamina.

name: Jagdterrier
description: A compact, robust German hunting terrier, also known as the German Hunt Terrier.
history_description: Bred in Germany after WWI from Fox Terriers, with a focus purely on hunting utility and dark coloration.
size_description: Small/Medium. Height around 13–16 inches, weight 17–22 pounds.
coat_description: Dense, harsh, and often wiry coat. Colors are black, dark brown, or grayish-black with tan markings.
temperament_description: Fearless, tenacious hunter, but can be friendly with family. Reserved with strangers.
lifestyle_description: Requires intensive exercise and a working role. Not suited for sedentary living.
activities_description: Hunting (especially underground work), tracking, and searching.
content: A high-drive dog prized for its versatility in various hunting scenarios.

name: Jämthund
description: A large, powerful Swedish spitz-type dog used primarily for hunting elk and moose.
history_description: Native to the northern regions of Sweden, this is one of the oldest Nordic breeds, used historically for hunting and sledding.
size_description: Large. Males: 22.8–24.8 inches, Females: 20.9–22.8 inches. Strong and muscular.
coat_description: Thick, double coat with medium-length, coarse hair. Gray/Wolf-gray with lighter markings.
temperament_description: Brave, energetic, and self-confident. Loyal to family but independent in the field.
lifestyle_description: Needs vast amounts of exercise and space. Best suited for rural or cold environments.
content: Also known as the Swedish Elkhound.

name: Japanese Chin
description: A refined, ancient toy breed distinguished by its oriental expression and luxurious coat.
history_description: Developed in Japan, likely originating from China. Prized as a lap dog for Japanese and Chinese royalty.
coat_description: Profuse, silky, straight coat. Colors are white with black or red markings.
temperament_description: Charming, happy, and sensitive. Known for its 'Chin spin' and cat-like behavior (climbing).
lifestyle_description: Excellent apartment dog, but prone to respiratory issues due to a flat face. Needs gentle exercise.
content: In Japan, it is known as 'Chin'.

name: Japanese Spitz
description: A fluffy, energetic companion dog known for its thick, pure white coat and fox-like face.
history_description: Developed in Japan in the 1920s and 30s by crossing various white Spitz breeds.
coat_description: Thick, double coat that is always pure white. Requires regular brushing.
temperament_description: Intelligent, playful, and fiercely loyal. Excellent watchdogs (prone to barking).
lifestyle_description: Good apartment dog if exercise needs are met. Moderate exercise required.
content: Despite their profuse coat, they are often surprisingly low-maintenance regarding dirt, as mud often brushes off easily.

name: Japanese Terrier
description: A rare, small terrier known for its short, smooth coat and striking color pattern (usually a black head on a white body).
history_description: Originated in Japan in the 17th century, resulting from crosses between local dogs and European smooth-haired terriers brought by Dutch traders.
coat_description: Very short, smooth, and glossy coat. A distinctive tri-color pattern with a black head is common.
temperament_description: Lively, cheerful, and affectionate. Highly responsive and quick to learn.
lifestyle_description: Excellent companion dog, sensitive to cold. Minimal grooming needs.
content: Almost exclusively found in Japan, making it one of the rarest breeds worldwide.

name: Jeju
description: An indigenous hunting dog breed from Jeju Island, South Korea.
history_description: A very rare native Korean breed that was nearly extinct. Efforts are ongoing to conserve the remaining population.
coat_description: Short and coarse coat, typically light brown or reddish-fawn.
temperament_description: Loyal, agile, and excellent hunter. Highly alert.
lifestyle_description: Requires significant exercise and space. Best suited for active owners.
content: Recognized as a Natural Monument by the South Korean government.

name: Jindo
description: A strong, medium-sized spitz-type dog native to Jindo Island, South Korea. Known for its fierce loyalty and intelligence.
history_description: Originated on Jindo Island. They are prized in Korea for their hunting abilities and are designated as a Natural Monument.
size_description: Medium. Males: 40–60 pounds. Well-proportioned and muscular.
coat_description: Thick, double coat in colors like red fawn, white, black, or brindle.
temperament_description: Extremely loyal to family but highly reserved and sometimes aggressive toward strangers and other dogs. Very independent.
lifestyle_description: Requires firm, experienced handling and extensive socialization. High exercise needs.
content: Famous for their homing instinct, capable of finding their way back over vast distances.

name: Jonangi
description: A rare, indigenous Indian breed often used by fishermen for herding ducks and as a hunting/guard dog.
history_description: Originating from the eastern coast of India (Andhra Pradesh), historically used for duck herding and guarding.
size_description: Medium. Lean, athletic build with a distinctive wrinkled forehead.
coat_description: Very short, fine coat. Colors include fawn, white, black, or brindle.
temperament_description: Alert, active, and affectionate with family. They are known to emit a 'yodel' instead of a bark.
lifestyle_description: Highly adaptable, needs space to run. Low maintenance grooming.
content: One of the few Indian breeds known to have a unique sound pattern.

name: Kai Ken
description: A rare and athletic Japanese spitz breed, known for its tiger-stripe coat (brindle).
history_description: Native to the mountainous region of Kai Province (Yamanashi Prefecture) in Japan, traditionally used to hunt boar and deer.
size_description: Medium. Muscular and agile, built for mountain terrain.
coat_description: Medium-length, double coat, always brindle (black, red, or medium brindle).
temperament_description: Intelligent, loyal, and a natural hunter. Known for their strong loyalty and tendency to bond tightly with one owner.
lifestyle_description: Requires significant daily exercise, especially running or hiking. Needs firm socialization.
content: Designated as a Natural Monument in Japan.

name: Kaikadi
description: A small, lean sighthound from Maharashtra, India, used for hunting small game.
history_description: Named after the Kaikadi nomadic tribe in Maharashtra, India. Bred for speed and agility.
size_description: Small. Extremely lean and lightweight, built for speed.
coat_description: Short, smooth coat. Colors vary (black, tan, white, spotted).
temperament_description: Lively, alert, and affectionate with its owners. Good watchdogs.
lifestyle_description: Needs running space; generally hardy and low-maintenance.
content: One of the lesser-known native Indian dog breeds.

name: Kamchatka Sled Dog
description: A landrace sled dog from the Kamchatka Peninsula in Siberia, bred for strength and endurance.
history_description: Developed by the indigenous peoples of the Kamchatka Peninsula for use in heavy sled hauling over long distances.
size_description: Large. Powerful build, built for endurance and cold weather.
coat_description: Very thick, long double coat. Colors vary widely.
temperament_description: Hard-working, hardy, and resilient. Can be independent but affectionate with their handlers.
lifestyle_description: Needs a cold climate and a lot of vigorous, purposeful work.
content: A crucial breed for transportation and survival in the harsh Siberian climate.

name: Kangal Shepherd Dog
description: A large, powerful livestock guardian dog from Turkey, known for its protective nature and speed.
history_description: Originating from the Sivas province of Turkey, used for centuries to guard flocks against predators like wolves and bears.
size_description: Giant. Males: 110–145 pounds, 30–32 inches tall. Very strong build.
coat_description: Short, dense double coat, typically a solid fawn or tan with a mandatory black mask.
temperament_description: Calm, reserved, and fiercely protective of its charges and territory. Independent and serious.
lifestyle_description: Requires a large working area (ranch/farm) and a purpose. Not suited for urban or small suburban homes.
content: Considered the national dog of Turkey.

name: Kanni
description: A rare sighthound from Tamil Nadu, India, bred for hunting deer and protecting the home.
history_description: Native to the Tamil Nadu region of India, historically favored by a particular tribal community for its loyalty and hunting prowess.
size_description: Medium/Large. Elegant, lean, and athletic build.
coat_description: Short, fine coat. Colors are usually black and tan, or solid fawn.
temperament_description: Extremely loyal and devoted to its family. Quiet, reserved, and protective. Can be shy with strangers.
lifestyle_description: Needs daily vigorous exercise (running). Requires a secure, spacious area.
content: The name Kanni translates to 'pure' in Tamil.

name: Karakachan
description: A large, ancient livestock guardian dog from Bulgaria.
history_description: Named after the Karakachan transhumant shepherds of the Balkan Mountains, used for guarding livestock for millennia.
coat_description: Long, thick, and harsh double coat. Colors are typically white with dark spots, or entirely dark.
temperament_description: Courageous, independent, and stubborn. Highly protective of its flock.
lifestyle_description: Best suited for working roles in rural areas. Needs space and a purpose.
content: One of the oldest European breeds, believed to be a descendant of the ancient dogs of Thrace.

name: Karelian Bear Dog
description: A fierce and powerful Finnish/Russian spitz-type dog, used for hunting large, aggressive game like bears and moose.
history_description: Originating from the Karelian region on the Finnish-Russian border, used historically by hunters to hold dangerous game until the hunter arrived.
coat_description: Thick, harsh, straight outer coat and dense, soft undercoat. Always black with white markings (usually on the chest, paws, and tail tip).
temperament_description: Bold, tenacious, and aggressive towards other animals. Extremely devoted to its owner but reserved with strangers.
lifestyle_description: Requires massive amounts of exercise and a challenging working role. Not a casual family pet.
activities_description: Bear/moose hunting, tracking, and protection work.
content: Renowned for its ability to silently locate and distract large predators.

name: Karelo-Finnish Laika
description: A small, energetic Russian hunting dog, closely related to the Finnish Spitz.
history_description: A landrace spitz from the Karelia region of Russia, utilized primarily for hunting forest game and birds.
size_description: Small/Medium. Height around 15–18 inches. Light and agile.
coat_description: Thick, harsh double coat, typically a red or deep red-fawn color.
temperament_description: Lively, alert, and a passionate hunter. Friendly with people but highly focused on prey.
lifestyle_description: Needs extensive daily exercise and a stimulating environment. Not ideal for urban life.
content: Bred for its distinctive, high-pitched barking used to indicate the location of game.

name: Kars
description: A large, rugged livestock guardian dog from the Kars province of eastern Turkey.
history_description: Indigenous to the Kars region, used by shepherds to protect sheep and goats from large predators.
size_description: Large/Giant. Very robust and muscular build.
coat_description: Thick, dense double coat, often black or very dark gray.
temperament_description: Independent, highly territorial, and suspicious of strangers. Courageous and loyal.
lifestyle_description: Requires a large, rural area and a specific working role. Not a typical companion animal.
content: Closely related to other Turkish shepherd dogs but distinct to the Kars region.

name: Karst Shepherd
description: A medium-sized, sturdy shepherd dog from Slovenia, used for guarding flocks and property.
history_description: Native to the Karst region of Slovenia, believed to be descended from ancient dogs brought by early settlers.
coat_description: Long, thick, and coarse double coat, always an iron-gray color.
temperament_description: Independent, brave, and reliable guard dog. Reserved with strangers but gentle with family.
lifestyle_description: Needs space and consistent socialization. Moderate to high exercise.
content: The breed's protective instincts are very strong.

name: Kazakh Tazy
description: A rare sighthound from Kazakhstan, valued for its speed and endurance in hunting.
history_description: An ancient sighthound breed from the steppes of Kazakhstan, used for hunting small game and occasionally wolves.
size_description: Medium/Large. Lean and elegant sighthound build.
coat_description: Short, fine coat; some variations have slightly longer hair (fringes) on the ears and tail. Colors vary.
temperament_description: Affectionate and gentle at home, but fierce and highly focused during the hunt.
lifestyle_description: Requires a large area to run and regular, intense exercise.
content: Highly prized by nomadic Kazakh hunters, often treated as a family member.

name: Keeshond
description: A medium-sized, fluffy spitz dog known for its 'spectacles' marking around the eyes and smiling expression.
history_description: Originated in the Netherlands as a barge dog and companion. Became a symbol of the Dutch Patriot movement in the 18th century.
size_description: Medium. Typically 17–20 inches tall, 35–45 pounds. Compact and well-balanced.
coat_description: Abundant, long, harsh straight outer coat and a very thick undercoat. Color is typically gray, black, and cream.
temperament_description: Extremely friendly, affectionate, and lively. Excellent family dog, often called the 'Velcro dog' due to its attachment to owners.
lifestyle_description: Good apartment dog, but requires daily moderate exercise. Needs consistent grooming.
content: Known as the 'Smiling Dutchman'.

name: Kerry Beagle
description: The oldest Irish hound, known for its stamina and deep voice in the hunt.
history_description: An ancient Irish breed, originating from the County Kerry region. Used historically for stag hunting.
size_description: Medium/Large. Strong, muscular build, slightly larger than the common Beagle.
coat_description: Short, smooth coat. Colors include black and tan, blue mottled and tan, or tricolor.
temperament_description: Hard-working, enthusiastic, and packs well with other dogs. Gentle at home.
lifestyle_description: Needs vast amounts of exercise and is best suited for country living or active hunting families.
content: Despite the name, it is a true hound and is not closely related to the modern Beagle.

name: Kerry Blue Terrier
description: An all-purpose Irish terrier known for its soft, blue-gray coat and robust build.
history_description: Developed in County Kerry, Ireland, to be a multi-purpose farm dog, used for hunting, retrieving, and herding.
size_description: Medium. Typically 17.5–19.5 inches tall, 33–40 pounds. Powerful and well-muscled.
coat_description: Soft, dense, and wavy coat that is non-shedding. Puppies are born black and gradually turn blue-gray.
temperament_description: Spirited, intelligent, and strong-willed. Needs consistent, firm training to manage its terrier temperament.
lifestyle_description: Requires moderate daily exercise and regular grooming (clipping and trimming).
activities_description: Obedience, earthdog trials, and general terrier work.
content: The blue color is considered its hallmark trait.

name: Khala
description: A primitive, indigenous dog of the Andean high plains of Argentina and Bolivia.
history_description: Believed to be a direct descendant of the pre-Columbian dogs of the Andes. Used by indigenous people for hunting and guarding.
size_description: Medium. Lean, athletic, and agile build.
coat_description: Two varieties: Hairless and Hairy (short-coated). Colors are variable.
temperament_description: Alert, independent, and hardy. Reserved with strangers.
lifestyle_description: Adapted to high-altitude and harsh conditions. Needs space to roam.
content: A very rare breed, mostly found in its native mountain range.

name: King Charles Spaniel
description: A very small toy spaniel with a domed head and flat face, originally favored by British royalty.
history_description: An old English breed popular with King Charles II, from whom the name is derived. It is the precursor to the Cavalier King Charles Spaniel (which is physically distinct).
coat_description: Long, silky, and straight coat with feathering. Four standard colors: Black and Tan, Tricolor, Blenheim (red and white), and Ruby (solid red).
temperament_description: Quiet, gentle, and affectionate lap dog. Known for being placid.
lifestyle_description: Ideal apartment dog. Low exercise needs, but sensitive to heat/cold due to the flat face.
content: Often confused with the Cavalier King Charles Spaniel, which has a longer muzzle and larger ears.

name: King Shepherd
description: A large American working dog, developed to be a massive version of the German Shepherd.
history_description: Developed in the U.S. in the 1990s by crossing German Shepherds with breeds like the Great Pyrenees and Alaskan Malamute to create a larger, calmer, and more robust dog.
size_description: Giant. Males can exceed 140 pounds. Very powerful and muscular.
coat_description: Can be rough (long-haired) or smooth (medium-haired). Colors: Sable, black/tan, black/red, or bi-color.
temperament_description: Intelligent, confident, and gentle. Protective of its family but generally calmer than a typical German Shepherd.
lifestyle_description: Needs substantial daily exercise and early socialization. Requires a dedicated owner.
activities_description: Guarding, tracking, carting, and police work.
content: A relatively new breed aimed at combining the intelligence of the German Shepherd with the size and calm nature of giant breeds.

name: Kintamani
description: An Indonesian landrace dog native to the island of Bali, known for its spitz-type appearance.
history_description: Originated in the mountainous region of Kintamani in Bali. Used as a versatile farm and companion dog.
coat_description: Thick, medium-length double coat, typically white, but also black, fawn, or brindle.
temperament_description: Agile, affectionate, and fiercely territorial. Known for liking to climb and sit on high places.
lifestyle_description: Needs space to roam and moderate daily exercise. Adaptable.
content: Recognized by the FCI as an indigenous breed of Indonesia.

name: Kishu
description: A medium-sized Japanese hunting dog known for its endurance and almost always white coat.
history_description: Native to the mountainous region of Kishu (Wakayama Prefecture) in Japan, used for hunting deer and boar.
size_description: Medium. Muscular and robust spitz build.
coat_description: Short, stiff double coat, usually pure white, but red or sesame were historically allowed.
temperament_description: Quiet, focused, and brave hunter. Extremely loyal and reserved with strangers.
lifestyle_description: Needs vigorous daily exercise and a working job or challenging activities. Prone to roaming.
content: Designated as a Natural Monument in Japan.

name: Kokoni
description: A small, ancient Greek companion dog known for its lively and affectionate nature.
history_description: A native Greek breed, depicted in ancient art, traditionally used as a house dog and companion.
size_description: Small. Typically under 15 pounds. Compact and sturdy.
coat_description: Medium-long, dense, and slightly wavy coat. Colors are varied (black, brown, white, patches).
temperament_description: Cheerful, intelligent, and highly adaptable. Very social and enjoys being part of the family.
lifestyle_description: Excellent apartment dog. Requires daily moderate walks and playtime.
activities_description: Companion and watchdog (due to being vocal).
content: The name 'Kokoni' loosely translates to 'little dog' in Greek.

name: Kombai
description: A powerful, indigenous Indian breed from Tamil Nadu, historically used for hunting and guarding.
history_description: Originating from the town of Kombai in South India. Known for its bravery in guarding the palaces of the Marava dynasty.
coat_description: Short, sleek, and single coat. Colors are typically red or brown with a black mask.
temperament_description: Fiercely protective, brave, and loyal. Highly dominant and requires experienced handling.
lifestyle_description: Needs significant exercise and socialization. Not suited for novice owners.
content: A traditional hunting and guard dog of the region.

name: Komondor
description: A large Hungarian livestock guardian dog recognizable by its distinctive, long, corded coat.
history_description: Brought to Hungary by the nomadic Cumans in the 13th century. Used to guard sheep and blend in with the flock.
size_description: Giant. Males: over 80 pounds, 27.5 inches tall. Very strong and heavy-boned.
coat_description: Unique, heavy, white corded coat that develops naturally. It requires specialized maintenance.
temperament_description: Brave, serious, and deeply devoted to its charges. Highly protective and independent.
lifestyle_description: Requires large space (ranch/farm) and a working role. Not suited for urban or suburban life.
content: The corded coat provides protection from the weather and predator bites.

name: Kooikerhondje
description: A small Dutch spaniel, originally bred to lure ducks into traps (kooien).
