description: A small, muscular toy dog known for its deeply wrinkled face, short muzzle, and curly tail.
history_description: An ancient Chinese breed, favored by the Emperors of China. Brought to Europe in the 16th century by Dutch traders.
size_description: Toy. Typically 14–18 pounds. Compact, muscular, and square.
coat_description: Short, smooth, and glossy coat. Colors: Fawn or Black, with a black mask.
temperament_description: Charming, playful, and mischievous. Affectionate and eager to please (clownish).
lifestyle_description: Ideal apartment dog. Low exercise needs, but highly sensitive to heat (flat face). Sheds heavily.
content: Known for its unique snoring and wheezing sounds.

name: Puli
description: A medium-sized Hungarian herding dog, famous for its dense, corded coat.
history_description: Brought to Hungary by the Magyars over 1,000 years ago. Used for herding and guarding livestock.
size_description: Medium. Typically 25–35 pounds. Compact and well-muscled.
coat_description: Unique, heavy, dense corded coat that develops naturally. Always black, rusty black, or white.
temperament_description: Intelligent, highly energetic, and agile. Devoted to family, can be reserved with strangers.
lifestyle_description: Needs daily vigorous exercise and a job to do (herding/agility). Requires specialized corded coat maintenance.
content: The corded coat provides insulation and protection from bites/weather.

name: Pumi
description: A lively Hungarian herding dog, known for its curly coat and semi-erect ears.
history_description: Developed in Hungary in the 17th-18th centuries by crossing the Puli with French and German herding dogs (likely Terriers). Used for herding sheep and cattle.
size_description: Medium. Typically 22–33 pounds. Compact and square.
coat_description: Wavy/curly, non-matting coat (not corded like the Puli). Colors: Gray, black, fawn, or white (no merle).
temperament_description: Highly intelligent, very energetic, and quick-moving. Needs constant mental and physical work.
lifestyle_description: Requires intensive daily exercise and a job (herding, agility). Not for sedentary owners.
content: Known for its distinctive 'alert' ear carriage.

name: Pungsan
description: A large, strong hunting dog from North Korea, known for its white coat.
history_description: A native, primitive breed from the mountainous Pungsan region of North Korea, historically used for hunting large animals like tigers and bears.
coat_description: Thick, double coat, almost always white or cream.
temperament_description: Intelligent, brave, and highly loyal. Can be aggressive toward other dogs.
lifestyle_description: Needs vast space and rigorous daily exercise. Best suited for cold climates.
content: A national dog of North Korea and rarely seen outside the peninsula.

name: Pyrenean Mastiff
description: A giant Spanish livestock guardian dog from the Pyrenees Mountains.
history_description: Native to the Aragonese Pyrenees in Spain. Used for centuries to guard sheep against wolves and bears.
size_description: Giant. One of the largest and heaviest breeds, often exceeding 150 pounds. Massive and powerful.
coat_description: Thick, medium-length double coat. Colors: White with dark (gray, fawn, or black) markings.
temperament_description: Calm, noble, and extremely protective. Gentle with family, but reserved/suspicious with strangers.
lifestyle_description: Requires a large rural area and a working role. Needs moderate exercise.
content: Known for its imposing size and calm demeanor.

name: Pyrenean Mountain Dog
description: A giant French livestock guardian dog, known for its majestic white coat.
history_description: Native to the French side of the Pyrenees Mountains. Used for centuries to guard sheep flocks.
size_description: Giant. Males: 100–120 pounds, 27–32 inches tall. Powerful and elegant.
coat_description: Thick, long, weather-resistant double coat, usually white or white with badger/gray/tan markings.
temperament_description: Calm, intelligent, and independent. Highly devoted and protective of family/flock.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate exercise and space. Prone to barking (due to guarding instinct).
activities_description: Livestock guarding, carting, and therapy work.
content: Known for its unique double dewclaws on the hind legs.

name: Pyrenean Sheepdog
description: A small, highly energetic French herding dog from the Pyrenees Mountains.
history_description: Native to the French Pyrenees, one of the oldest sheep herding breeds. Used for driving and protecting flocks.
size_description: Small/Medium. Typically 15–30 pounds. Lean and agile.
coat_description: Two types: Long-haired (long, shaggy) and Smooth-faced (shorter hair on the face). Colors: Fawn, black, gray, or blue merle.
temperament_description: Extremely intelligent, highly energetic, and tireless. Reserved with strangers and needs careful socialization.
lifestyle_description: Requires constant work or intense, sustained exercise. Not suited for sedentary owners.
content: A small dog with incredible stamina and work drive.

name: Rafeiro do Alentejo
description: A giant Portuguese livestock guardian dog, known for its heavy build.
history_description: Native to the Alentejo region of Portugal. Used to guard large flocks of sheep on the plains.
size_description: Giant. Very large, robust, and heavy-boned. Males often exceed 110 pounds.
coat_description: Short or medium-length, dense coat. Colors: Black, fawn, or wolf-gray, with or without white markings.
temperament_description: Calm, noble, and deeply independent. Highly protective and reserved with strangers.
lifestyle_description: Requires a working role and a large, rural space. Moderate exercise.
content: Known for its powerful voice and ability to patrol vast areas.

name: Rajapalayam
description: A large, sleek Indian sighthound from Tamil Nadu, known for its pure white coat.
history_description: A royal breed from the town of Rajapalayam, India, favored by the royal family and used for hunting boar and as a guard dog.
size_description: Large. Very lean, elegant, and athletic sighthound build.
coat_description: Short, fine, and glossy coat. Almost always pure white (though other colors exist).
temperament_description: Highly loyal and devoted to its owner. Reserved, independent, and a strong guard dog.
lifestyle_description: Needs a large, securely fenced area for running. Sensitive to cold.
content: Known as the 'Indian Ghost Hound' due to its white coat and silent gait.

name: Rampur Greyhound
description: A large, powerful Indian sighthound, known for its speed and courage in hunting.
history_description: Developed by the Nawab of Rampur (India) in the late 1800s by crossing various sighthound types. Used for hunting jackals and wild boar.
size_description: Large. Very muscular, slightly heavier than the standard Greyhound, built for endurance.
coat_description: Short, fine, and glossy coat. Colors: Mouse-gray, dark brindle, or fawn.
temperament_description: Brave, reserved, and highly intelligent. Fierce hunter but gentle with family.
lifestyle_description: Needs vast space and strenuous daily exercise. High prey drive.
content: Bred to withstand the harsh heat and terrain of the Indian plains.

name: Rastreador Brasileiro
description: A large Brazilian scenthound, known for its excellent nose and stamina in the hunt.
history_description: The only Brazilian dog breed recognized by the FCI (though recognition was withdrawn and restored). Used for hunting wild boar and jaguar.
size_description: Large. Robust and muscular scenthound build.
coat_description: Short, dense coat. Colors: White with patches (blue, black, red, or fawn).
temperament_description: Brave, energetic, and highly dedicated hunter. Excellent pack dog.
lifestyle_description: Needs vast space and strenuous daily exercise. Not suited for urban life.
content: Known for its powerful voice and determination on the trail.

name: Rat Terrier
description: A small, sturdy American terrier, known for its speed and effectiveness in killing rats and small vermin.
history_description: Developed in the U.S. by crossing various terriers (Fox, Manchester, Bull) with Whippets and Beagles. Popular on farms for pest control.
size_description: Small/Medium. Typically 10–25 pounds. Muscular and athletic.
coat_description: Short, smooth, and dense coat. Colors: Pied (large patches) with white, in various combinations (black, tan, red, blue, etc.).
temperament_description: Lively, curious, and highly energetic. Affectionate family dog but highly persistent on the hunt.
lifestyle_description: Good apartment dog if well-exercised. Needs moderate daily activity and mental stimulation.
content: An all-purpose farm and hunting terrier.

name: Ratonero Murciano
description: A small Spanish terrier from Murcia, used for ratting and vermin control.
history_description: A native, small terrier of the Murcia region of Spain, historically used for ratting and as a companion dog.
coat_description: Short, smooth coat. Colors: Typically black, brown, or tri-color.
temperament_description: Lively, intelligent, and highly alert. Affectionate and good companion.
lifestyle_description: Good apartment dog, moderate exercise needs. Strong hunting instinct.
content: One of the lesser-known Spanish terrier breeds.

name: Redbone Coonhound
description: A sleek, muscular American coonhound, known for its deep red coat and strong hunting drive.
history_description: Developed in the U.S. (Georgia) from Red Foxhounds and other hounds. Bred to hunt raccoons, bear, and mountain lions, often solo.
size_description: Large. Typically 45–70 pounds. Sleek, powerful, and athletic.
coat_description: Short, smooth, and dense coat. Always solid red (sometimes with a small amount of white on the chest/feet).
temperament_description: Intelligent, confident, and highly determined hunter. Affectionate and gentle with family.
lifestyle_description: Needs vast amounts of exercise and a working role (hunting). Prone to scent-driven wandering.
content: The only solid-colored coonhound breed.

name: Rhodesian Ridgeback
description: A large, powerful South African dog, known for the ridge of hair running backwards along its spine.
history_description: Originated in Southern Africa (Zimbabwe/Rhodesia). Bred by Boer farmers by crossing European dogs with the native Khoikhoi dog to hunt lions and other large game.
size_description: Large. Typically 70–85 pounds. Muscular, athletic, and noble.
coat_description: Short, dense, and sleek coat. Always features the distinctive ridge. Colors: Light wheaten to red wheaten.
temperament_description: Intelligent, strong-willed, and highly independent. Affectionate but reserved with strangers.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate to high daily exercise and a securely fenced area. Requires consistent, firm training.
content: The only breed to originate in Southern Africa.

name: Rize Koyun
description: A rare, local livestock guardian dog from the Rize province of Turkey.
history_description: An indigenous landrace dog of the Black Sea region of Turkey, used for guarding livestock in the high mountains.
coat_description: Thick, medium-length coat. Colors vary (often dark gray, black, or pied).
temperament_description: Independent, brave, and highly protective guard dog.
lifestyle_description: Requires a working role and extensive space.
content: A very rare, ancient Turkish shepherd dog type.

name: Romanian Mioritic Shepherd Dog
description: A large Romanian livestock guardian dog, known for its massive, shaggy coat.
history_description: Native to the Carpathian Mountains of Romania. Used for centuries to guard sheep flocks against wolves and bears.
size_description: Large. Males: 110–140 pounds. Massive, robust, and shaggy.
coat_description: Very long, dense, and shaggy coat. Colors: Typically white, gray, or white with fawn/gray patches.
temperament_description: Calm, intelligent, and fiercely protective. Independent and reserved with strangers.
lifestyle_description: Requires a working role and large, rural space. Needs regular grooming.
content: The name *Mioritic* comes from *mioara*, meaning 'ewe lamb.'

name: Romanian Raven Shepherd Dog
description: A large Romanian livestock guardian dog, known for its dark coat.
history_description: Native to the Southern Carpathian Mountains of Romania. Used for centuries to guard sheep flocks against predators.
coat_description: Thick, dense, medium-long coat. Always black (or very dark gray) with small white markings.
temperament_description: Calm, brave, and fiercely protective. Independent and a devoted guard dog.
lifestyle_description: Requires a working role and large, rural space. Needs moderate exercise.
content: The name refers to its predominant black coloration.

name: Rottweiler
description: A large, powerful German working dog, known for its strength, intelligence, and guarding instincts.
history_description: Descended from Roman drover dogs. Later developed in Rottweil, Germany, to drive cattle and pull butcher carts.
size_description: Large. Typically 85–130 pounds. Robust, muscular, and powerful.
coat_description: Short, coarse, and dense coat. Always black with clearly defined rust/mahogany tan markings.
temperament_description: Intelligent, brave, and deeply loyal. Can be aloof with strangers and requires strong, consistent training.
lifestyle_description: Needs daily vigorous exercise and mental stimulation. Requires experienced, firm handling.
activities_description: Guarding, police work, obedience, and carting.
content: One of the oldest herding breeds.

name: Rough Collie
description: A large, graceful Scottish herding dog, known for its intelligence and abundant, long coat.
history_description: Originated in Scotland, used for herding sheep. Gained worldwide fame through the *Lassie* books and movies.
size_description: Large. Typically 50–75 pounds. Elegant and noble.
coat_description: Long, harsh outer coat and a soft, dense undercoat (the 'rough' coat). Colors: Sable and white, blue merle, or tricolor.
temperament_description: Intelligent, gentle, and highly sensitive. Devoted family dog, good with children.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate daily exercise and companionship. Requires regular grooming.
content: Often known simply as 'Collie.'

name: Russian Spaniel
description: A medium-sized Russian gundog, a flushing and retrieving spaniel.
history_description: Developed in Russia in the early 20th century from various European spaniels (English Cocker, English Springer) to create a hardy hunting dog adapted to the Russian climate.
coat_description: Medium-long, wavy coat with feathering on the ears, legs, and tail. Colors: Solid (black, brown, red) or bi-color/tri-color.
temperament_description: Intelligent, enthusiastic, and highly energetic hunter. Affectionate and lively companion.
lifestyle_description: Needs extensive daily exercise, especially retrieving and field work. Loves water.
content: A versatile hunting breed developed for its endurance in tough terrain.

name: Russkiy Toy
description: A tiny Russian toy dog, known for its elegant build and lively temperament.
history_description: Originated in Russia in the 18th century as a companion dog for the Russian nobility. Almost vanished during the Soviet era.
size_description: Toy. Typically 3–6 pounds. Fine-boned and graceful.
coat_description: Two types: Smooth-coated (short) and Long-coated (with feathering on the ears and legs). Colors: Black and tan, red, or brown and tan.
temperament_description: Lively, cheerful, and highly affectionate. Fearless and curious.
lifestyle_description: Ideal apartment dog. Sensitive to cold; needs protection.
content: One of the smallest dog breeds in the world.

name: Russo-European Laika
description: A medium-sized Russian hunting spitz, used for hunting various game (squirrels to bears).
history_description: Developed in the European part of Russia in the 20th century by crossing local hunting spitzes. Used for hunting by treeing, cornering, or baying.
size_description: Medium. Muscular and robust spitz build.
coat_description: Thick, coarse double coat. Colors: Black and white (pied), or entirely black.
temperament_description: Intelligent, energetic, and highly focused hunter. Reserved with strangers but affectionate with family.
lifestyle_description: Needs vast amounts of daily exercise and a working job. Best suited for country life and cold climates.
content: A high-performing, versatile hunting spitz.

name: Ryukyu
description: A primitive, indigenous hunting dog from the Ryukyu Islands of Japan (Okinawa).
history_description: A native, primitive dog of the Ryukyu Islands, historically used for hunting boar.
coat_description: Short, dense coat. Colors: Red, black, or black and tan, often with a white bib.
temperament_description: Brave, determined hunter, and highly loyal. Reserved with strangers.
lifestyle_description: Needs significant daily exercise and a working role (hunting/hiking).
content: A very rare breed outside of its native islands.

name: S–Z
description: Divider for Breed list.

name: Saarloos Wolfdog
description: A large Dutch breed, a hybrid between a German Shepherd and a wolf, known for its wolf-like appearance and cautious temperament.
history_description: Developed in the Netherlands by Leendert Saarloos in the 1930s by crossing a German Shepherd with a European wolf to create a hardy, natural working dog.
size_description: Large. Athletic and distinctly wolf-like in appearance.
coat_description: Thick, double coat. Colors: Wolf-gray, brown (forest), or white.
temperament_description: Independent, intelligent, and highly cautious/reserved. Can be very shy and nervous. Needs extremely extensive socialization.
lifestyle_description: Requires significant space and highly experienced handling. Not suited for urban life or novice owners.
content: Retains much of the natural wariness of the wolf.

name: Sabueso Español
description: A medium-sized Spanish scenthound, known for its long, pendulous ears and excellent nose.
history_description: An ancient Spanish breed, used since the Middle Ages for hunting all types of game (hare, boar, deer) with its scent.
coat_description: Short, smooth, and dense coat. Colors: White with patches (typically orange, lemon, or red).
temperament_description: Calm, affectionate, and a determined hunter. Known for its strong baying voice.
lifestyle_description: Needs daily vigorous exercise and a working role. Prone to scent-driven wandering.
content: Known for its unique, melancholic expression.

name: Saint Miguel Cattle Dog
description: A medium-sized Portuguese herding and guarding dog from the Azores Islands.
history_description: Native to São Miguel Island in the Azores (Portugal). Used for driving and guarding cattle and as a general farm dog.
coat_description: Short, smooth coat. Always brindle (various shades) with white markings (chest, feet).
temperament_description: Intelligent, highly territorial, and naturally protective. Requires firm, consistent training.
lifestyle_description: Needs a job (herding/guarding) and extensive daily exercise. Not suited for apartment life.
content: Known for its strong, powerful head.

name: Saint-Usuge Spaniel
description: A rare French gundog, a flushing and retrieving spaniel.
history_description: Originated in the Bresse region of France (near Saint-Usuge). An old breed that nearly became extinct, recently revived for hunting waterfowl.
coat_description: Medium-long, dense coat with feathering. Colors: Brown roan, or brown with white patches.
temperament_description: Intelligent, enthusiastic, and highly affectionate. Reliable gundog and companion.
lifestyle_description: Needs extensive daily exercise, especially retrieving and water work. Loves water.
content: Known for its devotion to its family and excellent retrieving ability.

name: Sakhalin Husky
description: An extremely rare, traditional Japanese/Russian sled dog, now virtually extinct.
history_description: A landrace dog native to Sakhalin Island (Russia/Japan). Used by the Nivkh people for heavy sled hauling. Famous for a 1958 Antarctic expedition tragedy.
coat_description: Very thick, heavy double coat. Colors vary widely.
temperament_description: Hardy, resilient, and independent worker. Loyal to its team.
lifestyle_description: Requires cold climate and a working job.
content: One of the most genetically pure and oldest sled dog lines.

name: Saluki
description: An ancient, elegant sighthound from the Middle East, known for its grace and speed.
history_description: One of the oldest known dog breeds, dating back to 7,000 BC. Used by royalty and Bedouins for hunting gazelle and hare.
size_description: Large. Typically 40–60 pounds. Very lean, elegant, and graceful.
coat_description: Two types: Smooth (short) and Feathered (longer hair on ears, tail, and legs). Colors: All colors are permissible.
temperament_description: Reserved, independent, and dignified. Highly affectionate with family but aloof with strangers.
lifestyle_description: Needs daily sprinting exercise in a securely fenced area. Sensitive to cold.
content: Revered as 'The Royal Dog of Egypt.'

name: Samoyed
description: A medium-sized Russian spitz dog, known for its dense white coat and 'Sammy smile.'
history_description: Originated in Siberia, used by the nomadic Samoyedic peoples for herding reindeer, guarding, and pulling sleds.
size_description: Medium. Typically 35–65 pounds. Robust, muscular, and elegant.
coat_description: Thick, harsh outer coat and a soft, dense white undercoat. Always white (or biscuit/cream). Requires extensive grooming.
temperament_description: Friendly, playful, and affectionate. Highly intelligent but can be mischievous and prone to digging/wandering.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate to high daily exercise and mental stimulation. Sheds heavily and requires cold climate adaptation.
activities_description: Mushing, weight pulling, agility, and companion.
content: The 'Sammy smile' is a natural expression that prevents drooling/icicles in freezing weather.

name: Sapsali
description: A shaggy Korean dog breed, historically believed to ward off evil spirits.
history_description: An indigenous Korean breed, historically revered for its spiritual protective qualities. Nearly became extinct in the 20th century.
coat_description: Long, thick, and shaggy coat (often covering the eyes). Colors vary (black, gold, blue, gray).
temperament_description: Friendly, gentle, and playful. Loyal to family and highly intelligent.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate daily exercise. Requires regular grooming.
content: The name means 'ghost-hunting dog' in Korean.

name: Sarabi
description: A giant, powerful Iranian mastiff, known for its use as a livestock guardian dog.
history_description: An indigenous dog of the Sarab region of Iran (Iranian Azerbaijan). Used for centuries to guard livestock against bears and wolves.
size_description: Giant. Very massive, muscular, and imposing.
coat_description: Short, dense double coat. Colors are typically fawn, red, or gray (often with a black mask).
temperament_description: Brave, fiercely protective, and independent. Serious and aloof with strangers.
lifestyle_description: Requires a working role and extensive space; needs experienced handling.
content: One of the most powerful and enduring mastiff breeds in the Middle East.

name: Sarail Hound
description: A rare, primitive dog from Bangladesh, often used for guarding and hunting.
history_description: An indigenous dog of the Sarail region (Brahmanbaria District) of Bangladesh. Historically used for hunting and property guarding.
coat_description: Short, smooth coat. Colors vary (often black, fawn, or white).
temperament_description: Brave, intelligent, and highly territorial. Requires experienced handling.
lifestyle_description: Needs significant space and daily exercise.
content: A very rare, primitive dog breed, highly adapted to the local climate.

name: Sardinian Shepherd Dog
description: An indigenous Italian herding and guardian dog from the island of Sardinia.
history_description: Native to Sardinia, used for herding sheep and goats and guarding property.
size_description: Medium/Large. Robust and strong working build.
coat_description: Medium-long, thick, and slightly shaggy coat. Colors are typically black, gray, or fawn.
temperament_description: Intelligent, brave, and a reliable worker. Reserved and independent.
lifestyle_description: Needs a working role and extensive space/exercise.
content: Also known as the *Cane Fonnese*.

name: Šarplaninac
description: A large, ancient livestock guardian dog from the Šar Mountains of the Balkans.
history_description: Native to the Šar Mountains (North Macedonia, Albania, Kosovo). Used for centuries to guard flocks against wolves and bears.
size_description: Large. Males: 77–100 pounds. Robust, heavy-boned, and powerful.
coat_description: Long, very thick, and dense coat. Always solid colors: Iron gray, white, fawn, or sable.
temperament_description: Calm, serious, and fiercely protective. Independent and reserved with strangers.
lifestyle_description: Requires a working role and large, rural space. Needs moderate exercise.
content: Named after the Šar Mountains.

name: Schapendoes
description: A medium-sized Dutch herding dog, known for its shaggy coat and cheerful temperament.
history_description: Originated in the Netherlands. Used for herding sheep, particularly in marshy areas.
size_description: Medium. Typically 26–35 pounds. Agile and light-footed.
coat_description: Long, shaggy, dense, and slightly wavy coat. All colors are permissible, though blue-gray/black with white markings are common.
temperament_description: Intelligent, cheerful, and highly energetic. Eager to please and trainable.
lifestyle_description: Needs daily vigorous exercise and mental stimulation. Good family dog.
content: Known for its distinctive jumping and leaping ability.

name: Schillerstövare
description: A medium-sized Swedish scenthound, known for its striking black and tan coat.
history_description: Originated in Sweden in the 19th century. Developed for hunting fox and hare.
coat_description: Short, hard, and dense coat. Always black and tan (tricolor markings are common).
temperament_description: Energetic, enthusiastic hunter with great stamina. Affectionate and gentle at home.
lifestyle_description: Needs extensive daily exercise and is best suited for country life or active hunting families.
content: Named after its original developer, Per Olof Schiller.

name: Schipperke
description: A small Belgian herding/barge dog, known for its fox-like face and short, tailless body.
history_description: Originated in Belgium. Used as a barge watchdog and rat hunter in the canals and docks.
size_description: Small. Typically 10–16 pounds. Compact, sturdy, and tailless.
coat_description: Thick, harsh double coat with a heavy ruff around the neck. Always solid black.
temperament_description: Lively, curious, and fearless. Excellent watchdog (vocal) and highly independent.
lifestyle_description: Good apartment dog, requiring moderate daily exercise and mental stimulation. Prone to barking.
content: The name means 'little boatman' in Flemish.

name: Schweizer Laufhund
description: A medium-sized Swiss scenthound, known for its elegant build and four color varieties.
history_description: An ancient Swiss breed, used for hunting deer, wild boar, and hare. Exists in four color types (Berner, Jura, Lucerner, Schwyzer).
coat_description: Short, smooth coat. Colors vary by type: Black/tan/white, blue/mottled, red/white, or black/tan.
temperament_description: Energetic, enthusiastic hunter. Affectionate and good-natured with family.
lifestyle_description: Needs extensive daily exercise and is best suited for country life or active hunting families.
content: Also known as the Swiss Hound.

name: Schweizerischer Niederlaufhund
description: A small, low-legged Swiss scenthound, a smaller version of the Schweizer Laufhund.
history_description: Developed in Switzerland as a shorter-legged version of the Swiss Hound, used for hunting small game in dense brush.
coat_description: Short, smooth coat. Colors match the four types of the larger Swiss Hound.
temperament_description: Energetic, enthusiastic hunter. Affectionate and good-natured with family.
lifestyle_description: Needs extensive daily exercise and a secure area (high prey drive).
content: Also known as the Small Swiss Hound.

name: Scottish Deerhound
description: A large, stately Scottish sighthound, historically used for hunting the red deer.
history_description: An ancient Scottish breed, reserved for the nobility to hunt stag/red deer in the Highlands.
size_description: Giant. Males: 85–110 pounds, 30–32 inches tall. Elegant, tall, and greyhound-like.
coat_description: Wiry, harsh, and shaggy coat. Colors: Blue-gray, gray, or fawn (often with black points).
temperament_description: Gentle, noble, and dignified at home. Highly affectionate and calm. High prey drive in the field.
lifestyle_description: Needs daily sprinting exercise in a large, securely fenced area. Good house dog if exercised.
content: Known as the 'Royal Dog of Scotland.'

name: Scottish Terrier
description: A small, compact Scottish terrier, known for its short legs, sturdy build, and distinctive beard and eyebrows.
history_description: Originated in Scotland, used for hunting vermin in the Highlands (fox, badger, otter).
size_description: Small. Typically 18–22 pounds. Compact and muscular.
coat_description: Hard, wiry outer coat and soft, dense undercoat. Colors: Black, brindle, wheaten, or grizzle.
temperament_description: Independent, stubborn, and confident. Highly loyal to family but reserved with strangers.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate daily exercise and mental stimulation. Requires stripping/trimming grooming.
content: Known affectionately as 'Scottie.'

name: Sealyham Terrier
description: A small, sturdy Welsh terrier, known for its predominantly white coat and long-haired face.
history_description: Developed by Captain John Edwardes in Wales in the mid-19th century, used for hunting otter, badger, and fox.
size_description: Small. Typically 20–25 pounds. Sturdy and rectangular.
coat_description: Hard, wiry, medium-long coat. Always predominantly white with or without lemon, tan, or badger markings on the head and ears.
temperament_description: Brave, spirited, and comical. Affectionate family dog, but requires consistent training.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate daily exercise. Requires stripping/trimming grooming.
content: A very rare and critically endangered breed.

name: Segugio dell'Appennino
description: A medium-sized Italian scenthound from the Apennine Mountains, used for hunting hare.
history_description: An indigenous scenthound of the Apennine Mountains of Italy, used for hunting hare.
coat_description: Short, rough coat. Colors are typically fawn, red, or black and tan.
temperament_description: Energetic, reliable, and persistent hunter. Reserved but affectionate with family.
lifestyle_description: Needs extensive daily exercise and is best suited for country life or active hunting families.
content: Highly adapted to the mountainous terrain.

name: Segugio Italiano
description: An ancient Italian scenthound, known for its speed and endurance in hunting.
history_description: An ancient Italian breed, descended from the hounds of ancient Rome. Used for hunting hare and wild boar.
coat_description: Two types: Short-haired (Pelo Raso) and Rough-haired (Pelo Forte). Colors: Fawn (various shades) or black and tan.
temperament_description: Energetic, enthusiastic hunter with great stamina. Gentle and affectionate at home.
lifestyle_description: Needs vast amounts of exercise and is best suited for country life or active hunting families.
content: Known for its unique, bell-like voice.

name: Segugio Maremmano
description: A medium-sized Italian scenthound from the Maremma region, used for hunting wild boar.
history_description: An indigenous scenthound of the Maremma region of Tuscany, Italy. Used primarily for hunting wild boar.
coat_description: Two types: Short-haired (Pelo Raso) and Rough-haired (Pelo Forte). Colors: Brown or gray, often with a white blaze.
temperament_description: Brave, determined hunter. Loyal and affectionate with family.
lifestyle_description: Needs extensive daily exercise and a working role (hunting).
content: Highly prized in its native region for its wild boar hunting prowess.

name: Serbian Hound
description: A medium-sized Balkan scenthound, known for its reddish-tan coat.
history_description: Native to Serbia and the Balkan region. Used for hunting fox, hare, and wild boar.
coat_description: Short, dense, and glossy coat. Always a reddish-tan color with a black mantle (saddle).
temperament_description: Energetic, enthusiastic hunter. Affectionate and good-natured with family.
lifestyle_description: Needs extensive daily exercise and is best suited for country life or active hunting families.
content: Historically known as the Balkan Hound.

name: Serbian Tricolour Hound
description: A medium-sized Balkan scenthound, known for its tricolor coat.
history_description: Native to Serbia and the Balkan region. Used for hunting fox, hare, and wild boar.
coat_description: Short, dense, and glossy coat. Always tricolor (black, white, and tan).
temperament_description: Energetic, enthusiastic hunter. Affectionate and good-natured with family.
lifestyle_description: Needs extensive daily exercise and is best suited for country life or active hunting families.
content: A visually distinct variant of the Serbian Hound.

name: Serrano Bulldog
description: A large Brazilian working dog, used for cattle herding and guarding.
history_description: Originated in the southern mountainous region (Serra Gaúcha) of Brazil. Used for driving and guarding cattle.
coat_description: Short, smooth coat. Colors: Fawn, brindle, red, or white (often with patches).
temperament_description: Brave, determined, and highly protective. Intelligent and loyal.
lifestyle_description: Needs a job (herding/guarding) and extensive daily exercise. Not suited for apartment life.
content: A strong, utilitarian mastiff/bulldog type.

name: Shar Pei
description: A medium-sized Chinese dog, known for its characteristic loose, wrinkled skin, and blue-black tongue.
history_description: An ancient Chinese breed, dating back to the Han Dynasty. Used originally for hunting, herding, and fighting. Nearly extinct in the 20th century.
size_description: Medium. Typically 45–60 pounds. Compact and square.
coat_description: Very short, harsh, and bristly coat ('sandpaper' texture). All solid colors are acceptable.
temperament_description: Independent, reserved, and highly intelligent. Deeply loyal to family but aloof with strangers. Can be dominant.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate daily exercise and firm, consistent training/socialization. Prone to skin/eye issues.
content: The name means 'sand skin' in Cantonese.

name: Shetland Sheepdog
description: A small, highly intelligent herding dog, resembling a miniature Rough Collie, from the Shetland Islands.
history_description: Originated in the Shetland Islands of Scotland, used for herding small livestock and as a farm watchdog.
size_description: Small/Medium. Typically 14–20 pounds. Elegant and balanced.
coat_description: Long, thick, and harsh double coat (similar to a Collie). Colors: Sable, blue merle, or tricolor (all with white markings).
temperament_description: Extremely intelligent, highly sensitive, and eager to please. Affectionate but often reserved/shy with strangers.
lifestyle_description: Needs daily mental stimulation and moderate exercise. Excellent apartment dog if exercised. Sheds heavily.
content: Known affectionately as 'Sheltie.'

name: Shiba Inu
description: A small Japanese spitz dog, known for its fox-like face, curled tail, and strong will.
history_description: An ancient Japanese breed, the smallest of the six native Japanese spitz breeds. Used for hunting small game and birds in the mountains.
size_description: Small. Typically 17–23 pounds. Compact, muscular, and agile.
coat_description: Short, dense double coat. Colors: Red, black and tan, or sesame (all with 'urajiro' or creamy white markings).
temperament_description: Intelligent, independent, and confident. Can be reserved and sometimes aggressive toward other dogs. Known for the 'Shiba scream.'
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate daily exercise and a securely fenced area (prone to escaping/wandering). Requires firm training.
content: The name means 'brushwood dog' (referring to the brushwood where it hunted).

name: Shih Tzu
description: A small, sturdy Chinese toy dog, known for its long, flowing hair and underbite.
history_description: Originated in Tibet, later refined in China as a companion dog for the Imperial Court. Name means 'lion dog.'
size_description: Toy. Typically 9–16 pounds. Compact and solid.
coat_description: Long, dense, double coat. All colors are permissible. Requires daily, meticulous grooming.
temperament_description: Outgoing, affectionate, and lively. Can be stubborn but generally a happy companion.
lifestyle_description: Ideal apartment dog. Low exercise needs, but sensitive to heat (flat face). Needs constant grooming.
content: Its appearance is meant to resemble a lion (a sacred animal in Buddhist culture).

name: Shikoku
description: A medium-sized Japanese spitz dog, known for its wolf-like appearance and hunting ability.
history_description: Native to the island of Shikoku, Japan. Used for hunting wild boar in the rugged mountains.
size_description: Medium. Typically 35–55 pounds. Muscular and athletic.
coat_description: Short, harsh double coat. Colors: Sesame (red with black tips), red, or black and tan.
temperament_description: Intelligent, brave, and highly independent hunter. Loyal and reserved with strangers.
lifestyle_description: Needs daily vigorous exercise and a working role (hiking/hunting). Requires firm training.
content: Designated as a Natural Monument in Japan.

name: Shiloh Shepherd
description: A large American working dog, developed to be a massive, gentler version of the German Shepherd.
history_description: Developed in the U.S. in the 1970s from German Shepherds, with some Alaskan Malamute and other large-breed lineage, aiming for improved health and a calmer temperament.
size_description: Giant. Males can exceed 130 pounds. Large and robust.
coat_description: Can be smooth or plush (long-haired). Colors: Sable, black and tan, silver, or solid black.
temperament_description: Intelligent, calm, and gentle. Highly loyal and protective, but less hyperactive than a typical German Shepherd.
lifestyle_description: Needs substantial daily exercise and early socialization. Good family dog.
activities_description: Therapy work, search and rescue, and companion.
content: Bred primarily for its calm temperament and size.

name: Siberian Husky
description: A medium-sized working dog from Siberia, known for its endurance, speed, and beautiful coat/eyes.
history_description: Originated in Siberia, used by the Chukchi people for pulling light loads over vast distances at high speed.
size_description: Medium. Typically 35–60 pounds. Athletic and built for speed and endurance.
coat_description: Thick, soft double coat. All colors and markings are acceptable. Sheds heavily.
temperament_description: Friendly, outgoing, and adventurous. Highly independent and known for its high energy and tendency to howl/escape.
lifestyle_description: Needs vast amounts of exercise and a secure containment. Best suited for active, experienced owners.
content: Famous for their role in the 'Great Race of Mercy' to Nome, Alaska.

name: Silken Windhound
description: A small/medium American sighthound, known for its long, silky coat and speed.
history_description: A relatively new breed, developed in the U.S. in the 1980s by crossing Borzoi, Whippets, and Shetland Sheepdogs.
size_description: Medium. Typically 20–45 pounds. Elegant, lean, and athletic.
coat_description: Long, silky, single coat with feathering. All colors are permissible.
temperament_description: Gentle, affectionate, and calm indoors. High energy and speed outdoors. Excellent family companion.
lifestyle_description: Needs daily sprinting exercise in a securely fenced area. Good apartment dog if exercised.
content: Bred to be a smaller, long-haired sighthound.

name: Sinhala Hound
description: A primitive, indigenous dog from Sri Lanka, used for hunting and guarding.
history_description: A native, primitive landrace dog of Sri Lanka. Highly adapted to the local environment and historically used by the Sinhala people.
coat_description: Short, smooth coat. Colors vary (fawn, black, or red).
temperament_description: Hardy, intelligent, and independent. Resilient and reserved.
lifestyle_description: Requires space and moderate exercise. Highly adaptable to the tropical climate.
content: The indigenous dog breed of the island nation of Sri Lanka.

name: Skye Terrier
description: A long, low-to-the-ground Scottish terrier, known for its long, flowing coat.
history_description: Originated on the Isle of Skye, Scotland. Used for hunting otter, badger, and fox.
size_description: Medium. Typically 25–40 pounds. Very long body, short legs.
coat_description: Long, hard, straight outer coat and a soft, woolly undercoat. Colors: Black, gray, fawn, or cream.
temperament_description: Brave, devoted, and gentle with family. Can be stubborn and reserved with strangers.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate daily exercise. Requires regular grooming to prevent matting.
content: A critically endangered breed, noted for its loyalty.

name: Sloughi
description: A graceful, ancient sighthound from North Africa, used for hunting gazelle and desert game.
history_description: An ancient sighthound native to the Maghreb region (Morocco, Algeria, Tunisia). Used by Berber and nomadic tribes for hunting.
size_description: Large. Typically 35–50 pounds. Very lean, elegant, and athletic.
coat_description: Very short, fine coat. Colors: Sand, fawn, red, or brindle (often with a black mask).
temperament_description: Reserved, sensitive, and dignified. Highly affectionate with family but aloof with strangers.
lifestyle_description: Needs daily sprinting exercise in a securely fenced area. Sensitive to cold.
content: Known as the 'Arabian Greyhound.'

name: Slovak Rough-haired Pointer
description: A medium-sized Slovakian gundog, known for its rough coat and versatility.
history_description: Developed in Slovakia in the mid-20th century by crossing the Cesky Fousek (Bohemian Wirehaired Pointer) with other pointers. Used as an all-purpose gundog.
coat_description: Harsh, rough, wiry coat (shaggy). Colors: Gray or light brown/fawn, often with white markings.
temperament_description: Intelligent, enthusiastic, and eager to please. Highly reliable gundog and companion.
lifestyle_description: Needs extensive daily exercise and a working role (hunting). Loves water.
content: Known for its distinctive 'beard' and eyebrows.

name: Slovak Cuvac
description: A large Slovakian livestock guardian dog, known for its dense white coat.
history_description: Native to the Carpathian Mountains of Slovakia. Used for centuries to guard sheep against large predators.
size_description: Large. Typically 68–97 pounds. Robust and strong.
coat_description: Long, thick, and dense white coat. Requires moderate grooming.
temperament_description: Brave, intelligent, and fiercely protective. Independent and reserved with strangers.
lifestyle_description: Requires a working role and large, rural space. Needs moderate exercise.
content: Its white coat helped it blend in with the flock and distinguish it from predators.

name: Slovenský kopov
description: A medium-sized Slovakian scenthound, known for its dark coat and excellent hunting ability.
history_description: Native to Slovakia, used for hunting wild boar and other large game in mountainous forests.
coat_description: Short, dense, and close-lying coat. Always black with tan/brown markings (muzzle, chest, legs).
temperament_description: Energetic, brave, and a persistent hunter. Highly focused on scent.
lifestyle_description: Needs extensive daily exercise and is best suited for country life or active hunting families.
content: Known for its incredible determination in tracking wild boar.

name: Smaland Hound
description: A medium-sized Swedish scenthound, known for its black and tan coat and docked tail.
history_description: One of the oldest hound breeds in Sweden, developed for hunting fox and hare. Docking was traditional (though now often prohibited).
coat_description: Medium-length, rough coat. Always black and tan (sometimes with white markings).
temperament_description: Energetic, enthusiastic hunter. Affectionate and good-natured with family.
lifestyle_description: Needs extensive daily exercise and is best suited for country life or active hunting families.
content: The only Swedish hound to have a naturally short tail (though many have full tails today).

name: Small Međimurje Dog
description: A small Croatian herding and farm dog from the Međimurje region.
history_description: An indigenous, local dog of the Međimurje region of Croatia, used for herding and as a farm watchdog.
coat_description: Short, dense coat. Colors vary widely (often tricolor).
temperament_description: Intelligent, lively, and highly dedicated worker. Affectionate and alert.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate daily exercise and mental stimulation. Good farm dog.
content: A very rare local breed.

name: Small Münsterländer
description: A small German pointing-retrieving gundog, known for its versatility in the field.
history_description: Developed in the Münster region of Germany. A smaller version of the Large Münsterländer, used as an all-around gundog (pointing, tracking, retrieving).
size_description: Medium. Typically 33–55 pounds. Robust and muscular.
coat_description: Medium-long, dense, and slightly wavy coat with feathering. Colors: Brown and white (roan or patches).
temperament_description: Intelligent, enthusiastic, and eager to please. High energy and needs a job to be happy.
lifestyle_description: Needs daily vigorous exercise and thrives in the field or a large, active household. Loves water.
activities_description: Hunting (gundog work), tracking, and field trials.
content: Known for its excellent close-working ability.

name: Smithfield
description: An extinct type of British herding dog, a large, heavy-coated precursor to modern herding breeds.
history_description: Historically used in England, particularly in the Smithfield area of London, for driving cattle to market.
coat_description: Long, shaggy, and often blue-gray coat.
temperament_description: Hardy, strong worker.
lifestyle_description: Used primarily for heavy droving work.
content: Believed to be a major influence on the Old English Sheepdog and other early Collies.

name: Smooth Collie
description: A large, graceful Scottish herding dog, the short-coated variant of the Rough Collie.
history_description: Originated in Scotland, used for herding sheep. Identical to the Rough Collie in all aspects except coat length.
size_description: Large. Typically 50–75 pounds. Elegant and noble.
coat_description: Short, dense, and hard coat (the 'smooth' coat). Colors: Sable and white, blue merle, or tricolor.
temperament_description: Intelligent, gentle, and highly sensitive. Devoted family dog, good with children.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate daily exercise and companionship. Low maintenance grooming.
content: Known for its elegant outline and speed.

name: Smooth Fox Terrier
description: A medium-sized British terrier, known for its clean lines, speed, and energetic nature.
history_description: Originated in England, bred for flushing foxes out of their dens during hunts. One of the oldest terrier breeds.
size_description: Medium. Typically 15–18 pounds. Sturdy and elegant.
coat_description: Short, smooth, and hard coat. Always predominantly white with black or tan markings.
temperament_description: Intelligent, lively, and fearless. Highly devoted but needs constant mental stimulation and firm training.
lifestyle_description: Needs daily vigorous exercise and a secure yard (prone to digging/wandering).
content: Known for its classic, balanced terrier build.

name: Soft-coated Wheaten Terrier
description: A medium-sized Irish terrier, known for its soft, silky, wheaten-colored coat.
history_description: Originated in Ireland, an all-purpose farm dog used for herding, guarding, and hunting vermin.
size_description: Medium. Typically 30–40 pounds. Sturdy and square.
coat_description: Soft, silky, single coat (non-shedding). Always wheaten (various shades of golden tan). Requires regular grooming.
temperament_description: Lively, happy, and affectionate. Highly energetic and playful. Known for the 'Wheaten Greetin'' (leaping hello).
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate daily exercise and mental stimulation. Good family dog.
content: Less fiery than many terrier breeds.

name: South Russian Ovcharka
description: A large, fierce Russian livestock guardian dog, known for its massive, shaggy coat.
history_description: Originated in Southern Russia, used for guarding sheep flocks on the vast steppes against wolves.
size_description: Large. Males: 100–110 pounds. Massive and powerful.
coat_description: Very long, thick, and shaggy coat. Colors: White, gray, or fawn (often with dark patches).
temperament_description: Brave, fiercely protective, and highly independent. Requires very experienced handling and extensive socialization.
lifestyle_description: Requires a working role and large, rural space. Needs regular grooming.
content: Also known as the Ukrainian Shepherd Dog.

name: Spanish Mastiff
description: A giant Spanish livestock guardian dog, known for its massive size and loose skin.
history_description: An ancient Spanish breed, used for centuries to guard migratory sheep flocks against wolves. Native to Spain's mountainous and plains regions.
size_description: Giant. Males often exceed 140 pounds. Very massive, heavy-boned, and imposing.
coat_description: Medium-length, dense coat. Colors: Fawn, red, black, or wolf-gray (often with a black mask).
temperament_description: Calm, noble, and extremely protective. Gentle with family, but reserved/suspicious with strangers.
lifestyle_description: Requires a large rural area and a working role. Needs moderate exercise.
content: The largest and heaviest of the Spanish dog breeds.

name: Spanish Water Dog
description: A medium-sized Spanish herding/gundog, known for its unique corded or curly coat.
history_description: Originated in Spain, used as an all-purpose farm dog: herding sheep, assisting fishermen (retrieving), and guarding.
size_description: Medium. Typically 31–49 pounds. Robust and well-muscled.
coat_description: Wavy, curly, or naturally corded coat (must never be clipped short). Colors: Black, brown, beige, or white (often with bi-color patches).
temperament_description: Intelligent, highly energetic, and eager to please. Devoted to family and a tireless worker.
lifestyle_description: Needs daily vigorous exercise and mental stimulation. Loves water and retrieving.
activities_description: Herding, agility, retrieving, and water work.
content: Its coat is naturally adapted to resist wetness and heat.

name: Spino degli Iblei
description: An indigenous Italian livestock guardian dog from the Iblei Mountains of Sicily.
history_description: A local, primitive dog of the Iblei Mountains in Sicily. Used for guarding livestock and property.
size_description: Large. Robust and strong working build.
coat_description: Medium-long, harsh, and shaggy coat. Colors are typically fawn, black, or brindle.
temperament_description: Brave, determined, and independent guard dog.
lifestyle_description: Requires a working role and extensive space/exercise.
content: Very rare breed, primarily found in its native area.

name: Spinone Italiano
description: A large, sturdy Italian gundog, known for its rough coat and gentle nature.
history_description: An ancient Italian pointing dog, used for hunting game birds. Known for its methodical, slow point (Spino means 'thorn').
size_description: Large. Typically 65–85 pounds. Strong and robust.
coat_description: Thick, harsh, and wiry coat with a distinctive beard and eyebrows. Colors: White, white/orange, or brown roan.
temperament_description: Calm, patient, and highly affectionate. A dedicated hunter but a gentle family companion.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate daily exercise and mental stimulation. Loves water.
content: Known for its gentle, thoughtful expression.

name: Sporting Lucas Terrier
description: A small British terrier, an offshoot of the Lucas Terrier, bred for working ability.
history_description: Developed in the U.K. as a separate line from the Lucas Terrier, focusing on maintaining working characteristics and gameness.
coat_description: Medium-length, broken coat, often wheaten, black and tan, or grizzle.
temperament_description: Lively, courageous, and highly energetic. Affectionate but determined.
lifestyle_description: Needs daily vigorous exercise and a working job (ratting/earthdog).
content: A versatile small working terrier.

name: St. Bernard
description: A giant Swiss working dog, famous for its history of alpine rescue work.
history_description: Originated at the Great St. Bernard Pass hospice in the Swiss Alps, used by monks to find and rescue travelers lost in the snow.
size_description: Giant. Males: 140–180 pounds, 28–30 inches tall. Massive, muscular, and powerful.
coat_description: Two types: Short-haired (smooth) and Long-haired (long, dense). Colors: Red and white, or mahogany and white.
temperament_description: Gentle, patient, and amiable. Excellent family dog, especially good with children. Can be stubborn.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate daily exercise and ample space. Sensitive to heat and prone to drooling.
content: Known for its life-saving instincts in the snow.

name: St. Hubert Jura Hound
description: A medium-sized Swiss scenthound, a variant of the Schweizer Laufhund, known for its deep voice.
history_description: One of the four types of the Schweizer Laufhund, native to the Jura Mountains of Switzerland. Used for hunting large game.
coat_description: Short, smooth coat. Colors: Black and tan, often with white markings.
temperament_description: Energetic, enthusiastic hunter. Affectionate and good-natured with family.
lifestyle_description: Needs extensive daily exercise and is best suited for country life or active hunting families.
content: Known for its highly developed sense of smell.

name: Stabyhoun
description: A rare Dutch gundog, a versatile pointer, retriever, and companion.
history_description: Originated in the Friesland region of the Netherlands. Used as an all-purpose farm dog and gundog (pointing, retrieving, and pest control).
size_description: Medium. Typically 40–55 pounds. Balanced and muscular.
coat_description: Long, silky coat with feathering (never curly). Colors: Black and white, or brown and white.
temperament_description: Intelligent, eager to please, and highly trainable. Gentle family dog but needs a lot of work.
lifestyle_description: Needs daily vigorous exercise and mental stimulation. Good family dog if exercised.
content: One of the rarest dog breeds in the world.

name: Staffordshire Bull Terrier
description: A small, muscular British terrier, known for its intelligence, courage, and gentle nature towards people.
history_description: Developed in Staffordshire, England, in the 19th century by crossing Bulldogs with various terriers for dog fighting (now banned). Later bred as a companion dog.
size_description: Medium. Typically 24–38 pounds. Stocky, muscular, and powerful.
coat_description: Short, smooth, and dense coat. Colors: Red, fawn, white, black, blue, or brindle (with or without white).
temperament_description: Brave, highly intelligent, and extremely affectionate with people (known as the 'nanny dog'). Can be dog-aggressive.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate daily exercise and a securely fenced yard. Requires consistent socialization.
content: A popular family dog, highly noted for its reliable nature with children.

name: Standard Schnauzer
description: A medium-sized German working dog, the original of the three Schnauzer sizes, known for its beard and eyebrows.
history_description: Originated in Germany, used as a rat catcher and guard dog on farms and coaches. The oldest of the three Schnauzer types.
size_description: Medium. Typically 35–50 pounds. Sturdy, square, and robust.
coat_description: Hard, wiry outer coat and a dense undercoat. Colors: Salt and Pepper, or Solid Black.
temperament_description: Intelligent, energetic, and highly territorial. Devoted to family and an excellent watchdog.
lifestyle_description: Needs daily vigorous exercise and mental stimulation. Requires professional grooming (stripping/clipping).
activities_description: Obedience, agility, herding, and utility work.
content: The archetype for the Miniature and Giant Schnauzers.

name: Stephens Stock
description: A type of American treeing cur, used for hunting small game and raccoons.
history_description: Developed in the U.S. (Kentucky) by the Stephens family from various Cur dogs, specifically for treeing raccoons and squirrels.
coat_description: Short or medium-length coat. Colors: Blue or black, with brindle or tan markings.
temperament_description: Brave, highly energetic hunter. Loyal and devoted to its hunting partner.
lifestyle_description: Requires constant work or intense daily exercise. Best suited for country living.
content: A highly specialized working breed, primarily used by hunters.

name: Styrian Coarse-haired Hound
description: A medium-sized Austrian scenthound, known for its rough coat and deep voice.
history_description: Originated in Styria, Austria. Developed in the mid-19th century for hunting wild boar and deer in mountainous terrain.
coat_description: Rough, coarse, and wiry coat. Colors: Red, fawn, or yellow (often with white markings on the chest).
temperament_description: Brave, hardy, and a persistent hunter. Good-natured with family.
lifestyle_description: Needs extensive daily exercise and is best suited for country life or active hunting families.
content: Known for its endurance in tough, mountainous conditions.

name: Sussex Spaniel
description: A medium-sized British spaniel, known for its rich golden-liver coat and heavy, low-to-the-ground build.
history_description: Originated in Sussex, England, in the 18th century. Bred to be a slower, methodical flushing spaniel that could work in dense undergrowth.
size_description: Medium. Typically 35–45 pounds. Long body, short legs, heavy and muscular.
coat_description: Long, flat, and silky coat with profuse feathering. Always a rich golden-liver color.
temperament_description: Calm, gentle, and eager to please. Can be stubborn but affectionate. Known for its distinct, deep bark.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate daily exercise. Requires regular grooming.
content: A rare breed, the only spaniel named after its place of origin.

name: Swedish Lapphund
description: A medium-sized Swedish spitz dog, traditionally used by the Sami people for herding reindeer.
history_description: One of the oldest native Swedish breeds, used for centuries by the Sami people to herd reindeer and as a general farm dog.
size_description: Medium. Typically 33–45 pounds. Robust and sturdy.
coat_description: Thick, profuse double coat. Always solid black (or dark brown/grizzled black).
temperament_description: Intelligent, highly energetic, and eager to please. Devoted to family, can be vocal (barking).
lifestyle_description: Needs daily vigorous exercise and mental stimulation. Thrives in cold climates.
content: A true working dog, highly adapted to the cold environment.

name: Swedish Vallhund
description: A small Swedish herding dog, known for its wolf-like head and corgi-like body (a Nordic Corgi).
history_description: An ancient Swedish breed, dating back over 1,000 years, used for herding cattle (heeler) and eliminating vermin.
size_description: Small. Typically 20–35 pounds. Long body, short legs.
coat_description: Medium-length, harsh double coat. Colors: Gray, gray/brown, or red/fawn (often with a dark mask).
temperament_description: Intelligent, highly energetic, and eager to please. Can be prone to barking and nipping (due to herding instinct).
lifestyle_description: Needs daily vigorous exercise and mental stimulation. Good apartment dog if exercised.
content: The word 'vallhund' means 'herding dog.'

name: Taigan
description: A rare, long-haired sighthound from Kyrgyzstan, known for its use in hunting large game in the mountains.
history_description: An ancient sighthound native to the Tian Shan mountains of Kyrgyzstan. Used for hunting fox, marmot, and even wolf.
size_description: Large. Typically 55–62 pounds. Lean, powerful, and athletic.
coat_description: Medium-length, soft coat with long fringes (feathering) on the ears, tail, and legs. Colors vary (black, fawn, gray, or brindle).
temperament_description: Brave, independent, and highly determined hunter. Reserved with strangers.
lifestyle_description: Needs vast space and strenuous daily exercise. Adapted to high altitudes.
content: Known for its stamina in difficult, high-altitude terrain.

name: Taiwan Dog
description: A primitive, medium-sized indigenous dog of Taiwan, known for its triangular head and erect ears.
history_description: A native, primitive dog of Taiwan, descended from the dogs of ancient South Asian hunters. Used for hunting and guarding.
coat_description: Short, dense coat. Colors: Black, fawn, or brindle.
temperament_description: Intelligent, brave, and highly independent. Reserved with strangers and needs early socialization.
lifestyle_description: Needs daily vigorous exercise and mental stimulation. Best suited for experienced owners.
content: Highly adapted to the mountainous and dense forest regions of Taiwan.

name: Tamaskan Dog
description: A British-developed dog breed created to resemble a wolf, but with a gentle domestic temperament.
history_description: A relatively new breed, developed in Finland in the 1980s by crossing various northern spitz and husky-type dogs to achieve a wolf-like appearance.
size_description: Large. Athletic and distinctly wolf-like in appearance.
coat_description: Thick, double coat. Colors: Wolf-gray, black gray, or red gray.
temperament_description: Intelligent, friendly, and highly social. Can be prone to stubbornness and high energy.
lifestyle_description: Needs significant daily exercise and mental stimulation. Good family dog if exercised.
content: Bred purely for its appearance and gentle disposition.

name: Tang Dog
description: A name sometimes given to various indigenous, primitive dogs of China.
history_description: A general term referring to ancient dog types in China, believed to have existed since the Tang Dynasty.
size_description: Highly variable, usually medium to large.
coat_description: Highly variable.
temperament_description: Highly variable, often protective and independent.
lifestyle_description: Highly variable.
content: Not a single, recognized breed, but a historical reference.

name: Tarsus çatalburun
description: A rare Turkish pointing dog, known for its unique 'split nose' (bifurcated nose).
history_description: An indigenous pointing dog of the Tarsus region of Turkey. Used for hunting game birds.
coat_description: Short, dense coat. Colors vary (often black or brown with white markings).
temperament_description: Intelligent, enthusiastic, and highly persistent hunter. Affectionate companion.
lifestyle_description: Needs extensive daily exercise and a working role (hunting).
content: The name *çatalburun* means 'fork nose' in Turkish.

name: Tatra Shepherd Dog
description: A large Polish livestock guardian dog, known for its thick white coat.
history_description: Native to the Tatra Mountains of Poland. Used for centuries to guard sheep flocks against predators.
size_description: Large. Males: 110–130 pounds. Robust and powerful.
coat_description: Long, thick, and dense white coat. Requires moderate grooming.
temperament_description: Calm, intelligent, and fiercely protective. Independent and reserved with strangers.
lifestyle_description: Requires a working role and large, rural space. Needs moderate exercise.
content: Also known as the *Polski Owczarek Podhalański* (POP).

name: Teddy Roosevelt Terrier
description: A small, sturdy American terrier, a short-legged version of the Rat Terrier, named after President Theodore Roosevelt.
history_description: Developed in the U.S. from the common Rat Terrier lines. Bred to be a compact ratter and farm dog.
size_description: Small. Typically 8–18 pounds. Compact and muscular (low to the ground).
coat_description: Short, smooth, and dense coat. Colors: Pied (large patches) with white, in various combinations.
temperament_description: Lively, curious, and highly energetic. Affectionate family dog but highly persistent on the hunt.
lifestyle_description: Good apartment dog if well-exercised. Needs moderate daily activity and mental stimulation.
content: Named for President Roosevelt, who owned terriers of this type.

name: Telomian
description: A rare, primitive dog from Malaysia, known for its climbing ability.
history_description: A primitive dog native to Malaysia, living in isolated areas. Historically used for hunting and developed the ability to climb trees/ladders.
coat_description: Short, dense coat. Colors: Fawn, brown, or black (often with white markings).
temperament_description: Intelligent, independent, and highly agile. Reserved with strangers.
lifestyle_description: Needs space and mental stimulation. Highly adapted to climbing.
content: Known for its unique flexible forepaws, enabling it to grasp objects and climb.

name: Tenterfield Terrier
description: A small, smooth-coated Australian terrier, used for ratting and farm work.
history_description: Developed in Australia, especially around the town of Tenterfield (New South Wales), from the early English terriers brought over by settlers.
size_description: Small. Typically 8–13 pounds. Sturdy and compact.
coat_description: Short, smooth, and fine coat. Colors: Predominantly white with black, tan, or liver markings.
temperament_description: Lively, confident, and highly intelligent. Affectionate companion but a tireless ratter.
lifestyle_description: Good apartment dog if exercised. Needs daily mental stimulation and walks.
content: A versatile small working terrier.

name: Thai Bangkaew Dog
description: A medium-sized Thai spitz dog, known for its lion-like ruff and intelligence.
history_description: Originated in the Bangkaew village of Thailand. Believed to be a cross between a local dog and a wild jackal/dingo.
size_description: Medium. Typically 35–50 pounds. Robust and muscular.
coat_description: Long, thick double coat with a heavy ruff around the neck. Colors: White with patches of any color (often black, brown, or red).
temperament_description: Intelligent, fiercely loyal, and highly protective. Can be aggressive toward strangers and other dogs.
lifestyle_description: Needs daily vigorous exercise and early, extensive socialization. Requires firm handling.
content: Known for its strong one-person bond and high protective instinct.

name: Thai Ridgeback
description: A medium-sized Thai dog, distinguished by a ridge of hair running backwards along its spine.
history_description: An ancient, primitive breed native to Thailand. Used for guarding and hunting in remote areas.
size_description: Medium. Typically 35–75 pounds. Lean, athletic, and muscular.
coat_description: Very short, dense coat. Always features the distinctive ridge of hair. Colors: Black, blue, red, or fawn.
temperament_description: Intelligent, independent, and highly protective. Can be strong-willed and reserved with strangers.
lifestyle_description: Needs daily vigorous exercise and a secure containment. Requires firm, consistent training.
content: One of only three breeds in the world with a ridge of hair along the spine.

name: Tibetan Kyi Apso
description: A rare, local Tibetan dog, a variant of the Tibetan Terrier/Lhasa Apso type.
history_description: A local, indigenous dog of the Tibetan plateau, a companion and watchdog type.
coat_description: Long, shaggy coat. Colors vary (often black, gray, or multi-color).
temperament_description: Protective, intelligent, and reserved.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate exercise. Requires regular grooming.
content: A very rare breed outside of its native region.

name: Tibetan Mastiff
description: A massive, ancient working dog from the Himalayan mountains, known for its protective nature and lion-like mane.
history_description: Originated in Tibet, where they served as nomadic livestock guardians and protectors of monasteries. Believed to be the primary stock for most modern mastiff breeds.
size_description: Giant. Males typically 100–160+ lbs (45–72+ kg) and 26+ inches tall. They are heavy-boned and powerfully built.
coat_description: Extremely thick double coat, with a long, dense outer coat. Males often have a heavier mane around the neck. Colors include black, brown, gold, and blue, often with tan markings.
temperament_description: Noble, reserved, and extremely protective of their family and territory. They are independent and stubborn, requiring consistent training and early socialization. Known for being aloof with strangers.
lifestyle_description: Not suited for apartment living; needs a large, secured yard. They are nocturnal guardians, often barking at night. Requires moderate exercise but high-quality fencing.
activities_description: Guarding, estate protection, and mountain trekking.
content: One of the most expensive dogs in the world, symbolizing status and wealth in parts of Asia.

name: Tibetan Spaniel
description: A small, assertive, and cheerful companion dog, traditionally raised in Tibetan monasteries.
history_description: Bred by Buddhist monks and lamas in Tibet, they served as lookouts, sitting atop monastery walls. They are not true spaniels but share the name due to their size.
size_description: Small. Typically 9–15 pounds (4–7 kg) and about 10 inches tall.
coat_description: Silky double coat, medium length, with a mane around the neck (the 'lion's mane'). Colors include all shades: fawn, cream, red, black, and particolor.
temperament_description: Playful, highly intelligent, and affectionate with family, but reserved with strangers. They are natural watchdogs and will alert to anything unusual.
lifestyle_description: Excellent apartment dog, requires moderate daily exercise like a good walk. They are low-shedding but require regular brushing.
content: Known as 'Simis' in Tibet, meaning 'house dog' or 'indoor dog'.

name: Tibetan Terrier
description: A medium-sized, shaggy dog known as the 'Holy Dog of Tibet,' traditionally a family companion and good luck charm.
history_description: Highly valued in Tibet, they were never sold, only given as gifts of good fortune. Used as herders and watchdogs, despite their name, they are not true terriers.
size_description: Medium. Typically 20–24 pounds (9–11 kg) and 14–16 inches tall.
coat_description: Long, fine double coat, similar to human hair, that sheds little but requires intense grooming to prevent matting. Any color or combination is acceptable.
temperament_description: Agile, sensitive, and intelligent. They are devoted family dogs but tend to be wary of strangers. Highly adaptable.
lifestyle_description: Can adapt to apartment living if exercised daily. Needs regular, thorough grooming sessions (or professional clipping).
content: Their flat, round feet act like natural snowshoes, helping them navigate harsh Tibetan terrain.

name: Tonya Finosu
description: A rare, primitive dog breed originating from the Black Sea region of Turkey.
history_description: Native to the Tonya region, historically used as a shepherd and guard dog by local villagers.
size_description: Medium-sized primitive dog. Specific weight and height standards are variable but generally robust.
coat_description: Dense, double coat, often black or black and tan, adapted for the colder mountainous climate.
temperament_description: Hardy, loyal, and territorial, often reserved with outsiders. Highly protective of its flock or family.
lifestyle_description: Best suited for working roles or a rural environment with space. Requires moderate to high exercise.
content: Very little documented outside of its native Turkish region, making it a true landrace breed.

name: Tornjak
description: A large, strong livestock guardian dog native to Bosnia and Herzegovina and Croatia.
history_description: An ancient breed from the mountainous regions of central and southern Bosnia and Herzegovina and Croatia, used to protect flocks from wolves and bears.
size_description: Large/Giant. Males typically 110–130+ lbs (50–60+ kg) and 25–27 inches tall.
coat_description: Long, thick double coat, providing excellent protection against cold weather. Colors are usually white with distinct markings of black, brown, or red.
temperament_description: Calm, steady, and courageous. Highly independent when working, yet affectionate and gentle with its family.
lifestyle_description: Requires a job and a large, rural environment. Not suitable for city life. Needs space to patrol.
content: The name 'Tornjak' is derived from 'tor,' meaning a fenced-in pen for sheep.

name: Tosa
description: A massive, dignified Japanese breed, historically developed for dog fighting.
history_description: Originated in Tosa (now Kochi) province in Japan in the mid-19th century by cross-breeding the native Shikoku dog with European mastiffs, Bulldogs, and Great Danes.
size_description: Giant. Often 100–200 lbs (45–90 kg), though size standards vary by country (Japanese lines are typically smaller).
coat_description: Short, hard, and close coat. Colors are fawn, brindle, red, black, or yellow.
temperament_description: Patient, bold, and obedient. They are quiet and calm indoors but require an experienced handler due to their size and potential dominant nature.
lifestyle_description: Needs moderate exercise and extensive, early socialization. Due to their history, they may be banned in some countries.
content: Sometimes called the 'Japanese Mastiff' or 'Japanese Fighting Dog.'

name: Toy Fox Terrier
description: A small, spirited American dog, combining the loyalty of a toy dog with the tenacity of a terrier.
history_description: Developed in the United States in the early 20th century, primarily by crossing small Smooth Fox Terriers with Toy breeds like Miniature Pinschers and Chihuahuas.
size_description: Toy. Typically 3.5–7 pounds (1.5–3 kg) and 8.5–11.5 inches tall.
coat_description: Short, fine, and glossy coat. Tri-color (white, black, and tan) is the most common, or black and white.
temperament_description: Energetic, bold, and intelligent. They are true terriers—feisty and alert—but loving and cuddly companions.
lifestyle_description: Excellent apartment dogs, requiring regular playtime and short walks. Not suited for outdoor life in cold weather.
content: Known for their ability to perform tricks and often seen in circuses and performances.

name: Toy Manchester Terrier
description: A sleek, black and tan toy dog, refined from the standard Manchester Terrier.
history_description: A miniaturized version of the Standard Manchester Terrier, developed in England to be an excellent ratter and companion. The distinction between 'Toy' and 'Standard' is mainly size.
size_description: Toy. Must weigh under 12 pounds (5.4 kg). They are slender and elegant.
coat_description: Short, smooth, jet-black coat with rich mahogany tan markings. Requires minimal grooming.
temperament_description: Lively, sharp, and alert. They are devoted and sensitive to their owners but can be willful and require consistent training.
lifestyle_description: Good apartment dog, needs daily exercise and attention. Sensitive to cold temperatures.
activities_description: Obedience, agility, and earthdog trials (for Standard, though they have the instinct).
content: Known for their 'v' shaped ears and 'thumb print' markings above each eye.

name: Transylvanian Hound
description: A sturdy, medium-sized Hungarian scent hound used for tracking large game.
history_description: An ancient Hungarian breed used for hunting deer, wild boar, and bear in the Carpathian Mountains and the Transylvanian forests.
size_description: Medium/Large. Typically 70–85 lbs (32–38 kg) and 22–26 inches tall.
coat_description: Short, dense, and coarse double coat, usually black with tan points on the muzzle and legs.
temperament_description: Courageous, good-natured, and devoted to its hunting work. They are generally calm around the home but have high working drive.
lifestyle_description: Needs significant daily exercise and a large, secured area. Ideal for hunting or active country living.
content: The breed has two size varieties (long-legged and short-legged), although only the long-legged version is currently recognized by major kennel clubs.

name: Treeing Cur
description: A type of hunting dog, typically used to 'tree' game like raccoons and squirrels.
history_description: Developed in the United States, particularly in the South, as a utilitarian working dog for farm and hunting duties.
size_description: Medium. Highly variable, typically 40–60 lbs (18–27 kg).
coat_description: Short to medium length coat, color variable (brindle, black, yellow, etc.).
temperament_description: Intelligent, tenacious in the field, and loyal to its owner. High energy and strong prey drive.
lifestyle_description: Requires constant physical and mental stimulation; best suited for a working role or highly active owners.
content: The term 'Cur' refers to a type of working, mixed-breed farm dog, though some Curs have specific registry status.

name: Treeing Feist
description: A small, energetic dog native to the Southern United States, used for hunting small game.
history_description: A type of small hunting dog originating from the Appalachian and Ozark Mountains, historically used to hunt squirrels and similar small game by driving them up trees.
coat_description: Short, dense coat; colors are highly varied (often brindle, red, white and black).
temperament_description: Alert, curious, and fearless when hunting. Affectionate and manageable as a house pet but highly driven outdoors.
lifestyle_description: Needs a securely fenced yard and regular, vigorous exercise to satisfy its hunting instincts.
content: Their name 'Feist' comes from an Old English word meaning 'small, fierce dog.'

name: Treeing Tennessee Brindle
description: A rare breed of Cur/Feist known for its brindle coat and proficiency in 'treeing' game.
history_description: Developed in the U.S. (particularly Tennessee) from a line of brindle-colored Cur dogs selectively bred for superior hunting and treeing ability.
coat_description: Short, easy-care coat, always brindle (tiger-striped) with varying shades of red, yellow, or brown stripes on a lighter background.
temperament_description: Even-tempered, good with children, and highly intelligent. Extremely eager and focused when hunting.
lifestyle_description: Needs a job or high-intensity exercise daily. Not a sedentary dog.
