content: Recognized by the United Kennel Club (UKC) as a specialized hunting breed.

name: Treeing Walker Coonhound
description: A popular American coonhound, known for its speed, stamina, and distinctive high-pitched 'chop' bark when treeing.
history_description: Developed from the Walker Hound and selectively bred in the United States, named after its key proponent, Thomas Walker, and its treeing ability.
size_description: Large. Typically 50–70 pounds (23–32 kg) and 20–27 inches tall.
coat_description: Smooth, short, and glossy coat. Tri-color (white, black, and tan) is the most common pattern.
temperament_description: Intelligent, competitive, and very keen on the trail. Can be a loving, laid-back family dog when properly exercised.
lifestyle_description: Needs intense, prolonged daily exercise or a working role. Not suited for urban apartment life due to baying tendencies.
activities_description: Raccoon hunting, trailing, and competitive coonhound field events.
content: Known for their beautiful vocalizations, which are prized by hunters.

name: Trigg Hound
description: A subtype of the Foxhound, a swift and powerful American hunting dog.
history_description: Developed in Kentucky by Colonel Haiden C. Trigg in the late 19th century, selectively breeding for a faster, more courageous foxhound.
size_description: Large. Similar in size to a Foxhound, typically 50–60 lbs (23–27 kg).
coat_description: Short, hard, and smooth coat. Colors are variable, often black, tan, and white, or tri-color.
temperament_description: High-spirited, determined on the chase, and excellent stamina. Highly focused on scent.
lifestyle_description: Requires a large amount of space and daily rigorous running; best suited for hunting families or large ranches.
content: Known for their deep, sonorous bay when on the trail.

name: Tyrolean Hound
description: A medium-sized Austrian scent hound used for tracking injured game.
history_description: Originated in Tyrol, Austria, descending from the Celtic Hounds and developed for hunting hare and fox in the mountainous terrain.
coat_description: Dense double coat, coarse, and slightly rough. Colors are red, black and tan, or tri-color.
temperament_description: Keen, energetic, and intelligent. Very eager to work but docile and friendly with family.
lifestyle_description: Needs long daily walks and access to the outdoors. Best if given a tracking activity to perform.
content: Highly adapted to working in high altitudes and harsh weather conditions.

name: Valencian Terrier
description: A small, ratting terrier from the Valencia region of Spain.
history_description: Native to Spain, used primarily to control rat and vermin populations, especially in agricultural and port areas.
coat_description: Very short and smooth coat, usually white with black or brown markings.
temperament_description: Quick, energetic, and highly focused on vermin. Affectionate and playful with its family.
lifestyle_description: Good apartment dog if daily exercise and mental stimulation are provided. High prey drive.
content: Also known as 'Ratonero Valenciano.'

name: Vikhan
description: An ancient, heavy-coated livestock guardian dog from the mountains of Pakistan and Afghanistan.
history_description: A large, ancient war/guard dog of the mountainous region, used for protecting flocks and property.
coat_description: Very thick, long double coat, designed to withstand extreme cold. Colors are variable.
temperament_description: Fiercely protective, courageous, and independent. Requires extremely experienced handling.
lifestyle_description: Requires a working role and large, rugged territory. Not a pet for novice owners.
content: A powerful and imposing dog, highly valued for its guarding capabilities in its native lands.

name: Villano de Las Encartaciones
description: A muscular Spanish dog used for cattle herding and protection.
history_description: Native to the Encartaciones area of the Basque Country, historically used for managing large, semi-feral cattle (Monchina cattle).
coat_description: Short, smooth, and coarse coat. Fawn, red, or brindle colors.
temperament_description: Dominant, courageous, and serious when working, but loyal to its master.
lifestyle_description: Needs a clear working structure or highly intensive daily training and exercise.
content: A rare breed known for its exceptional herding grip and strong physique.

name: Villanuco de Las Encartaciones
description: A smaller, rare Spanish cattle dog breed, closely related to the Villano.
history_description: A dwarf mutation or smaller version of the Villano, developed for different types of farm work in the same Spanish region.
size_description: Medium. Significantly smaller than the Villano.
coat_description: Short, smooth coat; colors similar to the larger Villano.
temperament_description: Agile, determined, and intelligent. Easier to manage than the larger Villano.
lifestyle_description: Requires active daily work or training.
content: A distinct breed recognized in its native region, prized for its agility.

name: Vizsla
description: A medium-sized, elegant Hungarian hunting dog, known for its reddish-gold coat and versatile pointing and retrieving skills.
history_description: Originating in Hungary, used by Magyar tribes for hunting and retrieving for centuries. Known as the 'Velcro dog' due to its extreme need for physical contact with its owners.
size_description: Medium. Typically 45–65 pounds (20–30 kg) and 21–24 inches tall.
coat_description: Short, smooth, dense, and close-lying coat. Always a striking rust or golden rust color.
temperament_description: Highly affectionate, energetic, and sensitive. Needs extensive human companionship and can suffer from separation anxiety. Very intelligent and easy to train.
lifestyle_description: Requires extremely vigorous daily exercise (running/jogging) and mental stimulation. Not suited for sedentary owners.
activities_description: Hunting (pointing/retrieving), agility, field trials, and dog sports.
content: They are quiet hunters, working by sight and scent, and rarely bark.

name: Volkosob
description: A large, Soviet-era hybrid dog, a cross between a wolf and a dog, developed for guarding purposes.
history_description: Bred in Russia, specifically at the Perm Institute, for their extreme guarding instincts, combining the stamina and intelligence of a wolf with the trainability of a dog (usually Shepherd lines).
size_description: Large/Giant. Highly variable, often 90–130+ lbs (41–59+ kg).
coat_description: Dense, thick coat, often gray or wolf-sable colored.
temperament_description: Extremely dominant, intelligent, and fiercely protective. Requires expert handling and is not suitable as a family pet.
lifestyle_description: Used almost exclusively by Russian military and border patrol. Not suited for private ownership.
content: The name 'Volkosob' is a portmanteau of the Russian words for 'wolf' (Volk) and 'dog' (Sobaka).

name: Volpino Italiano
description: A small, spitz-type dog with a long, stand-off coat, essentially the Italian version of the Pomeranian.
history_description: An ancient Italian breed, descended from the European Spitz, found throughout Italy for centuries, used as a watchdog and companion, particularly by common people and farmers.
coat_description: Long, very dense, stiff coat that stands out from the body. Usually solid white, though red and black are also permitted.
temperament_description: Lively, cheerful, and highly attached to its owner. They are natural watchdogs and will bark readily.
lifestyle_description: Good apartment dog, needs regular daily walks and routine grooming to manage the coat.
content: Historically popular in Italian palaces and with commoners alike.

name: Weimaraner
description: A large, sleek German hunting dog known for its striking silver-gray coat and intense devotion to its family.
history_description: Developed in Weimar, Germany, in the early 19th century by the nobility to hunt large game, such as bear, deer, and boar. They were later refined for pointing and retrieving.
size_description: Large. Males typically 70–90 lbs (32–41 kg) and 25–27 inches tall.
coat_description: Short, smooth, and hard coat. Always a shade of silver-gray, often called the 'Gray Ghost.'
temperament_description: Intelligent, fearless, and extremely energetic. They require constant companionship and training. They are prone to separation anxiety.
lifestyle_description: Requires two hours or more of vigorous daily exercise (running/hiking). Not suited for apartment living or owners who are frequently away.
activities_description: Hunting, tracking, running, and all high-energy dog sports (agility, flyball).
content: Famous for their stunning light amber, blue-gray, or gray eyes.

name: Welsh Hound
description: A large, powerful scent hound from Wales, used for hunting fox and hare.
history_description: An ancient breed native to Wales, where it was developed for hunting in mountainous terrain, prized for its stamina and deep voice.
size_description: Large. Typically 55–75 pounds (25–34 kg). Taller and more lightly built than the English Foxhound.
coat_description: Harsh, dense coat, often rough, usually black, tan, and white (tri-color).
temperament_description: Strong pack instincts, dedicated on the scent, and robust. Docile at home but requires purpose.
lifestyle_description: Needs a rural environment with vast space and rigorous daily exercise. Should be kept in a securely fenced area due to scent drive.
activities_description: Hunting, scent work, and endurance running.
content: The breed nearly became extinct in the 20th century but has been revived by enthusiasts.

name: Welsh Sheepdog
description: A native Welsh herding dog, highly valued for its intelligence and wide-flanking style of herding.
history_description: An indigenous landrace breed of Wales, used for gathering sheep on the steep, rugged Welsh hillsides. They work independently, covering large distances.
size_description: Medium/Large. Highly variable, typically 35–50 pounds (16–23 kg).
coat_description: Medium-length coat, often black and white, tri-color, or sable and white. Can be smooth or semi-rough.
temperament_description: Highly intelligent, tireless, and sensitive. Primarily a working dog; requires a job or serious mental exercise.
lifestyle_description: Only suitable for working environments or extremely active owners experienced with working breeds. Not a typical family pet.
content: Unlike the Border Collie, the Welsh Sheepdog tends to herd using eye contact less and prefers to run wide around the flock.

name: Welsh Springer Spaniel
description: A medium-sized sporting dog from Wales, known for its handsome red and white coat and strong retrieving ability.
history_description: An ancient Welsh breed, used for 'springing' (flushing) game from cover. They are thought to be the ancestors of most modern spaniels.
size_description: Medium. Typically 35–55 pounds (16–25 kg) and 18–19 inches tall.
coat_description: Medium-length, straight, flat, and silky coat. Always rich red and white, with feathering on the legs, chest, and tail.
temperament_description: Affectionate, eager to please, and highly spirited. Generally friendly but can be reserved with strangers.
lifestyle_description: Needs significant daily exercise (running, swimming, or long walks). Requires moderate grooming.
activities_description: Hunting (flushing and retrieving), agility, and obedience.
content: A very old and distinct breed, predating many other spaniel types.

name: Welsh Terrier
description: A robust, medium-sized terrier from Wales, known for its black and tan wiry coat.
history_description: Native to Wales, used historically for hunting fox, badger, and otter. They share ancestry with the Lakeland Terrier.
size_description: Medium. Typically 20–22 pounds (9–10 kg) and about 15 inches tall.
coat_description: Hard, wiry, dense coat, black and tan. Requires hand-stripping or clipping to maintain texture.
temperament_description: Classic terrier temperament: bold, spirited, and playful. Affectionate with family but can be dominant towards other dogs.
lifestyle_description: Needs daily vigorous exercise and mental challenges to prevent boredom. High prey drive.
content: Known for their rectangular, 'brick-shaped' head and confident demeanor.

name: West Country Harrier
description: A smaller, regional variation of the Harrier hound, native to the West Country of England.
history_description: A specific bloodline of the Harrier, developed for hunting hare in the hilly terrain of the West Country (Devon and Cornwall).
size_description: Medium. Slightly smaller than a standard Harrier.
coat_description: Short, smooth, and dense coat. Tri-color (black, tan, and white) is typical.
temperament_description: Tenacious hunter, good pack mentality, and generally friendly.
lifestyle_description: Requires significant, continuous exercise and is best suited for pack or working environments.
content: This type is often considered a landrace or regional strain rather than a separate formal breed.

name: West Highland White Terrier
description: A small, sturdy Scottish terrier, famous for its brilliant white coat and cheerful, confident attitude.
history_description: Developed in the Scottish Highlands to hunt and kill vermin, particularly in rocky areas. The white coat was intentionally bred to distinguish it from the game.
size_description: Small. Typically 13–20 pounds (6–9 kg) and 10–11 inches tall.
coat_description: Double coat: hard, wiry outer coat and soft undercoat. Always pure white. Requires regular stripping or clipping.
temperament_description: Hardy, confident, and highly independent. Can be bold and will stand its ground, making it a good watchdog.
lifestyle_description: Good apartment dog if daily walks and playtime are provided. Prone to barking and digging.
content: Also known affectionately as 'Westies.'

name: West Siberian Laika
description: A medium-sized Russian hunting dog of the spitz type, known for its versatility in hunting all kinds of game.
history_description: A Russian aboriginal hunting dog, developed in the forest zones of Western Siberia. Used for hunting game from squirrels to bear.
coat_description: Thick, coarse double coat, adapted for extremely cold climates. Colors include gray, red, wolf-sable, and white.
temperament_description: Intelligent, highly energetic, and independent. They possess a strong hunting instinct and are generally reserved with strangers.
lifestyle_description: Needs immense daily exercise, preferably running in a large, secured area. Strong drive to roam and hunt.
content: Laikas are divided by the region in which they were developed, with this being one of the most common hunting Laikas.

name: Westphalian Dachsbracke
description: A small German hunting dog, a short-legged scent hound used for tracking.
history_description: Developed in Westphalia, Germany, as a smaller version of the Deutsche Bracke (German Hound), designed to track game in dense undergrowth.
coat_description: Short, dense, coarse coat, usually red, yellow, or black and tan with white markings.
temperament_description: Lively, bold, and highly persistent on a scent. Affectionate and gentle with its family.
lifestyle_description: Needs long daily walks and consistent scent-based work or training.
content: The name means 'Westphalian Dachshund-Hound' due to its short legs and hound body.

name: Wetterhoun
description: A rare, medium-sized Dutch water dog, known for its distinctive curly coat.
history_description: Originated in the Friesland province of the Netherlands, traditionally used for hunting otter and for general farm and watch duties.
coat_description: Thick, water-repellent, oily, and coarse curly coat (except on the head and legs, which are smooth). Colors are black or brown, often with white markings.
temperament_description: Reserved, protective, and independent. Highly devoted to family but not overly demonstrative. Strong drive to swim and retrieve.
lifestyle_description: Needs daily moderate to vigorous exercise, especially swimming. Requires experienced handling.
activities_description: Water retrieving, hunting, and utility work.
content: The name means 'Water Dog' in Frisian.

name: Whippet
description: A medium-sized sighthound, often called the 'poor man's racehorse,' known for its speed and sleek elegance.
history_description: Developed in England during the late 18th century by cross-breeding small Greyhounds with terriers. Used primarily for coursing rabbits and racing.
size_description: Medium. Typically 25–40 pounds (11–18 kg) and 18–22 inches tall.
coat_description: Short, fine, and close coat. All colors are acceptable.
temperament_description: Gentle, calm, and quiet indoors, highly athletic outdoors. Affectionate companion, but highly sensitive to sound and weather.
lifestyle_description: Needs a securely fenced area for daily sprints (they are fast!) but are excellent, quiet house dogs. Sensitive to cold.
activities_description: Racing (straight and oval track), lure coursing, and companionship.
content: They are famous for going from 'zero to 35 mph' very quickly but are couch potatoes inside the home.

name: White Shepherd
description: A white-coated version of the German Shepherd Dog, selectively bred for color and stable temperament.
history_description: Descended from white-coated German Shepherd Dogs. In the mid-20th century, the white coat was disqualified by the German Kennel Club, leading breeders to develop a separate, stable line, particularly in the US and Canada.
size_description: Large. Similar in size and structure to the German Shepherd.
coat_description: Medium-long double coat, always pure white. Can be straight or wavy.
temperament_description: Loyal, intelligent, and highly trainable. Generally less aggressive and more sensitive than some German Shepherd lines. Excellent family companion.
lifestyle_description: Requires significant daily exercise and mental stimulation. Needs strong human interaction.
activities_description: Obedience, agility, service dog work, and herding.
content: Often confused with the White Swiss Shepherd, but they are generally regarded as a separate development in the US/Canada.

name: White Swiss Shepherd Dog
description: A distinct breed of white German Shepherd ancestry, officially recognized by the FCI.
history_description: A breed based on the White German Shepherd line, which was banned in Germany. The breed was formally developed in Switzerland, leading to its current name and FCI recognition.
size_description: Large. Similar in size to the German Shepherd.
coat_description: Thick double coat, pure white. Can be medium or long-haired.
temperament_description: Friendly, social, intelligent, and less reserved than some colored GSDs. Highly devoted and trainable.
lifestyle_description: Needs rigorous daily exercise and is highly responsive to training. Excellent family dog if socialized early.
activities_description: Service dog work, herding, obedience, and tracking.
content: The 'White Swiss Shepherd Dog' is the official name recognized by most international kennel clubs.

name: Wire Fox Terrier
description: A medium-sized, lively terrier known for its dense, wiry coat and cheeky personality.
history_description: Developed in England in the 19th century to bolt fox from their dens. They are closely related to the Smooth Fox Terrier but have a distinct coat type.
size_description: Medium. Typically 15–20 pounds (7–9 kg) and about 15.5 inches tall.
coat_description: Hard, dense, and wiry coat that requires hand-stripping. Primarily white, with brown or black markings.
temperament_description: Extremely energetic, playful, and assertive. Highly intelligent but often mischievous and determined. Prone to digging and barking.
lifestyle_description: Requires rigorous daily exercise and a securely fenced yard (they are escape artists). Needs strong, consistent training.
content: Often seen in classic movies and art due to their striking appearance.

name: Wirehaired Pointing Griffon
description: A rough-coated pointing and retrieving gun dog, known for its distinctive shaggy appearance.
history_description: Created in the Netherlands and France in the late 19th century by Eduard Korthals, aiming to create the ultimate, versatile gun dog suitable for all types of terrain and game.
size_description: Medium/Large. Typically 50–70 pounds (23–32 kg) and 20–24 inches tall.
coat_description: Harsh, wiry, and bristly double coat, with a thick undercoat, designed for weather protection. Colors are steel gray with brown/chestnut markings.
temperament_description: Devoted, eager to please, and highly intelligent. They are excellent family dogs when off duty, but relentless hunters in the field.
lifestyle_description: Requires long daily exercise and thrives on hunting or field work. The coat needs regular brushing and stripping.
activities_description: Hunting (pointing/retrieving), field trials, and water work.
content: Known as the 'Korthals Griffon' in some regions.

name: Wirehaired Vizsla
description: A sturdy, more robust version of the Vizsla with a protective, wiry coat.
history_description: Developed in Hungary in the 1940s by crossing the Vizsla with the German Wirehaired Pointer to create a tougher, cold-weather-resistant hunting dog.
size_description: Medium/Large. Slightly heavier and bonier than the smooth Vizsla.
coat_description: Close-lying, strong, wiry, and dense coat, with a protective beard and eyebrows. Always rust-gold colored.
temperament_description: Similar to the Vizsla—affectionate, energetic, and intelligent—but generally calmer and slightly more robust.
lifestyle_description: Requires very high daily exercise and field work. Better suited for cold weather than the smooth Vizsla.
activities_description: Hunting (pointing/retrieving), field trials, and dog sports.
content: A distinct breed from the smooth Vizsla, prized for its ability to work in heavy cover and water.

name: Xiasi Dog
description: A rare, pure white Chinese hunting and guardian dog from Guizhou province.
history_description: Originates from the village of Xiasi, bred by the Miao people for centuries to hunt small game and guard the home. It is believed to bring wealth to the family.
coat_description: Short, stiff, pure white coat. Often has a distinctive reddish-pink skin tone visible beneath the coat.
temperament_description: Fierce and determined hunter, yet loyal and gentle with its family. Highly energetic.
lifestyle_description: Needs a rural setting and significant daily exercise. Not a low-maintenance pet.
content: The breed is currently threatened with extinction and is the subject of preservation efforts.

name: Xigou
description: A large, ancient Chinese sighthound used for coursing and hunting.
history_description: An ancient Chinese breed, possibly descended from dogs similar to the Saluki or Afghan Hound, used for hunting rabbit and deer.
size_description: Large. Elegant and slender, typical of a sighthound.
coat_description: Short or long-coated varieties exist; long coat is feathery. Colors are varied.
temperament_description: Independent, quiet, and gentle indoors, but possessing a high prey drive and speed outdoors.
lifestyle_description: Needs a secure area to run and regular exercise. Not suitable for off-leash walking in open areas due to its hunting drive.
content: A rare, primitive dog that is rarely seen outside of China.

name: Xoloitzcuintle
description: An ancient, hairless breed from Mexico, sometimes called the Mexican Hairless Dog.
history_description: Traces back over 3,000 years, revered by the Aztecs and other Mexican cultures, often believed to guide souls through the underworld. A hairless and a coated variety exist.
size_description: Three sizes: Toy, Miniature, and Standard, ranging from 10–55 pounds (4.5–25 kg).
coat_description: The hairless variety has smooth, tough skin (requires sun protection). The coated variety has a short, smooth coat. Colors: Black, gray, liver, or bronze.
temperament_description: Calm, quiet, and highly intelligent. They are extremely devoted to their family but reserved with strangers. Excellent watchdogs.
lifestyle_description: Good apartment dog, needs moderate daily exercise. Hairless variety requires skin care (sunscreen/moisturizer).
content: Named after the Aztec god Xolotl and the Aztec word for dog, 'Itzcuintli.'

name: Yakutian Laika
description: A medium-sized, cold-weather spitz dog from the Arctic regions of Russia, used for sledding and hunting.
history_description: An ancient breed originating in the Kolyma River region, used by the Yakuts (Sakha people) as a sled dog and hunter for centuries in the extreme cold.
coat_description: Very thick, long double coat, designed for Arctic conditions. Colors are white with markings of black, gray, or red.
temperament_description: Friendly, gentle, and highly energetic. They are excellent with people and highly adaptable to different tasks.
lifestyle_description: Requires immense daily exercise and is best suited for cold climates. High prey and wander drive.
content: Famous for their ability to withstand temperatures down to -50°C (-58°F).

name: Yorkshire Terrier
description: A small toy dog, known for its long, flowing, blue and tan coat and feisty 'terrier' personality.
history_description: Developed in Yorkshire, England, during the mid-19th century to catch rats in textile mills and mines. They are descended from various small terriers.
size_description: Toy. Must not exceed 7 pounds (3.2 kg).
coat_description: Long, silky, fine coat that grows continuously, similar to human hair. Colors are steel blue on the body and rich tan on the head and legs.
temperament_description: Bold, tenacious, and highly energetic despite their size. They are highly affectionate with family but often reserved with strangers.
lifestyle_description: Good apartment dog, needs daily walks and play. Requires intensive daily grooming or a short clip.
activities_description: Agility (small dog division), obedience, and companionship.
content: Their coats are non-shedding, making them popular for allergy sufferers, but require high maintenance.

name: Zerdava
description: A rare, small to medium-sized Turkish hunting dog, specifically a treeing dog.
history_description: A primitive, indigenous dog breed from the Black Sea region of Turkey, used for hunting wild boar, marten, and raccoon.
coat_description: Short, smooth coat. Colors are typically dark, often black with white or tan markings.
temperament_description: Extremely keen hunter, high prey drive, intelligent, and highly mobile. Reserved with outsiders.
lifestyle_description: Requires extensive daily exercise and a working role. Not suited for sedentary life.
content: A distinct type of small scent hound in Turkey, known for its focus on treeing game.
